story:
The Gingerbread Man Lives!

  • My name is Mike Hobbs. While I am a broker by day, by night the chef's hat comes out and I become Master Llewellyn ap Teirnon, and I love to cook!
  • Before the bottom fell out of the economy, I had a travelling spice shop called The Gingerbread Man selling spices, spice blends and cookbooks. I happily travelled all over the Midwest selling and had a great time doing it.
  • I specialize in organic and unusual spices and want to again travel the highways and byways to special events and farmers' markets. In addition, I want to write a cookbook based on my adventures interspersed with tales from my world famous collection of hilarious bad food stories that I have found throughout my travels.

What Am I Doing and How?

  • To this end, I am raising $7500. This will pay for supplies, printing, website setup, shipping, and licensing. As this process will take several months, I plan on going live on September 1.

  • To help raise funds, I am offering the following perks: fridge magnets, tshirts and fresh foccacia. If you are really good, a dinner for ten! They are described below.
  • If I do not reach my whole goal, I will still setup a website to sell spices and print the cookbook.

What Am I Trying To Do?

  • This business is intended on spreading the love of cooking and using organic and unusual spices. Recent events involving food contamination show why this is more important than ever. 
  • I intend on working with small farmers as much as possible as I believe in supporting other small businesses.
  • In addition, I want to build a business for when I retire and that I can pass on. It has always been my dream to again work with food.

If You Can't Donate, You Can:

  • I am looking for designs for fun, food oriented T-Shirts to sell. If you send a design that I use, you get one along with a "I'm Spicy!" T-Shirt for free!
  • Send me your favorite bad food tale for my book!
  • Buy off of me when the time is right!
  • Please spread the word to your friends by sharing my link!

Thanks,

Mike

story: We're raising money to help Atma from Bosnia and Herzegovina and Denis from Brazil to travel to India to go on the silent retreat with Ananta in Tiruvannamali in October. We'd also like to raise a bit extra to give some financial assistance to Priya and anyone else who needs support. Any help you can give will be much appreciated.

We'd also like to raise a bit extra to give some financial assistance to Priya and anyone else who needs support. Any help you can give will be much appreciated.

story:
The Saleyards Hotel, Rockhampton, Queensland

Thanks for stopping by!  We're so excited about our new adventure in Rockhampton and hope you can come along for the ride!

We've bought an iconic old pub, motel and restaurant in Rockhampton with the dream of bringing a small batch distillery to the region and create a great brand with distillers who are passionate about great quality spirits with innovative flavours, sourced locally.  

Our aim is bring the place back to life, provide a bar that's got something a little bit different, an inviting place for all, whether you be a local, a spirit aficionado, a tourist passing by, youngins looking for a night out or a family looking for a great place to eat. 

We're working with the local community to also provide a place where local musicians and artists can show their work and, when we've grown enough, we'll be providing jobs for the local economy, and top quality booze to everyone all over Australia and the world.

The building is a bit of a mess and we've got a lot of work to do.  To fund this exercise, we've decided to offer you the chance to be one of the first to taste our spirits at a bargain price, or perhaps you'd like to take on a more quirky sponsorship in the form of you or your company naming parts of the building; a must for those who want to have their name attached to something really special.

What We Need & What You Get

We're looking to fund the renovation to get us ready to go into production.  We're looking for at least $50,000 to get this done.

The rewards for sponsorship are below and will be delivered at various stages of the project.

When looking at the rewards involving the Rum, Whisky and Gin, think of it like pre-purchasing the first available batch of a great new product at a discount.  You'll love them as much as we do, we promise!

The Impact

The impact your sponsorship will bring will be massive to our little project and we will be forever grateful for your help!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially, but would still like to get the word out, share our campaign page and if the people you refer support the project, we'll even send you something special!  Read on for more details!

It is against the law to sell or supply alcohol to, or to obtain alcohol on behalf of, a person under the age of 18 years.

story:
OUR STORY

Across cultures. Across disciplines. Engaging thoughtful discussions within the community of artists, neighbors, anyone witnessing. Inspiring collaborations. Listening. Creating consciousness surrounding the beauty & insights from the creative process... 

Facilitated by award-winning performance artist Baraka de Soleil & co-facilitated by multidisciplinary artist Awilda Rodriguez Lora Re-Frame: A Gathering is a two-fold communal workshop  for artists at variant stages of creative development. We want to provide a sustainable space for active witnessing, supportive feedback  and rigorous crafting AND a laboratory for experimentation through interdisciplined explorations and cross-cultural discussions. Re-Frame: A Gathering focuses on the 'practice of process' - what is discovered in the act of making work is valuable and should be experienced as well, by other artists, by the larger community.

Baraka de Soleil and Awilda Rodriguez Lora initially met in Chicago. He was curating a unique multidisciplinary series “Studies n Black” for Links Hall and she produced an award-winning film STILL BLACK: a portrait of black transmen that premiered in Chicago. Since meeting, they have worked together on numerous creative endeavors including S’Kin Deep and most recently co-facilitated Agua/Tierra: A Listening Project in Panama in 2010.


Re-Frame: A Gathering is an initiative of D UNDERBELLY, a network of artists of color, seeking to create a  communal space for rigorous experimentation and investigation of an expansive performance aesthetic.  One that can serve as a model for creative process within community that can adapt and shift to various areas throughout the country &  internationally.   Through both invitation to select artists within the experimental art community and an open call, we will seek out a diverse group of 7 -10 with wide-range of disciplines who have a creative lineage (how they have been making work), a piece to 'excavate' and a desire to be part of a contemporary practice. Re-Frame: A Gathering will start with the artistic community of Chicago.


Our current vision:
The workshop process will begin in November with weekly Re-Frame sessions where Baraka will lead artists participants through a series of techniques in order to cultivate: communal consciousness around witnessing & offering feedback, excavation of themes/pieces brought by each individual artist and potential collaborative groupings. This leads to the beginning of December where Awilda will join the process as co-facilitator, to take artists through an intensive journey towards deepening the practice of the developing works.  Mid-December at A Gathering with the larger community, artist participants will share their developing work, engage in conversations and share food for thought and body!



Re-Frame: A Gathering' Key Objectives

To provide:

- a reduced cost or free opportunity for artist participants.

- a platform for creative process that can be molded to whatever communities it travels to....

- a unique opportunity for experimentation, to 'dig deep' & try things out with developing work or already-created work that may need ‘re-framing’.


To support:

- artists at whatever stage in their career.

- exchange and community building

- sustainability for the active creative process


To enhance:

- a multidisciplinary network of artists within the Chicago experimental aesthetic community and beyond.

- an expansive & diversified cross-pollination of collaborative possibilities.

- visibility for process-driven models with thoughtful intercultural community engagement.



Funds from this campaign will support the vision  in multiple ways beyond the costs associated with creating work.  We deeply believe that with your support, Re-Frame: A Gathering will impact not only the artist participants, facilitators and community of witnesses, but the larger discussion on the value of the creative process.

THE IMPACT


For Re-Frame: A Gathering, we are seeking to raise funds to support space rental costs, materials for the workshop process, honorarium for the artist participants and facilitators involved.

More specifically if we reach:

  • $1500, this amount will cover rental & production costs associated with the space; both for workshop process & performance showings
  • $2000, in addition to covering rental, will support any materials for the workshop process, 'bare-bones' production elements for the showing & travel for one artist facilitator
  • $3000, in addition to the above, secures a no cost opportunity for all artist participants and provide honorarium for both artist facilitators &
  • $4000, in addition the above funds, will provide  honorarium for each of the artist participant

In alignment with this campaign, we are working to ensure Re-Frame: A Gathering happens, even with the smallest of funds including:
  • soliciting in-kind contributions from organizations to reduce the cost for rental of space.
  • box office contributions from A Gathering's three showings.
  • barter/trade of services in order to promote/market the event.
  • based on amount raised, seek financial investments from artists who wish to participate in the process.
  • re-configuring the model so that it will reduce costs but still honor the artists & the process.
  • cooking meals that can be purchased at the showings.

THE EXCHANGE
We want to you to know that we value whichever amount you pledge. In exchange for your support, Baraka de Soleil, Awilda Rodriguez Lora, artists participants & D UNDERBELLY will acknowledge you through the program, online, via phone, with hand-made art, original designs, through complimentary tickets, invitations to A Gathering and future projects. You'll notice on our perks list what kind of acknowledgement each tier of funding support will garner.

Other Ways You Can Help

If in Chicago, come to A Gathering.  Join us for food, art, dialogue and community building....this will further support the artists & future opportunities for more gatherings...check out our site: http://reframeagathering.blogspot.com/  for the updates. Current dates  December 16th - 18th, 2011. A gathering will offer a unique experience with up to 3 different artists sharing their process each nite. 


Spread the word by putting this campaign on your facebook, twitter or other social network site.

Email blast your networks.   

And be part of the discussion: What has been meaningful to you as an artist in the creative process? 
http://reframeagathering.blogspot.com/2011/10/re-frame-gathering-discussion.html#comments
Whether you may consider yourself an artist or not, your thoughts will be appreciated and expand the discussion on why people should support the creative process of artists.

story:
Short Summary:

This house is a lovely place to host weddings or retreats, as well as fitness clinics.  There is rehearsal space and studio space in the basement.  Please help me keep it from foreclosure.

I conducted market research with event planners and wedding planners and 3 out of 4 are ready and willing to start booking the property. They said other single family homes are in high demand and booked solid through summer 2014 already.  

Work to be done:

It needs the decks replaced, landscaping, and work on the basement rooms and furnishings.  Other than that, it is ready to go.  However I have to pay the past due balance, the fees for a zoning adjustment, and the costs of outfitting it for private events.

Please help me turn this beautiful property into a venue for events that celebrate love and life. 

  • Why am I doing this?

Consolidated History, 2003 to present:

I bought this house in 2003; my husband and I were going to have children, which is why it had extra bedrooms and lots of space.  But over time it became apparent that we were not going to start a family.  

About the same time my mother became ill, in 2009, my ex found his groove in a new career and left me.  

My mother passed away on Halloween and my divorce became final within 30 days; two days before Thanksgiving.  

I found renters to supplement the costs, in February 2010, and they stayed for almost two years, but they caused so much damage, I used all my savings and credit to fix it, and then put it up for sale in an upside down market.  

I got an offer for a short sale.  It took a year for the bank to process it, but since the short sale fell through, just this past December, I thought, "maybe this happened for a reason" and scrambled to figure out how to keep the property from foreclosure.

I realized it would be a fantastic venue for weddings and retreats, maybe other events since it's only 20 minutes from Gunstock, Lake Winnipesaukee, 30 minutes from Laconia, and less than an hour from the White Mountains.  Everyone who has ever visited the place said, "You can't lose this house - why not rent it or set it up as a vacation rental" and those markets would not support it, but weddings and retreats will.

I only have about 30 days to make this happen or the bank will take it back. 

I don't want to be another casualty of the housing market.  I want to create a space where people celebrate their love.  A place where families gather to enjoy the outdoors. A place where people can relax and re-energize.  I survived so much loss, my mom, my marriage, my best friend, and my dog.

After surviving everything that has been happening I know that still having this property is a blessing I can't ignore.  For all the people who could benefit from it, I can't give up.

Seasonal Definitions:

  • Winter: Tuesday after Veteran's Day through the weekend before Valentine's Day;

  • Spring: Valentine's Day through Wednesday before Memorial Day;

  • Summer: Thursday before Memorial Day weekend through Tuesday after Labor Day weekend; and

  • Fall: Tuesday after Labor Day weekend through Tuesday after Veteran's Day weekend.

story:
What is a zero-waste store? 

Imagine a store with all the grocery products you need but none of the plastic packaging that those products normally come in. Zero-waste stores are food stores whereby customers bring in their own reusable containers (or buy reusable containers in the store), food is sold by weight and you can get as much or as little as you need. 

A zero-waste store aims to reduce waste by sourcing locally (to reduce the carbon footprint of the food), allowing you (the consumer) to buy just what you need (so if all you need is one cup of rice for the meal you are preparing tonight, you can buy one cup of rice) assisting people to waste less food, and NO plastic packaging! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise as much $ as we can through our Indiegogo campaign, while we are meeting and presenting our business plan to investors to raise the additional startup capital.

We have developed different perks for you, and we hope that you find something that you like and would want to donate towards.

Once the campaign is closed we will ship your products to you. 

 

Do zero-waste stores exist elsewhere? 

Bulk, refillable stores exist throughout the United States, Canada, Europe, Austrailia & Africa.

This concept is not entirely new, although new to Kansas City, check out just a few stores that exist today somewhere in the world. 

Canada: https://www.nadagrocery.com/

Australia: https://thesourcebulkfoods.com.au/

United Kingdom: http://thezerowasteshop.co.uk/

California: https://refillerydistrict.ca/

New York: https://www.precyclenyc.com/ 

South Africa: http://nudefoods.co.za/

 

Why no packaging? Just a few reasons .. 

Only 17% of plastic is recycled.

​All the plastic ever created still exists today.

​The average person eats 70,000 microplastics each year.

​Plastic is killing more than 1.1 million seabirds and animals every year.

 

Want to be an investor? 

If you love this concept, and would like to see this happen in Kansas City, you can be an investor. Contact marcelle@thepantryconcept.com 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends & family about us. Share our Facebook page.  

Come and shop at our store once we open! 

www.thepantryconcept.com

story:
Give the Gift of Healthy Food

A gift of just $25 dollars this holiday season can DOUBLE the fruits and vegetables purchased by one low-income family for an entire month.

Food brings people together, and Columbia Heights Community Marketplace works to ensure that all members of the community have access to fresh, healthy, locally grown food.

Donate now, and your tax-deductible gift will help make healthy food more affordable for low-income families at the Columbia Heights farmers market. It will also help locally owned businesses and small farms by keeping these funds in the local economy. 

When families shop at the market with Federal benefits like food stamps, our matching funds program doubles the amount they spend up to $10. That means:

  $5 in food stamps = $10 in fruits and vegetables

  $10 in food stamps = $20 in fruits and vegetables

Here's where your gift comes in: 

In order to help even more low-income families in 2015, we need to raise $7,500. This represents 1/3 of the total program cost, and your support is critical to our ability to sustain the program. We rely on individual donors and 100% of your donation will go directly to low-income families.

Thanks to your support last year, we distributed more matching funds in 2014 than ever before - but demand always exceeds our supply.

Every donation helps. Even if you can only give a little, please donate today.

Our gift to you:

Every donation of $25 or will get newly designed Columbia Heights farmers market merchandise, including t-shirts and bumper stickers! We'll have your gift waiting for you at the market.

Here's what our program participants say:

"The matching funds program helps us to eat healthily, to eat more vegetables, and to learn more about how to prepare vegetables.”

"The matching funds program is beautiful. It really helps senior citizens on a fixed income who have limited resources." 

"The matching funds program gives me more money to spend on good, healthy food for the kids."

More information:

Columbia Heights is one of the District's most socioeconomically diverse neighborhoods, and the Columbia Heights farmers market supports more low-income customers than any other market in the city.

In 2013, one in five dollars of the Women, Infants, and Children (WIC)  Farmers Market Nutrition Program spent in all of Washington, DC was spent at the Columbia Heights farmers market.

CHCM is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that operates one of the largest and most vibrant farmers markets in Washington, DC. CHCM is committed to increasing access to fresh, sustainably produced, local food and building a healthier community in the heart of the nation's capital.

Give the Gift of Healthy Food
 
A gift of just $25 dollars this holiday season can DOUBLE the fruits and vegetables purchased by one low-income family for an entire month.
Food brings people together, and Columbia Heights Community Marketplace works to ensure that all members of
      the community have access to fresh, healthy, locally grown food. 


Donate now, and your tax-deductible gift will help make
healthy food more affordable for low-income families at the Columbia Heights farmers market. It
will also help locally owned businesses and small farms by keeping these funds
in the local economy.  
When families shop
at the market with Federal benefits like food stamps, our matching funds program doubles the

story:
Mason Surf Designs

My name is Drew Mason and I created Mason Surf Designs to build top quality handcrafted surfboards heavily influenced by 1950s, 60s, and 70s style designs. In today's market, the three main U.S. manufacturers in the surfing industry produce computer generated, cookie-cutter boards that seriously limit a consumers customization options. Surfing and board building heritage has always been based upon the Shaper + Surfer relationship; building a board by hand for the individual, not producing a generic board for the masses. I've been shaping boards for 10 years, and surfing for 20. From the first time I rode a board at the age of 9, surfing and the surfing community have played a major role in my life.  My goal is to share that experience through my designs and make boards that continue and strengthen the tradition of Shaper + Surfer + Community.  And since surfing is a lifestyle in addition to being a sport, I want Mason Surf Designs to be a lifestyle brand and offer all the necessary clothing, accessories, and home goods for the surfing consumer to live a happy and full life.  With your help and support, I can achieve that goal.
MasonSurfDesigns.com

What We Need & How It Helps

Since starting Mason Surf Designs in 2012, I’ve struggled to design, shape, finish and sell my boards without the benefit of a consistent and dedicated workplace. For those unfamiliar with the process of making a surfboard, it begins by ordering a blank (unshaped surfboard block of foam), shaping the blank into the final surfboard shape based off of various templates, fiberglassing the board (to waterproof the foam and give strength), and then marketing and locating a customer. The total time it takes for a board to be made is about 6­-8 weeks. Without a shop or space of my own, I'm currently using four different locations to get the board from rough to finished.  The risk of the board getting damaged in transit is fairly high and, once finished, I don't have an easy way to market it and attract customers.

Why I need your help

My biggest business challenge is not having a shop. I need a space with a shaping bay in the back to make boards and a small store­front for products. Your contribution will give Mason Surf Designs a face; a physical address where anyone can come and be a part of the craftsmanship and community that are unique to surfing. The $50,000 goal of my campaign will allow me to find and lease space for a shop, establish a shaping bay and storefront, and stock it with my hand-crafted boards, as well as surf-related clothing and accessories.

                                                                                 (Some of my boards at Waterman's Guild)

What's In It For You?

While this campaign is geared towards opening a shop, once established, a part of every sale will be donated to non­profits like Surfrider Foundation and to sponsor kids to attend summer camps like surf camp or junior lifeguards. By helping me, we help each other, bringing community together. You will be aiding in community awareness and solidarity, and you will also receive Perks for your support!

Other Ways You Can Help

The biggest challenge in meeting or exceeding my goal is getting the word out to enough potential supporters. In order for social media to be effective, it requires a network of family, friends and community.  Word of mouth and personal relationships can also play a significant role in making my campaign a success.  Please help and share this campaign with everyone you know.  Click on the links below to share on your social media boards.  Send a link via e-mail to friends.  Talk to people you meet and help spread the word about my campaign.

I have the experience, craftsmanship and knowledge to do the job. With your help, I can open my Mason Surf Designs shop and achieve my vision of Shaper + Surfer + Community.

Stretch Goal #1 - $70,000

The second most important asset after acquiring a shop is purchasing a shop van. Getting blanks, moving boards, and shipping product will be easier and more efficient with a Mason Surf Designs cargo van.

Stretch Goal #2 - $100,000

Finally, surfing isn't all about being in the ocean, it's a lifestyle. Sandals, boots, candles, wallets, shaving goods, denim... all contribute to this lifestyle. I'd like to be able to offer the best products available for men, women, and home from quality makers. If I reach this goal, I will be able to supply essentials for everyday life, in and out of the water.

story:
One Stop Shop (Dec. 6, 2014)

OSS is an event jointly sponsored by the Redford Aldersgate United Methodist Church - Brightmoor Campus and The Detroit Partnership at U of M. It provides underprivileged families in the Brightmoor neighborhood with these much-needed resources:
  • Clothing
  • Children's toys
  • Groceries
  • Home appliances
  • A community meal
  • Information about community programs
Last year, we were able to welcome 400+ families into our doors and provide them with some of the resources mentioned above.

What We Need

Specifically, your monetary donations will help us purchase:

  • Small kitchen appliances (toasters, coffee makers, microwaves, etc.)
  • Children's toys
These are two areas where physical donations typically do not provide us with enough to help out all who attend the event.

      Other Ways You Can Help 

      If you are unable to contribute at this time, consider these ways to stay involved:

      • Spread the word to other people you know
      • Keep an eye out for upcoming events from the church's community initiative Read Seed Feed
      • Stay up to date on Detroit Partnership news

      Thank you!

story:
About the Event 

On June 18th, Free Body Project and the Martha Graham School of Contemporary Dance are bringing together thought leaders and social change makers from India, Canada, and the United States at the Martha Graham Center of Contemporary Dance in New York City for an inspiring panel event. 

You are invited! Admission is free and open to all. Any donations made at the event will go directly to support the organizations represented by the panelists. 

To learn more and to register for the event, visit www.freebodypanel.com.  

Through an engaging discussion with six practitioners supporting the use of dance as healing and empowerment for survivors of trauma and violence, we will 

  • more deeply understand how dance positively benefits the physical, cognitive, social, and emotional skills of individuals. 
  • discuss how dance and movement can be more widely utilized in international development and peace building initiatives. 
  • engage with the question of how more dancers can use their skill to become involved to perpetuate positive change. 

This is an important step in building a thriving and cohesive network of global dance activists. 


How You Can Help  

Free Body Project will be flying in two inspired change makers to speak at the panel event in New York; 

Sohini Chakraborty, an Ashoka Fellow and social entrepreneur from Kolkata, India. She is the Founder Director of Kolkata Sanved, an NGO using dance and Dance Movement Therapy to transform the lives of survivors of sex trafficking and violence. Learn more: Kolkata Sanved.

Carrie MacLeod, the Research Director for the Dancing at the Crossroads conflict transformation and dance project at the University of British Columbia. Learn more: Dancing at the Crossroads. 

Your help will allow us to purchase two plane tickets to bring the panelists to the Embodied Empowerment panel event: one round trip ticket from Kolkata, India to NYC and one round trip ticket from Vancouver, British Columbia to NYC. Additional funding will cover expenses for the event including printing and equipment.


The Impact and the Incredible Panelists

Dance presents a powerful lens through which to approach social change as well as healing and empowerment for survivors of trauma and violence. However, practitioners of this work are scattered across the globe; the Embodied Empowerment panel event looks to harness this power by brining together leaders in this unique and emerging field in New York. 

During the event, highly experienced and passionate panelists will help us explore why dance and movement are such powerful tools through the lenses of psychology, neuroscience, trauma theory, conflictresolution, performance, and human rights.

Sohini Chakraborty: Founder Director of Kolkata Sanved, an NGO based in Kolkata, India using dance as psychosocial rehabilitation for survivors of human trafficking and violence in India and across South Asia. Kolkata Sanved has directly served over 7,000 participants in partnership with over 30 partner organizations in India and across South Asia. 

Yasemin Ozumerzifon: Manager of the Community Action program at Gibney Dance working with survivors of domestic violence in New York.

Carrie MacLeod: Research Director of Dancing at the Crossroads Conflict Transformation Project at the University of British Columbia and co-author of a recent book, the Choreography of Resolution, on dance, conflict resolution, and neuroscience.

Alison Gardy: Director of International Relations at the 92nd Street Y.

Edward Henkel: Associate Director of the 92nd Street Y Harkness Dance Center, former professional dancer, teacher, and choreographer, and the creator of MovementTalks, an ongoing series exploring dance as a catalyst for change.

Beth Silverman-Yam: Adjunct Associate Professor at Columbia University teaching a course on domestic violence. Director of Clinical Programs at Sanctuary for Families from 1994-2014 and a social work clinician, program developer and administrator for more than 40 years.


Special Perks from Kolkata, India 

We believe in supporting the awesome work of organizations empowering survivors of trauma and violence and helping local communities. The thank you cards you will receive have been purchased at a special shop in Kolkata where all of the proceeds go to support individuals living with disabilities. The special edition Move for Freedom t-shirts as well as the Move for Freedom tote bags have been made by Freeset, a fair trade business in Kolkata offering employment to women once trapped in Kolkata's sex trade. Their products are made with fair trade, organic cotton but their main goal is to empower women through economic opportunity and freedom from trafficking; they also offer literacy classes, child care and other services to support their employees. The hand loom scarves are made in India from locally sourced cotton. The notebooks have been created by (and directly support) the Kolkata-based Anjali Mental Health Rights Organization which focuses on independence, self determination, and social inclusion of people with mental health conditions institutionalized and abandoned. 


Gratitude 

We are so grateful for your support! Thank you for taking the time to learn more about the amazing work individuals are doing across the globe, impacting lives through dance. You are an integral part of this growing community. 


About Free Body Project 

Free Body Project began in Portland, Oregon as a way to raise local awareness of domestic sex trafficking and gender violence using dance as advocacy. The project was initially composed of a city-wide dance and awareness raising campaign that mobilized over 100 local dancers to perform in various public spaces, a weekly movement class for survivors, and the creation of a short, experimental dance documentary film. The Free Body Film was created as a statement of solidarity between dancers and anti-trafficking activists in Portland, Oregon and the dancers and activists of Kolkata Sanved working in Kolkata, India. The film was an Official Selection at the Portland Oregon Women's Film Festival (POW Fest) in 2015 and has been screened internationally. 

Free Body Project will expand through the creation of a second dance film to be made in 2015 in collaboration with the dancers of Kolkata Sanved in India. The project will also grow through events looking to build a powerful network of dance activists such as the Embodied Empowerment Panel Event. 

Our Team

Sydney Skov, Free Body Project Founder has been inspired by dancers and people working for positive change in their communities around the world. After graduating from New York University's Gallatin School of Individualized Study with a degree in French and African Relations, Sydney pursued a career in the field of international development in the United States, Senegal and India. Sydney has recently earned her MA in Sustainable International Development from Brandeis University. Last year Sydney was honored to be chosen as a Boren Fellow by the United States’ National Security Education Program. During the fellowship she lived in Kolkata, India and worked with Kolkata Sanved, a groundbreaking non-profit organization transforming the lives of survivors of trafficking and violence through dance and dance movement therapy. Sydney continues to live in Kolkata and was recently selected as a Fulbright Scholar in India to expand Free Body Project through the creation of  a second dance and documentary film promoting the voices of dancers and activists working against gender based violence.

Cynthia Anne Stanley is a New York city based choreographer and performer. Migrated from Marin County California, where she trained at “Stapleton School of Performing Arts”, And San Francisco Ballet.  She received her BFA in Dance Performance at Southern Methodist University in Dallas, Texas, earning the "Dancer of Excellence" award. Cynthia has taught and choreographed for  Martha Graham School of contemporary dance and Ensemble, as well as other various performing art schools.  She has been teaching and writing curriculum at the Martha Graham School of Contemporary Dance, including outreach programs into public schools for the past ten plus years. Her tribute piece of "American Document" was performed at the Martha Graham Company Gala Spring of 2010. She has collaborated in a wide range of work through dance performance, choreography and film. She is the director of the collaborative dance theatre group “Bardos Ballet Theatre”. And most recently set and filmed a new work, “Reservoir” on The Graham School and Ensemble. This past year she was asked to come on as Senior Associate of Education at The Martha Graham School.

Nisha Singh is a visual and performing artist based out of San Francisco, California. Her commitment to dance and service is affirmed by her outreach work in India, woven by a common thread of hope and empowerment, using dance as a tool for social change. Working with a group of dancers, their commitment was steered by the universality of movement and the emotions from which it generates, without the need of a common technical language. Nisha and a fellow program director created 2 sustainable dance education programs for underserved communities in both Mumbai and Kolkata, empowering creative expression, cross-cultural understanding, and civic engagement. Her professional experience includes 12 years of marketing, communication, and design for start-up technology, and in the non-profit space. Nisha is currently training in Modern Dance at Alonzo Kings Lines Ballet and enrolled in a post bac program in Visual Arts - Photography at UC Berkeley Extension, where she is working on a photo narrative around the universal language of dance.

Janique L. Robillard is a freelance producer / director, based in Portland, Oregon. Her work spans many categories – live action and animated corporate videos, broadcast commercials, web videos, short films, and music videos - but her passion is documentary filmmaking. She is driven by her creative desire to capture portraits of women in power, especially in sports, without compromising their femininity or eliminating all depth from their character.Janique actively seeks opportunities to collaborate with women, working to elevate women’s voices in film with projects like her social activist dance short Move for Freedom and feature documentaries 1000 Times and The Woodsriders.
story_txt:
About the Event 
On June 18th, Free Body Project and the Martha Graham School of Contemporary Dance are bringing together thought leaders and social change makers from India, Canada, and the United States at the Martha Graham Center of Contemporary Dance in New York City for an inspiring panel event. You are invited! Admission is free and open to all. Any donations made at the event will go directly to support the organizations represented by the panelists. To learn more and to register for the event, visit www.freebodypanel.com.  
Through an engaging discussion with six practitioners supporting the use of dance as healing and empowerment for survivors of trauma and violence, we will 

more deeply understand how dance positively benefits the physical, cognitive, social, and emotional skills of individuals. 
discuss how dance and movement can be more widely utilized in international development and peace building initiatives. 
engage with the question of how more dancers can use their skill to become involved to perpetuate positive change. 

This is an important step in building a thriving and cohesive network of global dance activists. How You Can Help  Free Body Project will be flying in two inspired change makers to speak at the panel event in New York; 
Sohini Chakraborty, an Ashoka Fellow and social entrepreneur from Kolkata, India. She is the Founder Director of Kolkata Sanved, an NGO using dance and Dance Movement Therapy to transform the lives of survivors of sex trafficking and violence. Learn more: Kolkata Sanved.
Carrie MacLeod, the Research Director for the Dancing at the Crossroads conflict transformation and dance project at the University of British Columbia. Learn more: Dancing at the Crossroads. Your help will allow us to purchase two plane tickets to bring the panelists to the Embodied Empowerment panel event: one round trip ticket from Kolkata, India to NYC and one round trip ticket from Vancouver, British Columbia to NYC. Additional funding will cover expenses for the event including printing and equipment.The Impact and the Incredible PanelistsDance presents a powerful lens through which to approach social change as well as healing and empowerment for survivors of trauma and violence. However, practitioners of this work are scattered across the globe; the Embodied Empowerment panel event looks to harness this power by brining together leaders in this unique and emerging field in New York. 
During the event, highly experienced and passionate panelists will help us explore why dance and movement are such powerful tools through the lenses of psychology, neuroscience, trauma theory, conflictresolution, performance, and human rights.
Sohini Chakraborty: Founder Director of Kolkata Sanved, an NGO based in Kolkata, India using dance as psychosocial rehabilitation for survivors of human trafficking and violence in India and across South Asia. Kolkata Sanved has directly served over 7,000 participants in partnership with over 30 partner organizations in India and across South Asia. 

Yasemin Ozumerzifon: Manager of the Community Action program at Gibney Dance working with survivors of domestic violence in New York.

Carrie MacLeod: Research Director of Dancing at the Crossroads Conflict Transformation Project at the University of British Columbia and co-author of a recent book, the Choreography of Resolution, on dance, conflict resolution, and neuroscience.

Alison Gardy: Director of International Relations at the 92nd Street Y.

Edward Henkel: Associate Director of the 92nd Street Y Harkness Dance Center, former professional dancer, teacher, and choreographer, and the creator of MovementTalks, an ongoing series exploring dance as a catalyst for change.

Beth Silverman-Yam: Adjunct Associate Professor at Columbia University teaching a course on domestic violence. Director of Clinical Programs at Sanctuary for Families from 1994-2014 and a social work clinician, program developer and administrator for more than 40 years.Special Perks from Kolkata, India 







We believe in supporting the awesome work of organizations empowering survivors of trauma and violence and helping local communities. Their products are made with fair trade, organic cotton but their main goal is to empower women through economic opportunity and freedom from trafficking; they also offer literacy classes, child care and other services to support their employees. The hand loom scarves are made in India from locally sourced cotton. The notebooks have been created by (and directly support) the Kolkata-based Anjali Mental Health Rights Organization which focuses on independence, self determination, and social inclusion of people with mental health conditions institutionalized and abandoned.

story:
We’re exiting this era of culture where fitness should be serious. 

This is the equivalent of grown-up recess.

The Athletic Playground was started in 2008 by Shira Yaziv and David Grace as a way to offer playful and fun fitness opportunities to the San Francisco Bay Area. Since then, AP has grown exponentially, incorporating classes in acrobatics, dance, parkour, aerials, acroyoga, hula hooping, monkey conditioning, and more! In addition to offering a playful, fun, and skill-oriented route to fitness, the Athletic Playground has become a community hub, hosting social events and building lasting friendships.

Now we want to bring all of this to Seattle!

In 2013, Jen Ryan, a former teacher and student at AP, moved to Seattle and found her new life had a large, gaping, Athletic Playground-sized hole in it. Teaming up with Shira and long-time AP instructors Zach Fischer and Marria Kee, the decision was made to open Athletic Playground Seattle.

Here is where you come in. Starting a business takes a lot of money. We are not wealthy entrepreneurs, but we are skilled teachers, experienced business people, and passionate movement enthusiasts. We want to provide a space for movers of all kinds to come together, learn new things, make new friends, grow, and thrive. But we need your help to make this happen.


Here is what we need to make this real

Our stretch goal is to raise $60,000 to make this epic.

But we can get started with $20k. 

Here is what we need:
  • Space to move in! We need a lot of floorspace and a bit of height. We'll need to give our landlord a deposit and show them that we can pay a few months rent up front.

  • Improvements to that space! Because of our physical requirements, we're looking at industrial spaces. It might be pretty raw when we move in. We expect we'll need to put in some flooring, install and rig some equipment, paint a bit, maybe build some walls, improve the bathrooms... anything that needs to be done to the space itself to make it a place you want to come and play in.

  • Toys! We will need mats, crash pads, tumbling blocks, ropes, monkey bars... Some of these things are very cheap (rubber balls!), but some of them are not at all (crash pads...) and all together it adds up very quickly. The more we can raise, the more toys you all get to play with!

  • Amazing teachers! We'd love to believe that our doors will be beaten down on Day One by all of Seattle's excited monkeys! But let's be real; it takes time for a business to grow. We know the first few months will be tight, and we want to be ready for it. Our biggest operational expense will be our teachers' pay. They are the reason you will want to keep coming back here. They make us who we are and they are Worth. Every. Penny. Help us keep them teaching during our first few months of growth.


We feel the best way to reward you for contributing to our campaign is to get you to come and play with us, so we're offering access perks- free classes, memberships, private lessons. If you would like to support us from afar and you feel it is unlikely you will make it to Seattle to use your perk, please consider "paying it forward." For every contributor who chooses to Pay It Forward, the value of your perk with be added to our scholarship fund to provide access to low-income individuals and families.
**If you want to pay your perk forward, please send us a message to let us know. Thank you!

"The Athletic Playground changed my life..."

    -Vangelis C

This isn't just another place to work out. It's not just a gym, or a business, or a way to lose weight. Something unique, invaluable, and a little bit magical happened at the Playground. We don't know quite how to put it in words, so we asked our members to try instead...

"Monkey Conditioning has given me strength, confidence, body awareness and all kinds of cool muscles I never knew I could get. Also, I can now leap over fences, play on my hands, climb poles and spontaneously impress people with random skills. The AP could very well be the best thing that ever happened to me!"  - Liz A

"I love the way that the Athletic Playground helps get you more in touch with your own body. Exercising is no longer a chore, but rather an exploration and discovery of how awesome each of us really is."   -Jen

"In our society kids get to run and jump and fall down and fool around. But adults have to sit still and never be foolish. That's silly. The Athletic Playground provides a space where adults can forget all those 'should's' and 'shouldn't's' we've been taught. Want to climb a rope? Great! Want to walk around on your hands? Done. The Athletic Playground offers a completely different perspective: that play of all kinds can be utilized to promote fitness and skill-growth. Come on by and see what all those suckers in gyms are missing out on."    - Jaimie H

"You won't even believe how freakin' awesome the classes and community at Athletic Playground are! I've never been around so many adults having the time of their lives before! Hurry up and join so you can start having a ridiculously good time while feeling great about your body!"    - Susanna B

"Remember when you used to play on the monkey bars as a kid? And you tried to do all the stuff the other kids could? It wasn't about exercising or heart rates, but more along the vein of double-dares or "if s/he can do it it, then I can too." Well, welcome back."  - Jennie C


"The Athletic Playground is one of the best things I've ever discovered."                                                                                                                                                               -Angela C


Spread the Word!

Whether or not you're able to contribute to the fundraiser, there are other ways to help us out, too. This is a grassroots campaign, and our success is measured in participation. Let's make some noise, Seattle!

  • Share this online as far and wide as possible! Facebook, Instagram, Twitter- anything you use to communicate online, talk us up. Indiegogo has a column of sharing tools along the left-hand side of the screen. Click those buttons!
  • Email. Do you have pals that eschew the time-consumptive nature of social media sites? Or maybe they've just got too many friends to keep up? Drop 'em an email to let them know what's going on!
  • IRL. Talk about us face-to-face. Have you been to The Athletic Playground? Tell everyone you meet about your experience. Not been, but are super excited about trying us out? Great! Get your friends excited too!
The more people know, the stronger we'll be.

story:
What is this campaign about?

Today your work is most likely supported by software. As you know, life-science software must be validated. And validation is documented evidence that the software works OK. Probably your organization has its own validation approach or Quality Management System (QMS), which may be complex, expensive and time consuming.

In that case this campaign can help you out, with an open source QMS, that is a simple, efficient and compliant!

Is this campaign for You?

First, you are involved in CSV, for example as a user, a technical expert, a tester, a supplier, a validation or quality officer or as a manager.

Second, you believe your role or the one of your colleagues needs to be simplified.

For example, you DON’T want to spend tons of hours on the creation, review, approval or usage on large documents of which the content doesn’t get clearer. BUT work with easy and small documents, that only contain added value.

Or you DON’T need to take cumbersome and time-consuming trainings to figure out complex procedures and still don’t know what to do. BUT simply start with the validation right away!

Or you DON’T want to lose precious time and energy on discussing the implementation details of the CSV process for every new system, project, change or when a new colleague joins the team. BUT have a simple validation process that is well defined in every aspect.

Or you DON’T need to worry about the creation and maintenance of your own QMS compliant with all regulations, best practices and current inspector expectations. BUT just use an existing and easy QMS that is kept compliant continuously.

A QMS may consist of many objects such as a quality manual, policies, standards, procedures, work instructions, templates, training materials and tools. Keeping it consistent, efficient and compliant may take you a lot of effort! While with the current regulations and generic computer systems, your business absolutely does NOT need an own specific QMS anymore.

When you recognize these examples, then this campaign is for YOU!

Why should you listen to me?

My name is Dave Langerveld. I’m the founder of The Software Quality Kit. An initiative to help small life-science companies or organizations with small budgets to do the validation of their computerized systems in a very efficient way.

During the last 12 years, I worked for several large pharmaceutical companies. As a quality and validation officer, I successfully validated all kinds of computerized systems: large/small, global/local, administrative/technical, manufacturing and research.

Even more, colleagues and customers noticed that it is my passion to share my expertise and support others by making complex processes efficient and easy-to-use.

Please check my recommendations on linkedin.com/in/davelangerveld or tsqk.eu/references/

What will this campaign deliver?

This campaign will deliver your solution to stop wasting time, money and energy on CSV.

The solution consists of an open source, over-complete set of very effective templates. With specific subsets of these templates you can validate each regular and most special computerized systems in a very easy and efficient way. For the planning and overview of the templates, see the end of this text.

All compliance and efficiency is incorporated into the templates. They are as short as possible, focus on the data with the real added value and leave no room for different interpretations.

By using them in the right way, all these features are automatically inherited by the validation deliverables and your systems will be compliant and audit and inspection proof!

What are the benefits of this QMS?

First, the open source templates are optimized by the community. This will take away the burden to spend any more time and money on the creation and maintenance of your own QMS.

Second, because of the efficiency of the templates, you can save a lot of time, money and frustration on training and the execution of each validation activity.

For example you can create and finish a validation plan of 7 pages within one hour, instead of a document of more than 100 pages which may take multiple weeks or even months!

And third, because it is an easy-to-use system, you don’t need expensive validation experts anymore and your hour rates will go down! For some activities even up to 75%.

By using this QMS, you as a pharmaceutical or life-science company can focus your energy, time and money on your core business, the health and well-being of humans and animals. These benefits are even more important for smaller organizations, with limited budgets and resources!

For a list and explanation of all benefits of a simple and ready-to-go quality system, see the PERK “Special article about benefits” on the right side of this page.

How can you help!

To change the world of computer system validation for good and make it possible for any organization to benefit from this initiative, I need your help!

First, you can help by forwarding this campaign to everybody in your network who may benefit. Please use the Indiegogo share tools directly below the video message.

Second, you can discuss this initiative in your own organization. Whatever your responsibility is, you can always propose improvements, especially for activities that cost you a lot of time and effort. In that case, discuss this campaign with the validation, quality or management role of your project, department, site or company.

And you can fund some money and get a unique reward! When this campaign reaches its goal, the unique open source CSV templates will become true. As contributor, you get the rewards you chose. See Rewards/PERKS.

Rewards/PERKS

There are a few ways to contribute.

Validation Plan template

For just 10 EUR, you receive the template of the validation plan within 2 working days.

With this template you can create a formal validation plan for your own computer system within just 1 hour! Normally this may take a couple of weeks or even months. This validation plan gives full direction to the validation activities and can be used with any other QMS or vendor.

This VP template is a good example of the simplicity and efficiency of the templates.

When combined with an “ALL validation templates” perk, your 10 EUR will be refunded.

ALL validation templates

You can also have the over-complete set of all 60 validation templates as listed and 

planned below! With specific subsets of these templates you can validate each regular and most special computerized systems in a very easy and efficient way.

Normal market value is                                                                       6000 EUR

Via this campaign you can have them for just                            400 EUR

And with the PERK "First Supporters"* you may get them     for FREE!

*) Please be aware that this PERK has a limited availability for people to claim.

So go directly to the right side of this page and pick your PERK!

To Your Quality, Dave Langerveld

Planning

I will create and share the templates according to the planning and the received funding. The templates are sorted according the phases of an actual validation project, so you can directly start using them for a real project!

The deliverables are divided over the phases, in a way I can process one phase per 4 weeks. The amount of money will compensate only my time in a minimal way.

*) The Deliverables consist of the templates related to the phase as listed below.

**) The Due Date is the date that the funding of the related phase is received plus the number of weeks mentioned, but not earlier than the sum of the weeks mentioned for this and previous phases. I will deliver as much and as soon as possible.

List of templates
story_txt:
What is this campaign about?Today your work is most likely supported by software. As you know, life-science software must be validated. And validation is documented evidence that the software works OK. Probably your organization has its own validation approach or Quality Management System (QMS), which may be complex, expensive and time consuming.In that case this campaign can help you out, with an open source QMS, that is a simple, efficient and compliant!Is this campaign for You?First, you are involved in CSV, for example as a user, a technical expert, a tester, a supplier, a validation or quality officer or as a manager.Second, you believe your role or the one of your colleagues needs to be simplified.For example, you DON’T want to spend tons of hours on the creation, review, approval or usage on large documents of which the content doesn’t get clearer. BUT work with easy and small documents, that only contain added value.Or you DON’T need to take cumbersome and time-consuming trainings to figure out complex procedures and still don’t know what to do. BUT simply start with the validation right away!Or you DON’T want to lose precious time and energy on discussing the implementation details of the CSV process for every new system, project, change or when a new colleague joins the team. BUT have a simple validation process that is well defined in every aspect.Or you DON’T need to worry about the creation and maintenance of your own QMS compliant with all regulations, best practices and current inspector expectations. BUT just use an existing and easy QMS that is kept compliant continuously.A QMS may consist of many objects such as a quality manual, policies, standards, procedures, work instructions, templates, training materials and tools. Keeping it consistent, efficient and compliant may take you a lot of effort! While with the current regulations and generic computer systems, your business absolutely does NOT need an own specific QMS anymore.When you recognize these examples, then this campaign is for YOU!Why should you listen to me?My name is Dave Langerveld. I’m the founder of The Software Quality Kit. An initiative to help small life-science companies or organizations with small budgets to do the validation of their computerized systems in a very efficient way.During the last 12 years, I worked for several large pharmaceutical companies. As a quality and validation officer, I successfully validated all kinds of computerized systems: large/small, global/local, administrative/technical, manufacturing and research.Even more, colleagues and customers noticed that it is my passion to share my expertise and support others by making complex processes efficient and easy-to-use.Please check my recommendations on linkedin.com/in/davelangerveld or tsqk.eu/references/What will this campaign deliver?This campaign will deliver your solution to stop wasting time, money and energy on CSV.The solution consists of an open source, over-complete set of very effective templates. With specific subsets of these templates you can validate each regular and most special computerized systems in a very easy and efficient way. For the planning and overview of the templates, see the end of this text.All compliance and efficiency is incorporated into the templates. They are as short as possible, focus on the data with the real added value and leave no room for different interpretations.By using them in the right way, all these features are automatically inherited by the validation deliverables and your systems will be compliant and audit and inspection proof!What are the benefits of this QMS?First, the open source templates are optimized by the community. This will take away the burden to spend any more time and money on the creation and maintenance of your own QMS.Second, because of the efficiency of the templates, you can save a lot of time, money and frustration on training and the execution of each validation activity.For example you can create and finish a validation plan of 7 pages within one hour, instead of a document of more than 100 pages which may take multiple weeks or even months!And third, because it is an easy-to-use system, you don’t need expensive validation experts anymore and your hour rates will go down! For some activities even up to 75%.By using this QMS, you as a pharmaceutical or life-science company can focus your energy, time and money on your core business, the health and well-being of humans and animals. These benefits are even more important for smaller organizations, with limited budgets and resources!For a list and explanation of all benefits of a simple and ready-to-go quality
system, see the PERK “Special article about benefits” on the right side of this
page.How can you help!To change the world of computer system validation for good and make it possible for any organization to benefit from this initiative, I need your help!First, you can help by forwarding this campaign to everybody in your network who may benefit. Please use the Indiegogo share tools directly below the video message.Second, you can discuss this initiative in your own organization. Whatever your responsibility is, you can always propose improvements, especially for activities that cost you a lot of time and effort. In that case, discuss this campaign with the validation, quality or management role of your project, department, site or company.And you can fund some money and get a unique reward! When this campaign reaches its goal, the unique open source CSV templates will become true. As contributor, you get the rewards you chose. See Rewards/PERKS.Rewards/PERKSThere are a few ways to contribute.Validation Plan templateFor just 10 EUR, you receive the template of the validation plan within 2 working days.With this template you can create a formal validation plan for your own computer system within just 1 hour! Normally this may take a couple of weeks or even months. This validation plan gives full direction to the validation activities and can be used with any other QMS or vendor.This VP template is a good example of the simplicity and efficiency of the templates.When combined with an “ALL validation templates” perk, your 10 EUR will be refunded.ALL validation templatesYou can also have the over-complete set of all 60 validation templates as listed and planned below! With specific subsets of these templates you can validate each regular and most special computerized systems in a very easy and efficient way.Normal market value is                                                                       6000 EURVia this campaign you can have them for just                            400 EURAnd with the PERK "First Supporters"* you may get them     for FREE!*) Please be aware that this PERK has a limited availability for people
to claim.

So go directly to the right side of this page and
pick your PERK!To
Your Quality, Dave LangerveldPlanningI will create and share the templates according to the planning and the received funding. The templates are sorted according the phases of an actual validation project, so you can directly start using them for a real project!The deliverables are divided over the phases, in a way I can process one phase per 4 weeks. The amount of money will compensate only my time in a minimal way.*) The Deliverables consist of the templates related to the phase as listed below.**) The Due Date is the date that the funding of the related phase is received plus the number of weeks mentioned, but not earlier than the sum of the weeks mentioned for this and previous phases. I will deliver as much and as soon as possible.List of templates

story:
Citizen Sting (CitizenSting.com)

Have you ever wondered why some important news stories don't seem to get much attention in mainstream media?

Citizen Sting is a unique news gathering and presentation initiative. It will attempt to drive the focus of what we read, view and share to topics that are not only interesting and entertaining, but ideally more meaningful than funny cat videos.

Our tagline is, "Catch 'em in the act!" That can mean showing people doing things they shouldn't, but it also means celebrating the local heroes in our communities.

Citizen Sting believes that we can support better, safer and more tolerant communities through wider viewership of important but under-exposed events. To do this Citizen Sting will display a mix of traditional, independent and user generated stories in addition to producing original content.

Further, Citizen Sting will attempt to give the audience ways TO ACT on the stories that they feel are important.

About Us

Citizen Sting was started by Richard FitzGerald, a self-confessed news junky and travel addict who was also formerly a business development executive and consultant working with web based start-ups. The campaign seeks funds to supplement the founder's original investment.

What We Need & What You Get

Citizen Sting is hoping to achieve the following:

  • Raise $15,000. This will be used to complete the content delivery platform, build a organizational infrastructure, compensate editors and content contributors and cover things like hosting and ongoing development costs.
  • In future, where appropriate the platform will promote products and services that fit with our objectives and we hope to offer some exclusive discounts. 
  • Citizen Sting also wants to support community organizations working towards complementary objectives. Ideally, the community will have a voice in these decisions.
  • In the event that Citizen Sting does not meet its fundraising goal, the work will continue using the founder's investment and/or funds from other sources. 

The Impact

The motivation behind Citizen Sting is simple:

  • Discussion builds understanding. Understanding builds tolerance. Tolerance makes for a better world.
  • So why not use the technologies and techniques of the Internet and social media to raise the bar on what media we consume and share? 

Risks & Challenges

The risks for Citizen Sting are common to any start-up. The content will be free for people to read and the platform will be advertiser supported so the organization will eventually need to generate revenue in excess of its ongoing costs.

  • The founder has experience working with start-ups to take them from loss making to profitable.
  • The near-term plan is to create a lean organization relying on passionate individual contributors, partner companies and freelancers.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can support us financially. If you like what Citizen Sting is trying to do, please consider the following ways to help:

  • Please share the link to this campaign and CitizenSting.com with your friends and colleagues.
  • If you have a personal blog, feel free to post your thoughts on this initiative.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help us get the word out.
  • You can sign up for our newsletter at CitizenSting.com. 
  • Bookmark CitizenSting.com in your browser and when we launch in the coming weeks, have a look and let us know what you think.

Thanks for taking a moment to review our campaign.

story:
Dreamnight at Yerevan Zoo

On June 28th for the first Dreamnight at Yerevan Zoo more than 60 chronically ill or disabled children together with their parents, siblings and caretakers will be warmly welcomed as VIP guests at Yerevan Zoo. The zoo will be full of colors, lights, and music. There will be performances, games, great food and fantastic presents. The young guests will have a special guided VIP tour in the zoo, with direct contact to the animals and unique insights behind the scenes. The Dreamnight at Yerevan Zoo is organized by the Foundation for the Preservation of Wildlife and Cultural Assets.

The program of the event will also include a special part under the headline “Make a Child’s Dream come true”. The organizers alongside with supporters and donors will try to fulfill the special wishes of the invited children.

The mission of the event is not only complimenting the children living in struggle for life and their place in it with an unforgettable evening, but to raise awareness about the issues that these little ones are forced to encounter, finding themselves in the marginalized side of our society.

Yerevan Zoo is the first zoo in the entire region to join the global “Dreamnight at the Zoo” Network.


«Երազանքի գիշեր Երևանի կենդանաբանական այգում»

Հունիսի 28-ն Երևանի կենդանաբանական այգու առաջին «Երազանքի գիշերը» կհյուրընկալի անբուժելի հիվանդ և սահմանափակ կարողություններով ավելի քան 60 երեխաների, նրանց ծնողներին (խնամակալներին), քույրերին և եղբայրներին:

Հրավիրվածներին կընդունեն որպես հատուկ կարևորության հյուրերի՝ առաջարկելով հյուրասիրություն, լավ երաժշտություն, խաղեր ու նվերներ: Փոքրիկ հյուրերը հնարավորություն կունենան կենդանաբանական այգում հատուկ շրջայցի և կենդանիների հետ անմիջական շփման: 

«Երազանքի գիշեր Երևանի կենդանաբանական այգու» նախաձեռնությունն իրականացնում է Վայրի բնության և մշակութային արժեքների պահպանման հիմնադրամը:

Միջոցառման ծրագիրը կունենա հատուկ մաս՝ «Իրականացնենք երեխայի երազանքը» խորագրով, որի շրջանակում կազմակերպիչները դոնորների և աջակիցների հետ համատեղ կփորձեն իրականացնել հրավիրված երեխաների երազանքները:

Նախաձեռնության առաքելությունը ոչ միայն անմոռանալի երեկո նվիրելն է երեխաներին, որ ապրում են կյանքի ու դրանում իրենց տեղի համար պայքարի մեջ, այլև բարձրաձայնելն այն հավելյալ խնդիրների մասին, որոնց նրանք ստիպված են բախվել՝ ակամա հայտնվելով մեր հասարակության մարգինալ հատվածում:

Երևանի կենդանաբանական այգին առաջինն է տարածաշրջանում, որ միանում է «Երազանքի գիշեր կենդանաբանական այգում» համաշխարհային ցանցին:

«Երազանքի գիշեր կենդանաբանական այգում» համաշխարհային ցանց

 «Երազանքի գիշեր կենդանաբանական այգում» համաշխարհային ցանցի անդամներն աշխարհի տարբեր երկրների կենդանաբանական այգիներ են  (Նիդերլանդների, Գերմանիայի, Ճապոնիայի, ԱՄՆ-ի, Կանադայի, Մեքսիկայի, Չինաստանի, Հնդկաստանի և այլն), որոնց առաքելությունն է ամեն տարի կենդանաբանական այգի հրավիրել սահմանափակ կարողություններով կամ անբուժելի հիվանդ երեխաների և անմոռանալի օր նվիրել նրանց: Երազանքի գիշերները սովորաբար կազմակերպվում են հունիս կամ դեկտեմբեր ամիսներին:

Օրվա կարևոր բաղադրիչներից մեկն այն է, որ երեխաներն այգի կայցելեն իրենց ընտանիքների՝ ծնողների, քույր-եղբայրների և/կամ խնամակալների հետ, քանի որ վերջիններս նույնպես բազմաթիվ դժվարությունների են հանդիպում հատուկ ուշադրություն պահանջող երեխաների խնամքն իրականացնելիս: «Երազանքի գիշերվա» ընթացքում հրավիրվածներին ընդունում են որպես հատուկ կարևորության հյուրերի. այգու մուտքը փակ է լինում այլ այցելուների համար, և անվճար՝ հրավիրված երեխաների և նրանց ծնողների համար:

Բացի այդ, նրանց համար կազմակերպվում են համերգներ, թատերական ներկայացումներ, ծանոթացում ու «շփում» կենդանիների հետ, հյուրասիրություն և այլն: «Երազանքի գիշեր կենդանաբանական այգում» ցանցի անդամներից յուրաքանչյուրը կազմակերպում է միջոցառումն ըստ տեղի հնարավորությունների, սակայն հետևյալ պահանջները պետք է պարտադիր բավարարվեն.

-  Անվճար մուտք հյուրերի համար

-  Այգու մուտքն այլ այցելուների համար փակ է

-  Հրավերները պետք է բաժանվեն բացառապես  մանկատների, հավատարմագրված  կազմակերպությունների կամ բժշկական հաստատությունների միջոցով

- Երեխաներին և նրանց ծնողներին պետք է դիմավորել հատուկ հյուրընկալությամբ, հյուրերը պետք է օգտվեն այգու բոլոր հնարավորություններից անվճար:
