story:
Who We Are

What makes American great? The answer is you - you are an individual with a background and set of values that is utterly unique. Our diversity makes us stronger, spurring innovation and creativity at levels seen nowhere else in the world. We started American Certified (www.americancertified.com) to make it easy for shoppers to support American workers - whoever they may be, wherever they may be working, and whatever they may be making. 

Our goal is simple - transparency. More than ever, American shoppers want to make conscientious purchases, and make sure that they vote with their wallets to support those whose values they can agree with. This ambition, however, is tempered by the time and difficulty involved in researching every maker and product prior to purchase. Many of us simply do not have the time to do as much as we'd like - we're too busy taking care of our kids, or putting in long hours at our jobs to keep food on the table. Yet, we want to do the right thing.

What if finding out everything you wanted to know about a company wasn't so difficult? What if a free resource existed that allowed you to look up an American manufacturer by name or product and immediately find out everything you ever wanted to know about that company, for example, do you want to buy products only from companies which pay their workers a living wage? From woman, minority or veteran-owned businesses? From organizations which share your political or religious values? That makes products in a sustainable, environmentally conscious manner?

With over a hundred characteristics to choose from, American Certified hopes to make it as easy as possible for individuals like you to make informed purchases that support your unique belief system. But is a huge undertaking. We estimate that there are more than 250,000 makers who will qualify for our Directory, including not only traditional manufacturers, but farmers, craftspeople and artisans, as well as, tinkerers with 3D printers.

For example, take the seal below for the Yuengling brewery, located in Pottsville, Pennsylvania. Each icon tells you something about Yuengling, the way it operates, and how it makes its products. Just by looking, you can determine that Yuengling is an American owned and family operated German-American company, which employs both disabled and American veterans, providing medical benefits for both. These workers make a product, which is 100% Made in the USA, fully vegan, and bottled in recycled glass in the Greater Philadelphia area.  

                                

                                                      

No matter what characteristics you are particularly interested, and whatever your values may be, our Directory connects you with makers who share them, bridging American communities and making it easy to make purchases you can be happy with.

Our Veteran Initiative

The Directory of Certified Makers is an enormous undertaking, to be built in stages. As our initial focus, we're launching a campaign to reach out to American veterans (and their spouses) whose businesses are making products here in the USA. 

Veterans face many issues returning home - nearly a third of American homeless are veterans, they suffer unprecedented rates of Post Traumatic Stress Disorder and face huge backlogs for claiming benefits, while unemployment among veterans is twice the national average. 

Nonetheless, thousands of enterprising veterans (and veteran-spouses) have managed to build new lives for themselves, starting new companies, opening new plants, and creating tens of thousands of new jobs. We want to celebrate America's veteran makers, and have made it our goal to reach out to them, and promote their products, making it as easy as possible for Americans to support our returning heroes. 

What We Need

The Directory of Makers is a powerful tool -  yet we do not charge for participation. We estimate that there are over 50,000 veteran (and spouse owned) maker businesses which will qualify for certification.  We want to identify and then promote these hero-owned businesses, without charge. 

Specifically, we need $7,000 for compensation and travel expenses. This will cover the direct and indirect costs of hiring two returning veterans for a month to begin the research and networking. This will be a transitional stipend (with the intent to convert to permanent, full-time) aimed at helping some of our returning troops learn new skills, adapt to a civilian workplace, and build important resume experience for continued growth, while helping us do the same for many of their fellow soldiers. We will reach out to national and regional organizations, including local community leaders in that can serve as our ambassadors to the local makers who they already live and work alongside. We estimate an average cost of more than $5 per completed Directory listing. With 50,000 potentially qualified veteran-business prospects, the funding we are seeking will at least help us to get started. 

Full disclosure.  We are a for-profit business. Our associated store (featuring over 1.5 million American made products) helps fund some of our costs, including rent, compensation for our staff and programmers, for our social media presence (to promote the Makers), and also helps cover the remaining hosting expenses. But American Certified is a bootstrapped start-up, and companies in the Directory (including veteran-owned) are not required to participate in our e-commerce site. We simply cannot afford to undertake this project without your support.  

The Impact

What does promoting American manufacturing help? Why do my spending decisions matter?  

  • When you support our makers, all Americans benefit - every dollar spent with an American veteran maker has a multiplier effect equal to a $1.35 on our economy; each new job creates more than four additional ones! 
  • Financially support companies making a positive change in the American marketplace, creating market solutions for social problems! 
  • Find new makers who share your values which you never even knew existed! 
  • Help the environment! The world's fifteen largest oceanic freight barges produce more CO2 annually than every automobile combined! 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We understand that not everyone who may want to help us has the resources to do so. Nonetheless, there are many ways you can help that won't put a strain on your wallet! 

    • Like us on Facebook andTwitter. Create the buzz we need so that we can spread the word about the veterans and others who are putting Americans back to work building great products.
    • Join the Movement on our website! Create a profile to share with the world why you try to Buy American.
    • If you are purchasing a product through Amazon anyway, do so through our site. The commissions we earn help us fund our operations just the same as a donation, and is just as appreciated! 

    No matter what, we thank you for your interest and support.

story:
Who we are:

In 2001, MIT fellow and Popular Mechanics darling Jock Brandis traveled to Mali to fix a small village’s water treatment system. While there, he came across a woman who informed him of a village need for an affordable peanut sheller in order to increase their output of the crop to sell. One year later and several iterations of an obscure Bulgarian peanut shelling design, he completed what is now called the Universal Nut Sheller. In 2003, Brandis teamed with a group of retired Peace Corps volunteers to form the Full Belly Project.

Full Belly Project’s mission is to support the improvement of economic possibilities for people in global communities. We address the critical issue of poverty eradication with simple agricultural technologies, developing and distributing devices that essentially help people help themselves. Check out our active projects below!

      What we need:  

FB is at the juncture of growth and stability. We have great ideas, and although we have only a 2.5-person staff, our volunteers in the community and around the world have been instrumental in our success at improving economic opportunities for people in our global community! In order to increase our impact, we’re trying to tidy up our office and workshop. Church groups, boy scouts, volunteers, and neighbors visit daily; making sure our workshop and office are safe and inviting keeps our volunteers happy and provides a creative workspace for ideas, designs, and client meetings.

We need your help! We are developing partnerships with some great people and businesses across the globe, and we've been grateful for small grants to launch and maintain our projects overseas. We need upgrades to keep these projects going as well as to maintain an active role in our community at home. We plan to repair tools we have using local businesses, as well as purchase an extra set of welding gear to teach this valuable skill to high school and college students. We will paint the exterior of the building and purchase and install a latex coating for the roof to stop leaks and reduce our electricity bill to cool the building. Furthermore, as we grow, we need a safe, comfortable meeting space to host clients and potential funders.  Most of our labor will come from the volunteers; we simply need the goods.

     How we operate:  

There are people struggling worldwide. We aim to create self-efficacy in developing or rural economies using locally available materials and sustainable practices. We follow a clear directive in order to stay organized and maintain focus on existing projects while constantly branching out with new ideas.

Many prototypes and designs come from our garage in Wilmington, N.C. Volunteers and students are encouraged to offer suggestions and test ideas, honing in on problem-solving skills with a trial-and-error type methodology. Not only does this inspire brainstorming and outside-the-box thinking, it also builds confidence and self-assurance. Because there is no right or wrong way to solve these problems, there is no prospect of failure.

     Our Active Projects:    

1)  Peanut sheller  - Distributed all over Africa, our signature project helps villagers shell peanuts, their primary source of protein, using a fraction of the usual time and effort.

2)  Jatropha sheller  - The same sheller is modified and used to make diesel fuel from the seeds of the jatropha plant, a sturdy African weed typically used for fencing.

3)  Rocker water pump – The pump, fashioned from old tires, wood, and PVC, uses foot power for irrigation to increase crop yield.

4)  Corn cracker – The device saves time and effort by cracking whole corn kernels, which would otherwise be discarded by the birds, to use as chicken feed. 

5)  Soap for Hope - Soap donated by Manila Peninsula hotels is collected and recycled by Holy Family School of Indang. The repackaged soap, created with a soap press designed by Full Belly, allows communities to produce and distribute recycled soap products to fend off disease, promote better health, and generate income.

6)  Cotton gin - In some places in Africa cotton is a commercial crop; the cotton gins are often loaned to the villagers for a hefty fee. This simple gin reduces a village’s dependence on outside businessmen and is more effective at separating the cotton from the seeds.

7)  Plastic recycling/oven – Jock is developing a solar-powered press that combines plastic trash (collected by locals) and local plant material (such as grass or palm fronds) and heats it to 400 deg F. The repurposed plastic can then be used for shingles, furniture, school desks and chairs, etc.

     Our Stretch Goal: 

Like any successful organization, we DO have a long-term plan in place.  As we look toward the future, we want to expand our staff and plan to hire a Volunteer Coordinator. We get daily queries about peanut shellers, and we have a plan to hire and train a team of people to send overseas to work with local groups to get them started. Additional funds would help us have 8-10 ready to ship at all times by paying for the materials, shop tools, and defray shipping costs. We have a dream of hiring translators, technical writers, and engineers to help make the assembly of these products as seamless as possible. And we'd love to pay off the mortgage on our shop! So, if we were lucky enough to raise more than our goal right now, we could use it!

     What else you can do:

Go to our website. Volunteer. Check out our submission to BBC's World Challenge, In a Nutshell, to hear more about the Full Belly Project. Most importantly, SPREAD THE WORD. Sharing this social media campaign with YOUR FRIENDS is how this works. DO IT!! Right now!! 

     Behind the scenes:

This groundbreaking show features Full Belly Project crossing the globe developing simple, sustainable solutions that change lives. Taking a different approach to solving and bring awareness to global poverty issues, RePlan it  is an entertaining, enlightening, and uplifting public television series that demonstrates how basic science and ingenuity can empower people around the world. Check out the series on public television in Southern California and online here: http://replanit.tv/
story_txt:
Who we are:
In 2001, MIT fellow and Popular
Mechanics darling Jock Brandis traveled to Mali to fix a small village’s water
treatment system. While there, he came across a woman who informed him of a village need
for an affordable peanut sheller in order to increase their output of the crop
to sell. One year later and several iterations of an obscure Bulgarian peanut shelling design, he completed what is now called the Universal Nut Sheller. In
2003, Brandis teamed with a group of retired Peace Corps volunteers to form
the Full Belly Project.Full Belly Project’s mission is to
support the improvement of economic possibilities for people in global
communities. We address the critical issue of poverty eradication with simple
agricultural technologies, developing and distributing devices that essentially
help people help themselves. Check out our active projects below!      What we need:  FB is at the juncture of growth and stability. We have great ideas, and although we have only a 2.5-person staff, our volunteers in the community and around the world have been instrumental in our success at improving economic opportunities for people in our global community! In order to increase our impact, we’re trying to tidy up our office and workshop. Church groups, boy scouts, volunteers, and neighbors visit daily; making sure our workshop and office are safe and inviting keeps our volunteers happy and provides a creative workspace for ideas, designs, and client meetings.We need your help! We are developing partnerships with some great people and businesses across the globe, and we've been grateful for small grants to launch and maintain our projects overseas. We need upgrades to keep these projects going as well as to maintain an active role in our community at home. We plan to repair tools we have using local businesses, as well as purchase an extra set of welding gear to teach this valuable skill to high school and college students. We will paint the exterior of the building and purchase and install a latex coating for the roof to stop leaks and reduce our electricity bill to cool the building. Furthermore, as we grow, we need a safe, comfortable meeting space to host clients and potential funders.  Most of our labor will come from the volunteers; we simply need the goods.     How we operate:  There are people struggling worldwide. We aim to create self-efficacy in developing or rural economies using locally available materials and sustainable practices. We follow a clear directive in order to stay organized and maintain focus on existing projects while constantly branching out with new ideas.Many prototypes and designs come from our garage in Wilmington, N.C. Volunteers and students are encouraged to offer suggestions and test ideas, honing in on problem-solving skills with a trial-and-error type methodology. Not only does this inspire brainstorming and outside-the-box thinking, it also builds confidence and self-assurance. Because there is no right or wrong way to solve these problems, there is no prospect of failure.     Our Active Projects:    
1)  Peanut
sheller  - Distributed all over Africa, our signature project helps
villagers shell peanuts, their primary source of protein, using a fraction of
the usual time and effort.

2)  Jatropha sheller  -
The same sheller is modified and used to make diesel fuel from the seeds of
the jatropha plant, a sturdy African weed typically used for fencing.
3)  Rocker water pump – The pump, fashioned from old tires, wood, and PVC, uses foot power for irrigation to increase crop yield.
4)  Corn cracker – The device
saves time and effort by cracking whole corn kernels, which would otherwise be discarded by the birds, to use as chicken feed. 
5)  Soap for Hope - Soap
donated by Manila Peninsula hotels is collected and recycled by Holy Family School of
Indang. The repackaged soap, created with a soap press designed by Full Belly,
allows communities to produce and distribute recycled soap products to fend off
disease, promote better health, and generate income.

6)  Cotton gin - In some places
in Africa cotton is a commercial crop; the cotton gins are often loaned to
the villagers for a hefty fee. This simple gin reduces a village’s
dependence on outside businessmen and is more effective at separating the cotton
from the seeds.
7)  Plastic recycling/oven –
Jock is developing a solar-powered press that combines plastic trash (collected
by locals) and local plant material (such as grass or palm fronds) and heats
it to 400 deg F. The repurposed plastic can then be used for shingles,
furniture, school desks and chairs, etc.     Our Stretch Goal: Like any
successful organization, we DO have a long-term plan in place.  As we look
toward the future, we want to expand our staff and plan to hire a Volunteer Coordinator. We get daily queries about peanut
shellers, and we have a plan to hire and train a team of people to send
overseas to work with local groups to get them started. Additional funds would help
us have 8-10 ready to ship at all times by paying for the materials, shop
tools, and defray shipping costs. We have a dream of hiring translators,
technical writers, and engineers to help make the assembly of these products as
seamless as possible. And we'd love to pay off the mortgage on our shop! So, if
we were lucky enough to raise more than our goal right now, we could use it!
     What else you can do:
Go to our
website. Volunteer. Check out our submission to BBC's World Challenge, In a Nutshell, to hear
more about the Full Belly Project. Most importantly, SPREAD THE WORD. Sharing this social media campaign with YOUR FRIENDS is how this works. DO IT!! Right now!! 
     Behind the scenes:This
groundbreaking show features Full Belly Project crossing the globe developing
simple, sustainable solutions that change lives. Taking a different approach to
solving and bring awareness to global poverty issues, RePlan it  is
an entertaining, enlightening, and uplifting public television series that
demonstrates how basic science and ingenuity can empower people around the
world. Check out the series on public television in Southern California and
online here: http://replanit.tv/

story:
**NOTE: The perks are conditional on the restaurant taking off.  If for some reason we are unable to secure enough funding between IndieGoGo and private sources, we will be donating all funds received to the Food Bank.  WE ARE NOT KEEPING ANY MONEY UNLESS WE HIT OUR GOALS**

The Skinny

This is more or less going to be a paraphrased transcript of my video, because that's what it's all about.

My name is Jean-Guy Rouleau, my father is André and my mother Jacqui.

In short, we're trying to start a restaurant.  We've wanted to for many years but never had the right opportunity.

My father was a cook/chef for 20-something years.  My mother has been a waitress and cashier for many years as well.  I've never professionally worked in a restaurant, aside from helping my father, but I have a deep passion for cooking.

We also have great pride in our community and always try to help out when we can.

My father left the industry after he began losing the passion; the people he was working for didn't care about restaurants, they only cared about the money.  We've hosted many events at our home, and those of friends and family. He's always said that he would get back into it, but only if he had his own place, so that he wouldn't run the risk of losing the passion and creativity by having to bend to someone else's will.

Recently, the local "bar" owner has decided to sell.  Many residents are sad to see it go, as are we.  Being that my father and mother both have a lot of experience in the industry, we thought it would be perfect if we were to take over.

The current owner just purchased the restaurant less than a year ago, but has admittedly run it into the ground, so she's selling it.  She tried to turn the restaurant into a bar, but this is not the right neighbourhood for that; we need a restaurant.

This is a once in a lifetime opportunity for us.  What we want to do is bring it back to being a casual dining family restaurant, with strong ties to the community, hence why the current working name is Neighbourhood Grill & Lounge.  (Though that name might change once we get it up and running...it's a close tie with "Our Place".  Imagine the conversation:  "C'mon over to Our Place for dinner!"  How often do you hear people say that, right?)

Since we moved to this community 15 years ago, we have not been strangers: we've helped our neighbours with repairs and renovations, we've donated furniture, clothes and electronics, given away fresh produce from our garden...we've even held BBQs at no cost. We want to continue this giving philosophy with the restaurant, even increasing our community presence and involvement.

The only thing we're missing is money, which is why we're here.

What's In It For Us...And You!

We're asking for $200,000 to hit our goal: this covers the cost of buying her business, plus all the chattels; tables, chairs, kitchen equipment (the most expensive part) and it also covers our start up expenses and a few months of operating expenses, just while we get the place up and running.

It's a flexible funding campaign, so even if we don't hit the $200,000, we'll get the funding (minus IndieGoGo's 9% fee). With that, we'll use it as ammunition to go to a bank or investors to get the remainder.

Check out the perks to the side.  If you happen to be able to, and want to donate more than the perk levels listed, please contact me first - we might be able to work out a custom perk for you based on how much you're looking to give.

Every person who contributes will have their name listed on a special page of our website AND written in a book, placed on a mantle or shelf or somewhere visible in the restaurant.  Contributors of $250 or more will have their names engraved on a plaque which will get hung up on a wall where the book is; after all, without your support we wouldn't be able to do this, and it makes sense that you receive recognition.

We will also maintain a registry of the perks for redemption, so no pesky mailing out vouchers or whatnot.  You give us your info and we write it in a book, you show up with ID (or if you prefer, we could e-mail you a certificate to print), we have you sign the registry to confirm that you redeemed.  Simple.

If for some reason we cannot secure enough funding and the restaurant does not take off, we will not be keeping any of these funds; following our community involvement philosophy, we'll be donating the money to the Food Bank.

What Happens If We Get It?

Once we get up and running, we plan on being very active in the community.  Performing fundraising dinners for down-on-their-luck families.  Providing low-cost meals to low income families during the holidays.  Helping out our local Goodwill with on-the-job training to help people secure employment in the hospitality industry.

The list goes on, but suffice to say that we are very giving and plan on doing all that we can to help the community that helps us.

What If I Don't Have Money To Give?

If you can't help financially, that's okay too!  Just getting the word out and making a ruckus is a fantastic help!

The more people know about this, the more likely we are to reach our goal.  Anything you can do for us is greatly appreciated!

The list goes on, but suffice to say that we are very giving and plan on doing all that we can to help the community that helps us.

If you can't help financially, that's okay too!  Just getting the word out and making a ruckus is a fantastic help!

story:
Reasons to give...

I am asking for donations on behalf of my sister Bri. She was diagnosed with stage 3 melanoma in the Fall of 2012. She lives on her own, far from any family. She's been going to all her appointments and treatments by herself in a truck that is on its last leg. I wish with all my heart that I could just stop everything and just move down there to help her. She is truly a remarkable person, with a huge heart. And she is the best Aunt I could have asked for, for my three girls. If anyone in my family could just buy her a car on their own, we would do it in a heartbeat. So we are asking for any help anyone reading this can give. You would be helping take a huge weight off of her shoulders. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need at least enough for a down payment for a more reliable car. We're not looking for a brand new, fancy vehicle. Just one we don't need to worry about breaking down on her.

Unfortunately we don't have too much to give as perks, but thank you cards and drawings from her neices will definately be involved.

All the donations will go towards getting her a new car. If we (hopefully) go over our goal, the rest will go towards the 20% of her medical bills that she is currently paying out of pocket.

Sincere thank you...

If you can give, even a small amount...thank you from the bottom of my heart. Our family thanks you, and my daughters thank you for helping take any stress out of their Aunt BB's life while she's trying to beat this stupid thing call cancer.

story:
In order to make our clients visiting Port Grimaud and show our properties for sale and for rent we would need to buy a boat... with your help. Would you mind ?

What / Where is Port Grimaud ?

Port Grimaud is a unique "Lakeside Village" in France, also called the French Venice, where every homeowner can moor a boat in front of his or her house. A magical place where people can feel the specific atmosphere of a "French Provençal" village from southeast France.

Port Grimaud is located just in front of St. Tropez in the Gulf. 

We would love to help people all over the world to come and discover Port Grimaud at least once in their lifetime and live a house-with-mooring experience down here for their holidays. 

Port Grimaud is a safe and peaceful city for people who are looking to combine tranquility and wonder during their holiday.

Watch these reports and Ads about Port Grimaud just for pleasure (found on Youtube among a lot of them, see also our gallery) :




Boutemy Immobilier Real Estate offers its services to help its clients to buy, sell or rent their apartment or their house in Port Grimaud. 

We are a dynamic and reliable leading Real Estate Agency since 1998 (Member of FNAIM Network, Freanch National Real Estate Agencies Federation) and expert of Port Grimaud. 

We provide about 60 houses and apartments for rent and also about 60 properties for sale exclusively in Port Grimaud. 

One visit to our office or a phone call will make you appreciate our professionalism and our sense of hospitality and service from our great team.

Thousands of customers have chosen to work with us.

Fisherman's Houses, Balandrine Houses, Cassine or Ostale Houses, Bungalows, Bord de Rive, Mooring, etc., The specific dictionary of Port Grimaud is very well known by us.

Since 2014 we have launched a new image for our company : new logo, new website, extension on the most popular social networks (Facebook, Youtube, Twitter, Dailymotion, Google +). Go visit our website to get an idea of ​​our new image and have a look on our wonderful truly unique properties on http://www.boutemy.co.uk.

Our goal is really to attract more people from around the world to come and discover Port Grimaud for holidays.

This "Little Venice" deserves to be known much more than it is today. Have a look !

We will then be happy to offer to our new clients houses and apartments for rent or for sale during their stay in Port Grimaud.

If we raise enough money thanks to you, we also hope to be able to acquire an apartment or a house in Port Grimaud as a showroom. The purpose of this purchase would be to renovate the property and to rent it to show people our real estate expertise of Port Grimaud. And then we will communicate a lot on this property.

Most of people who will come for holidays will fall in love with Port Grimaud.

Unfortunately, bank loans are totally frozen in France and we have not managed to get any loan to start this project, this is why we need your help !


What We Need

We need to raise about € 1.700.000 to go through the whole global communication campaign.

These € 1.700.000 can be detailed as follows :

- We would need about € 514.000 to prepare, launch, pay and manage the communication campaign (including paid search on internet search engines like Google Adword, specialized magazines of tourism and real estate, communication in specialized press of North America, Northern Europe, South East Asia). 

This campaign would be held over two years : 2015 and 2016.

- If we manage to raise € 1.700.000, we would be able to buy a showroom apartment in Port Grimaud for € 540.000 OR otherwise we would use these funds to increase the budget of the campaign and acquire more potential visitors from all over the world for the next 2 years.

- Then we would have to pay about more or less 18% of fees to Indiegogo (third party fees and additional currency exchange fees included), which will be about € 306.000.

- French VAT (Value Added Tax) 20% : € 340.000

- Total needed to be raised = € 1.700.000

What you get

You get according to the amount of your donation : a discount for a boat rental in Port Grimaud, discounts on a rental of a house or an apartment available from us in Port Grimaud for your next holidays, or a white cap or a sticker marked "In Port Grimaud We Believe" with the legendary blue and green fish of Port Grimaud.

For example, a donation of 50 Euros (about $63) is good for a 10 percent discount on a boat rental in Port Grimaud. A very good deal !

For 150 Euros (about $188), you’ll receive a free apartment or house cleaning (value 135 Euros) plus the 10 percent boat discount.

A 200 Euros (about $250) contribution is rewarded with a 5 percent discount on a one-week house or apartment rental in Port Grimaud plus the 10 percent boat rental discount.

A 500 Euros (about $625) contribution is rewarded with a 10 percent discount on a one-week house or apartment rental in Port Grimaud plus the 10 percent boat rental discount.


And many other deals.

Example of discount for a rental of a fisherman house (house for 6 to 8 people) in August rented with Boutemy Immobilier :

Pricelist : € 2,500 a week (average price in high season for this kind of house).

With a 10% discount, the price will be € 2,250 a week instead of € 2,500 a week.

For larger donors, you will also take advantage of discounts on our fees for the purchase of a house or an apartment in Port Grimaud.

We are so sure you will fall in love with Port Grimaud !

See details of the perks below against.

You have 3 years from the fundraising date to take advantage of your perk. 

In case of a successful fundraising, we may have many happy donors who will wish to get their perk(s). In this case, the donors will be served in the order of the requests received by email.

Enjoy your holidays in Port Grimaud with us !

What you get in case of failure to achieve the objective of funds raised

In case of failure to achieve the objective of the funds raised, we will use the funds raised left to launch a less ambitious but efficient communication campaign (still over the next 2 years), and perks claimed will be still honored. 

The impact

·  This project is very important for our Agency and for Port Grimaud, a unique "Little Venice" listed by UNESCO as an exceptional work of the twentieth century. 

Your contribution would also enable us to start a process of renovation and modernization of Port Grimaud houses. We believe that development of tourism will encourage Port Grimaud’s condominium to invest in the renovation of the town.

If this project works, it will lead to other similar projects in the future and it will have a positive impact in Port Grimaud and Saint Tropez Area. 

By contributing to this project, you are also helping to launch a fundamental movement to get Port Grimaud known worldwide.

If the project works with many donors or even if it financially speaking does not work, it will also help Port Grimaud to be known all over the world thanks to this Indiegogo Crowdfunding campaign and we hope it will boost the number of our holiday rentals and mechanically increase our general business.

· We will show the results of this campaign on our blog http://boutemy-blog.com and our Facebook Page by May 2015 at the latest, and if you agree your name will appear as a donor who helped create a new fresh start for Port Grimaud and of course our Agency.

Risks and Challenges

·  You have to know that we have never done this kind of project that mixes Crowdfunding, Tourism, Holiday Rental and Real Estate. It is a all new and innovative program.

However, we have been working for years with communication agencies in Port Grimaud with of course much more reduced funds. 

·  It will be a lot of work for us to build this campaign but it will be a successful project for sure if we get the funds. The only difficulty is to get those funds, that is why we are looking for your help !

Other ways to help !

We know that everyone will not be able to contribute to our project, but you can still help ! 

Talk about our project to your friends and tell them also to generate ads for our project.

We also need you to help us get Port Grimaud to be known and discovered. Talk around ! Why wouldn't you come to visit Port Grimaud and Saint Tropez Area one day ? For your next holidays ? 

Please come to our agency to say hello !

Feel free to use our communication tools to connect us to you and learn more about us : 

  • Our website (about us, our properties for sale and for rent) : www.boutemy.co.uk
  • Our blog with news from Grimaud, Port Grimaud, Saint Tropez and Sainte Maxime : http://www.boutemy-blog.com
  • Facebook (our everyday life) : https://www.facebook.com/boutemy.immobilier
  • Twitter (the same but in summary) : https://twitter.com/Boutemy_immo
  • Google + : https://plus.google.com/104126459636941344186/videos
  • Youtube (all of our properties in video) : https://www.youtube.com/user/Boutemyimmo
  • Dailymotion (like Youtube) : http://www.dailymotion.com/Boutemy-immobilier 
  • And of course do not forget to use sharing tools from Indiegogo ! These are the most powerful ones for sure ! 
  • Thank you, thank you, and thank you again for your help and attention.

Our goal is really to attract more people from around the world to come and
discover Port Grimaud for holidays. 

This "Little Venice" deserves to be known much more than it is today. Have a look !

We will then be happy to offer to our new clients houses and
apartments for
rent or for sale during their stay in Port Grimaud.
If we raise enough money thanks to you, we also hope to be able to acquire an apartment or a house in Port Grimaud as a showroom. The purpose of this purchase would be to renovate the property and to rent it to show people our real estate expertise of Port Grimaud. And then we will communicate a lot on this property.

Most of people who will come for holidays will fall in love with Port Grimaud.

Unfortunately, bank loans are totally frozen in France and we have not managed
to get any loan to start this project, this is why we need your help !




What We Need


We need to raise about €
1.700.000 to go through the whole global communication campaign.
These € 1.700.000 can be detailed as follows :
- We would need about € 514.000 to prepare, launch, pay and manage the communication
campaign (including paid search on internet search engines like Google Adword, specialized
magazines of tourism and real estate, communication in specialized press of North America, Northern Europe, South East Asia). 
This campaign would be held over two years : 2015 and 2016.
- If we manage to raise € 1.700.000, we would be able to buy a showroom apartment in Port Grimaud for € 540.000 OR otherwise we would use these funds to increase the budget of the campaign and acquire more potential visitors from all over the world for the next 2 years.
- Then we would have to pay about more or less 18% of
fees to Indiegogo (third party fees and additional currency exchange fees included), which will be about € 306.000.
- French
VAT (Value Added Tax) 20% : € 340.000
- Total needed to be raised = €
1.700.000




What you get








You get according to the amount of your donation :
a discount for a boat rental in Port Grimaud, discounts on a rental of a house or an apartment available from us in Port Grimaud for your next
holidays, or a white cap or a sticker marked "In Port Grimaud We Believe" with the legendary blue and green fish of Port Grimaud.


For example, a donation of 50 Euros (about
$63) is good for a 10 percent discount on a boat rental in Port Grimaud. A very good deal !


For 150 Euros (about $188), you’ll receive a free apartment or house cleaning (value 135 Euros) plus the 10 percent boat discount.


A 200 Euros (about $250) contribution is rewarded with a 5 percent
discount on a one-week house or apartment rental in Port Grimaud plus the 10
percent boat rental discount.
A 500 Euros (about $625) contribution is rewarded
with a 10 percent discount on a one-week house or apartment rental in Port Grimaud plus the 10 percent boat rental discount.

And many other deals.
Example of discount for a rental of a fisherman house
(house for 6 to 8 people) in August rented with Boutemy
Immobilier :
Pricelist : € 2,500 a week
(average price in high season for this kind of house).
With a 10% discount, the price
will be € 2,250 a week instead of € 2,500 a week.
For larger
donors, you will also take advantage of discounts on our fees for the purchase
of a house or an apartment in Port Grimaud.
We are so sure you will fall in love
with Port Grimaud !
See details of the perks below
against.
You have 3 years from the
fundraising date to take advantage of your perk. 
In case of a successful fundraising, we may have
many happy donors who will wish to get their perk(s). In this case,
the donors will be served in
the order of the requests received by email.


Enjoy your holidays in Port Grimaud with us !



What you get in case of failure to achieve the objective of funds raised


In case of failure to achieve
the objective of the funds raised, we will use the funds raised left to launch
a less ambitious but efficient communication
campaign (still over the next 2 years), and perks claimed will be still honored. 
The impact




·  This project is very important
for our Agency and for Port Grimaud, a unique "Little Venice" listed by
UNESCO as an exceptional work of the twentieth century. 
Your
contribution would also enable us to start a process of renovation and
modernization of Port Grimaud houses. We believe that development of
tourism will encourage Port Grimaud’s condominium to invest in the renovation
of the town.
If
this project works, it will lead to other similar projects in the
future and it will have a positive impact in Port Grimaud and Saint Tropez Area. 

By
contributing to this project, you are also helping to launch a fundamental
movement to get Port Grimaud known worldwide.
If
the project works with many donors or even if it financially speaking does not work, it will also help Port Grimaud to be known all over the world thanks
to this Indiegogo Crowdfunding campaign and we hope it will boost the number of our
holiday rentals and mechanically increase our general business.
· We will show the results of this
campaign on our blog http://boutemy-blog.com and our Facebook Page by
May 2015 at the latest, and if you agree your name will appear as a donor who
helped create a new fresh start for Port Grimaud and of course our Agency.Risks and Challenges

·  You have to know that we have
never done this kind of project that mixes Crowdfunding, Tourism, Holiday Rental and Real Estate. It is a all new and innovative program.
However, we have been working for years with communication agencies in Port
Grimaud with of course much more reduced funds. 

· 
It will be a lot of work for us to build this campaign but it will be a successful project for sure if
we get the funds. The only difficulty is to get those funds, that is why we
are looking for your help !



Other ways to help !

We know that everyone will not be able to contribute to our project, but you can still help ! 
Talk about our project to your friends and tell them also to generate ads for our project.
We also need you to help us get Port Grimaud to be known and discovered. Talk around ! Why wouldn't you come to visit Port Grimaud and Saint Tropez Area one day ? For your next holidays ? 
Please come to our agency to say hello !
Feel free to use our communication tools to connect us to you and learn more about us : 


Our website (about us, our properties for sale and for rent) : www.boutemy.co.uk

Our blog with news from Grimaud, Port Grimaud, Saint Tropez and Sainte Maxime : http://www.boutemy-blog.com

Facebook (our everyday life) : https://www.facebook.com/boutemy.immobilier

Twitter
     (the same but in summary) : https://twitter.com/Boutemy_immo

Google
     + : https://plus.google.com/104126459636941344186/videos

Youtube
     (all of our properties in video) : https://www.youtube.com/user/Boutemyimmo

Dailymotion
     (like Youtube) : http://www.dailymotion.com/Boutemy-immobilier 

And
     of course do not forget to use sharing tools from Indiegogo ! These are the most
     powerful ones for sure ! 
Thank you, thank you, and thank you again for your help and attention.

story:
Short Summary

Welcome to our campaign.

We are a small, energetic team from Hungary. It is a family-business. 

Gábor is the owner and Gabriella has the swivel chair job in the company. 


For years we have been working with electrical monitoring.

3 years ago we had a baby-boy, Misu. Misu is an Autist.

So, our life has changed.

We slept little. But we learnt a lot.

Over the years we  learnt to say: our child is an Autist.

And we learnt to ask for help. 

Helping an autistic child is very hard because this disability is not always visible.

We found a way how to show people our needs.

We had some T-shirts made for Misu and for us and our world has changed. 


It's like the white cane for the blind.

Without the cane we do not realise that somebody is in need, but as soon as we see the cane we jump there to help.

So we made T-shirts for the whole Autist-parent community and it worked.

Meanwhile we realised that the rest of the family, who help us, could also make use of T-shirts like this to promote proudly that Autism is not a disease, Autism is not a shame, but Autism is the combination of a gift, adventure, love and wisdom.

Our aim is to establish a web-shop in Europe where T-shirts, bags, mugs, stickers, jewellery and other accessories with positive messages would be sold for Autistic children, parents, siblings, grandparents, cousins and developing-teachers. The products would be made on the language of the customer, but they will also be available in English.

Our greatest objective is to make the Autism spectrum state widely known, to help parents like us see the state of their child as a gift and those who are not concerned to accept and support Autistic life.

What We Need & What You Get

To open the web-shop, make the copyright of the trademark and the graphics, to collect the basic stockpile and launch the advertisements we need $12 000.

The production of one T-shirt costs about $11.

The patent fees about $280.

The purchase of legal software and the establishment of the web-shop $1600.

We intend to employ two Autist-mothers with flexible working hours in the web-shop

We are going to send every supporter a thank you letter.

Every supporter over $20 receives a mug.

Supporters over $50 a supporter T-shirt in the selected colour, pattern and size.

Supporters over $100 will get a T-shirt, a mug, and a bag full of love.

The Impact

Our project is not only valuable to the contributors but really is to the whole world.

We would like to help autistic families to get more support and help and also we want to help people who can not see the needs of autistic families.

Autistic kids need acceptance, patience, sense of humour and love. With our T-shirts and other goods they can get them more easily.

    Risks & Challenges

    It is really hard to get acceptance enough in Eastern European countries.

    With the help of our contributors we would like to open people's eyes and we want to talk about the importance of acceptance and learning.

    We do believe in goodness of humans and that they only need some guide how to notice some diasbilities. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We would like to ask you to help our campaign.

    If you can not contribute but find our campaign interesting please talk to your family and friends about it. 

    We are very grateful for every share and support as well.

    Thank you for visiting our campaign, thank you for your help.

    God bless you. 

    Gábor & Gabriella

story:
A different kind of bar on the South Side to serve organic raw juices, breakfast, lunch & dinner

I'm a 98-pound chef who makes much-dreaded super clean and healthy eating tempting and addictive...in a good way. I believe that indulging and comforting everyday food can be tastefully healthy with careful preparation and ingredients nature gives us. I'm excited to announce the launch of my new venture: extraVEGANza Pgh.

For the past two years since I began my solo entrepreneurial journey to do something different, I have transformed and improved the lives of many clients and customers. I now have like-minded people helping me along the way. With their continued support, I'm now able to grow my business and take it to the next level. I'm the chef behind the monthly 14-item vegan brunch series that has received press write-ups (like this recent one linked to two more) and loyal following of customers who pay in advance for 12 months. The brunch gets discovered by out-of-towners from as far as Austin, Texas. No worries...this is not the end of the (brunch) as I understand my brunch is life changing and equals the world to some of you. It will still be served on the second Saturday of every month as always. Breakfast, lunch and dinner will be served five days a week Tuesday through Saturday. If you read this far already, I feel your love and know that this campaign will reach its goal in 21 days.
 

Examples of Menu Items To Expect

All plant-based, wholesome, gluten-free, some raw

Black rice-buckwheat donuts lightly cooked in virgin coconut oil, dipped in cashew-coconut-maple glaze, sprinkled with coconut dust [Stone-ground organic buckwheat is sourced from Weatherbury Farm.]

Teapuccino: Brewed Assam tea infused with fresh coconut milk

Grease-less, steam cooker fried brown rice with carrots, peas, turmeric, light tamari, ginger, garlic, onion, celery. Side of Lacto -fermented vegetables, Cashew-ginger-parsley-scallion pesto and Cold-pressed sesame-hot chili paste

Raw, cold-pressed juices

Hyper-local organic romaine salad with nori-avocado Caesar dressing [I recently got this recipe published on a blog], with pine nut parmesan [Crisp young romaine plants are grown in-house in ceramic bowls]

Cold & hot loose leaf organic teas, ginger tea, house chai tea, herbal teas

Inside-out taco with Swiss Chard leaves and black bean-grain-flex-mushroom meat, topped with mango pico de gallo [Clarion River Organics black beans and corn meal are used in the meat. Mushrooms are soured from Wild Purveyors]

Ever-popular raw zucchini cannelloni with raw cashew ricotta and sun-dried tomato-basil marinara

Smokey slow-roasted parsnip ribs with raisin-apple cider vinegar BBQ sauce, served with broccoli-carrot slaw and creamy ginger-cashew dressing

Raw coconut-banana-berry ice cream

Raw cacao-walnut-date brownies
 

Why I'm Doing This

I grew up in a less-industrialized Southeast Asian country. I learned how to cook at age 11. Every morning, I rode my bicycle to my neighborhood farmers market to grab vegetables, grains, legumes and wild-caught fish. I helped my parents raise a dozen naturally-fed free-range chickens and ducks. We grew herbs, vegetables and fruits. I picked guavas, mangoes, papayas, cherimoyas and jackfruits ripen on the trees.

In pursuit of a degree in journalism, I came to Pittsburgh. I aspired to be a foreign correspondent, traveling and seeing the world but fell in love with culinary arts. With my cuisine, influenced by many different cultures and countries, I take my guests on a journey across the world. A Pittsburgh Post-Gazette food writer called me a "citizen of the world."

Having worked in several restaurants in the East Coast for more than a decade, I do not imagine my own place to be a stuffy conventional bar/ restaurant type. The food will be refined at extraVEGANza Pgh; the ambiance laid back and unpretentious. I'll let my food speak, not the facade of the place. 

So I hail from meat-centric, flour-covered, butter-drowned US restaurant kitchens. This was me... unhappy, depressed in 145-pound body in 2008, working at an upscale casual Italian bistro and making a 21-inch pizza loaded with carbs.

But I turned my life around. By incorporating more plant-based foods  in my diet, I reversed my own health problems resulted from eating whatever was available in restaurant kitchens. I'd like to inspire and help others.

Ways You Can Help

By pre-paying for my products and services, you assure me that everything I plan will fall in place. Goals to achieve in the next two years include: finishing a memoir/ cookbook and getting it published: certifying kosher, green and organic; composting organic fruit and vegetable scraps; continuing to grow some ingredients, like scallions, celery and romaine in re-purposed glass bottles and jars; providing bicyclist discounts and bike racks, continuing to educate the public by offering free/ low-cost cooking demos and workshops, completing my diploma in nutritional therapy. So grab your perks on the right side of this page. Or simply contribute any amount. 

Refer backers to  this campaign and earn from a free donut to 2 free passes to menu pre-view launch dinner party and a gift basket filled with artisan condiments, sauces, fresh buckwheat pasta, teas, spices and nuts.

IMPORTANT: You must be logged into your Indiegogo account and use Indiegogo’s share tools for our analytics to track your referrals. You will be able to check your referrals through your Indiegogo profile.

If your referral claims $30 or $40 perk, you will get a free donut.
If your referral contributes $98 or more but under $500, you are invited to menu pre-view launch dinner party.
If your referral contributes $500 or more, you and a friend are invited to menu pre-view launch dinner party. Plus you'll get a gift basket.

EXTRAS:  Call for voting...send me your free love!

I have entered extraVEGANza Pgh in the second annual SMB Marketing Makeover Contest to win free marketing services.

Two new domain names associated with extraVEGANaa are in another contest to win up to $35,000 and need votes to move up to the next phase to get judged.
The first one, http://www.98PoundChef-Pgh.com will be used as domain that points to extraVEGANza Pgh website.
The second one, http://www.RockUrRawRecipes.com is for blogging my raw recipes that rock your world.

Please send your love that doesn't cost a penny through these voting links:
http://woobox.com/8yid8a/vote/for/6758037
https://verisign.promo.eprize.com/domain/?entry_id=2770
https://verisign.promo.eprize.com/domain/?entry_id=2772

Press

Vegans Save the World I April 2015: An Evolution of Eating

Muddy Melissa's Musings I April 2015: Vegan Brunch Review

Pittsburgh Magazine I April 2015: Donate Now: 6 Worthy Pittsburgh Food Startups

Pittsburgh Tribune Review I Jan 2015: Dining News: Valentine's Day Brunch Wonderaddo I Jun 2014: Try new foods at Chef Mya's family-friendly vegan brunch
Pittsburgh Magazine I Jan 2014: A la carte > Mya Zeronis
Muddy Melissa's Musings I Jan 2014 : Vegan brunch with Chef Mya Zeronis
Pittsburgh Post-Gazette I Sept 2013: Cook and learn at pop-up dinner
Pop City Media I Sept 2013: From farm tables to city lots, it's a new scene in dining
Edible Allegheny I Aug 2013: Worldly Menu

Vegan Recipes

Azula I Mar 27 2015: [See #3] 5 Healthy Seaweed Recipes You Should Try This Weekend
The Brazen Kitchen I July 2013: Chilled Raw Avocado Cucumber Soup
Market District Shadyside I Chili Cook-Off 2012 Winner: Sriracha-Spiced Vegan Chili with Coconut Rice

story:
Open source and easy to use, BUDDY protects your home, entertains your kids, & helps you stay connected with the ones you love. 














Here at Blue Frog Robotics, we believe that an awesome team is the key to an incredible project.


In addition to our core team, we have partnered with industry experts, notably with Jabil Circuit Inc. (JBL), the third largest global Electronic Manufacturing Services (EMS) company based in US ($15.8 billion FY14 Revenue).

Now we’re excited to build a product that can change the way people interact with robots.



Getting started

If I have a question, how I can reach your team?

Do not hesitate to contact us for any questions. For questions regarding BUDDY, your perk, the Developer Program, or the campaign itself, the Blue Frog Robotics Team can be reached indiegogo@bluefrogrobotics.com 

Who is BUDDY designed for?

BUDDY is designed for everyone : Adults, Kids, Seniors, Geeks and Developers.

How easy is it to set up and use BUDDY?

Yes, BUDDY is easy to use and operate. Simplicity and accessibility are the core of our product.

How tall is BUDDY? How heavy?

BUDDY is 22’ tall and weighs about 11 pounds (56cm; 5kg).

Can I give BUDDY a different name?

For now, you will have to call him by his name BUDDY to interact with him. Name customization will be available in the future.

Can I customize BUDDY's appearance?

Yes, you can make BUDDY uniquely yours by customizing his facial expressions. More accessories to customize will be sold separately. Have fun customizing your BUDDY!

Does BUDDY come with local storage?

Yes, BUDDY will allow you to store 32GB locally.

How durable is BUDDY?

BUDDY is a robust robot, built to handle most common shocks. However like all electronic devices, you should treat BUDDY with care.

What colors are available for BUDDY?

Currently BUDDY is white, but there are plans to introduce other colors in the future.

What languages does BUDDY speak?

BUDDY currently understands French and English. Future versions of BUDDY will be able to communicate in other languages. BUDDY owners can download software updates through Google Play Store for more languages, including Japanese, Mandarin Chinese, Korean, Italian, German, Portuguese, Spanish and Russian.

How does BUDDY move?

BUDDY moves autonomously on his built-wheels at speeds up to 70cm/sec. BUDDY can rotate his head in all directions, enhancing how he interacts with you.

BUDDY is completely wireless and moves by himself throughout your home. BUDDY can travel from room to room to patrol. He can also move alongside you as you walk using his motorized wheels.

When you’re away, you can control BUDDY remotely through a mobile app on your smartphone. See through his eyes via the camera and move him around.

How does BUDDY navigate around the house?

BUDDY is equipped with a wide range of sensors: BTLE, 3D camera, ultrasound, infra-red sensors and thermal sensors. To navigate, BUDDY uses these sensors to map the room, move around while avoiding obstacles and familiarise himself with your home. BUDDY will stop before running into objects in front of him. He will also stop before going over a stairway or other surface drop off.

Can BUDDY communicate wirelessly to my devices?

You can play audio, video and photo content on your devices directly from BUDDY. He is compatible with a large array of devices that are WiFi / Bluetooth enabled.

Can I access BUDDY from outside of my house (remotely)?

Of course. You can interact with BUDDY remotely by sending a message or via your smartphone, tablet or PC.

Does BUDDY's app work with iOS, Android, Windows mobile devices?

Yes. BUDDY will have his own mobile app and can be downloaded for free on any smartphone that is compatible with iOS, Android and Windows devices.

Can I control BUDDY with several smartphones or computer?

Several phones, tablets or computers can control the same BUDDY. Your BUDDY mobile app will notify you if someone else is already actively using BUDDY.

Does BUDDY communicate with other robots?

BUDDY can communicate with other BUDDY robots and all the BUDDYs will have their own social network. We plan to launch mybuddyworld.com in 2016. It will be a social network for your BUDDYs allowing them to interact with each other and share photos & videos.

Which wireless networks will support BUDDY?

All BUDDYs are connected via both Bluetooth and WiFi.

Does BUDDY require a WiFi connection?

No. You can use BUDDY if you don’t have a WiFi connection. However, some features such as remote control and alert notifications won't be available without WiFi connection.

BUDDY can create his own WiFi network to connect to your smartphone, tablet, PC and other smart devices. He can access to content stored on them; like photos, music and video.

BUDDY Apps

Where will I be able to download BUDDY apps?

BUDDY mobile apps will be available in the Google Play Store. If your favorite apps run on Android and are available in the Google Play Store, they will also run on BUDDY.

What apps will be available for BUDDY?

Almost all existing Android apps in the Google Play Store will work on BUDDY. Developers will also be able to adapt their apps for BUDDY to provide an even better experience. Developers can innovate and create new apps. The possibilities are endless with some imagination! Apps for games, music, TV, video calls, home security can be created for BUDDY.

What will the Classic Edition include?

The BUDDY Classic Edition comes with features such as centralized agenda, multi-alarm clock, telepresence, audio and video play, games and learning supports for children, hands-free helper, home security and patrolling, and connects to most of your smart home devices.

Smart home devices supported : Parrot Flower Power / Withings Blood Pressure monitor, Aura, Smart Body Analyser / Nest thermostat, Protect / Netatmo Thermostat, Wheather station / MyFox Home Alarm / LifFx Light / Holi Sleep Companion, Smart Lamp…and more to come.

Developer Program and the SDK

How is the Developer Edition different from the Classic Edition?

Developers will have early access to our SDK, including libraries, headers, documentation, samples for integrating BUDDY and most importantly, the support of our team. Developers are also the first to receive BUDDY upon shipping.

What programming language do I need to know?

The SDK will be a graphical tool for programming and is easily accessible. Prior knowledge of 3D Unity, C++, C# and the JavaScript programming languages is beneficial. Even you don’t have basic programming skills (or are a beginner), you will be able to create simple apps. Anyone can create behaviors simply by dragging and dropping actions from the library or creating customized boxes and saving them to custom libraries.

How do I get information and support as a developer?

When you pre-order a BUDDY Developer Edition, you will become a full member of our BUDDY Developers community. We hope that you will help BUDDY to become an indispensable companion robot. We want to make your BUDDY apps and content come to life and are committed to working with you to make these tools truly exceptional.

Is the software open source?

There is a part of open-source with 3D unity language programming. Most of the BUDDY's platform will be open source including all you need to create new applications and accessories.

Battery life and Usage

How does BUDDY charge?

BUDDY will be battery-ready.

How long does the battery last?

BUDDY works hard. Like any device, battery life expectancy will depend on usage, but BUDDY can operate for up to 10 hours with typical usage.

BUDDY recharges extremely fast and a dock station is available for purchase.

Does BUDDY charge automatically?

Yes, if you have the docking station sold separately. When the battery is low, BUDDY navigates back autonomously to his docking station.

Does BUDDY have and On/Off function?

BUDDY turns on and off by pushing the button on his head. You can tell BUDDY to go to rest or to sleep. BUDDY will only wake up when you ask him to.

Accessories

When will accessories be available for BUDDY?

Some accessories for BUDDY are available, such as docking station, arms and pico-projector (Digital Light Processing / WVGA / 16lm /60" maximum display), and will ship in December 2016.

You will be able to purchase a number of accessories for BUDDY. These include functional accessories, as well as fun items that allow you to customize the appearance of your BUDDY or add accessories making your life easier.

Privacy and Security

Can BUDDY sleep? 

Yes, he can sleep. You wake BUDDY by touching his screen. While sleeping, BUDDY does not listen nor watch anything. BUDDY 100% respects your privacy.

How does BUDDY store information?

All the private data recorded by BUDDY is stored into the robot memory. Users can activate the backup on BUDDY's interface to make a secure copy of the data online, on a secure cloud.

What data does BUDDY store?

BUDDY stores information about interaction to recognize his environment and his family.

How about Privacy?

We truly believe that privacy is sacred. We are doing our utmost to firmly secure any data that goes online. The communication between BUDDY and his users is encrypted and not stored.

How is this secured?

We do not communicate the tool we are using as it is the first wall of safety. However, we use encryption for any private exchanges.

Does someone else can control my BUDDY?

To remotely control your BUDDY, you must log in with a unique and secure username and password. You are the only one that can control him. When calling someone through the app, the receiver has to explicitly accept the call.

What data do we store?

We do not store any personal data. On demand, we store your backup data on a secure cloud that only you can access. With your permission, we only collect anonymous technical data in order to enhance the BUDDY user experience.

Production and Shipping

Where is BUDDY produced?

We are based in Paris so we design, produce and assemble BUDDY entirely in France and Europe. We work with one of the best global full service EMS contract manufacturers, Jabil Circuit Inc. (JBL), to ensure that our products are shipped directly after production.

When will BUDDY ship?

- Classic & Premium Edition of BUDDY will ship in December 2016.

Actual shipping dates may vary. The Blue Frog Robotics Team will keep you updated of your BUDDY shipping date.

Where does BUDDY ship?

We currently ship to the US, Canada, EU (all 28 countries), Switzerland, Australia, , Japan, Singapore, Taïwan, Hong Kong & Republic of Korea. We are currently evaluating other countries to start shipping to at a later time!

Is a transport case included when I purchase BUDDY?

The transport case will be an accessory available later for your BUDDY.

Credits

Who did your movie?

We worked closely with Franck de Visme for our movie.

Who did your music?

We worked closely with Marie Muller for our music.

Who did your website?

We worked closely with Antoine Gaboriau for our website.

Who did you work with on the industrial design for BUDDY?

We worked closely with OVA Design.

Contact

I'm a distributor/retailer, how do I contact you?

We are accepting inquiries regarding future distribution opportunities via email at distributor@bluefrogrobotics.com. Thank you for your interest in BUDDY!

Join us in the movement to take personal robotics to the next level!

THANK YOU!
story_txt:
Open source and easy to use, BUDDY protects your home, entertains your kids, & helps you stay connected with the ones you love. 


























Here at Blue Frog Robotics, we believe that an awesome team is the key to an incredible project.


In addition to our core team, we have partnered with industry experts, notably with Jabil Circuit Inc. (JBL), the third largest global Electronic Manufacturing Services (EMS) company based in US ($15.8 billion FY14 Revenue).
Now we’re excited to build a product that can change the way people interact with robots.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, we're the Austin Panic Room the city's first and premier live escape game established by local students and alumni of the University of Texas at Austin. Since our establishment in August 2014, we aim to provide a fun team building activity for the people and businesses in this great city of Austin, Texas. This city is nothing short of our home and our community. 

As some of you may know, torrential rains have caused over 37.3 trillion gallons of water to fall over the state of Texas in the month of May this year alone. This has caused 22 deaths in our state and countless homes and businesses to be flooded/displaced. With such devastation in our community, the Austin Panic Room will pledge $1,000.00 and up to another $1,000.00 in dollar for dollar matching donations through this Indiegogo portal to the Memorial Weekend Flood Fund hosted by the Austin Disaster Relief Network.

No small business stands alone, apart from the community that surrounds it and this is one of the ways that we at Austin Panic Room want to give back. Join us in helping to rebuild our city and our community.


What We Need & What You Get

As mentioned above:

  • We pledge $1,000 to the Austin Disaster Relief Network
  • We will match any donations raised here dollar for dollar (up to another $1,000)

Austin Disaster Relief Network is a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization and donations are tax deductible. 100% of your donation will be applied towards Disaster Relief efforts. 90% of these funds will be applied towards meeting the needs of disaster survivors, 10% applied towards the coordination of relief efforts. None of the Memorial Weekend Flood relief funds will be used for promotional expenses. On rare occasions, donations may exceed the particular needs for a specific disaster.  When this occurs, contributions will be used to coordinate, prepare for and serve victims of other disasters within the Central Texas area.

We promise we won't make a dime off of any of this (in fact we'll be paying the 9% Indiegogo fundraising fees from our own pockets) and our goal is for 100% of the money raised go directly to help those impacted by the floods.


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Here are a few other ways you can help Central Texas flood victims, either by donating or volunteering (courtesy of KVUE):

  • Tell others about our campaign!
  • Give to or volunteer directly with the Austin Disaster Relief Network (the fund's name is the Memorial Weekend Flood Fund. Go to the organization's website to donate.
  • The United Way of Hays County is accepting monetary donations. Donate through the webpage or text "FLOODS" to 41444 to make a donation.
  • Serve San Marcos is asking for volunteers to help with cleanup. Go here for more information.
  • The American Red Cross is in need of volunteers. Go here to find out how you can become one.
  • A community Facebook page has surfaced where affected residents are seeking help restoring their homes. Check out the Austin Flood 2015 Relief page.
Thanks for partnering with us to serve and rebuild our community!

story:
Buttons. Pins. Macarons. Badges. What are we talking about?

Buttons are small shapes that can be attached to different surfaces.  The front of a button can bear any artwork, photo, message, textile or flat object under plastic.  

Needs

To make buttons efficiently I need a precision-tooled press with metal dies which I will operate with a hand-cranked lever: a button maker.  I also need a cutter, for cutting out perfect paper circles, and button parts.

  • 2.25" button maker - $275
  • 2.25" graphic punch for cutting artwork - $200
  • hardware to make 1000 pin back buttons - $85
  • shipping - $40
  • crowd funding campaign fees- $66

Prizes

When you contribute to The Button Project, you will receive at least six 2 1/4" round buttons, a 10% discount on your button orders for a whole year, and a strong sense of uncensored independence. Local contributors are invited to use the machine themselves any time they want to try their hand at button making.  Every contribution level is eligible for more free stuff if we exceed the funding goal of $666 (see below).

Five contributors will have the option of getting THEIR button design sent to every other participant (The Soapbox).

Five people can get 25 buttons with an image designed to their specifications by a graphic artist (The Happy Ending).

One lucky and generous person will get to name the machine (Naming Rights).

If all of our funds don't add up to $666, I will finance the rest myself within six months - every contributor is guaranteed to get buttons.

If we exceed the funding goal by

  • $100: every contributor will receive a one of a kind 2.25" pocket mirror.
  • $200: every contributor will also receive a one of a kind 2.25" bottle opener
  • $300: every contributor will also receive a one of a kind 2.25" magnet

So please choose a perk that tickles you, share this campaign with your friends, and get free stuff.

All shipping is included.

The Greatest Idea Ever

By using crowdfunding to start this project I hope to foster a sense of community and interest in the machine.  Button making is an act of independence.  Because the badges can attach to anything and look sharp, they are portable message boards that garner constant attention.  If you have access to a button maker, you have freedom from all censorship and restrictions to choose what to post almost anywhere.

Your contribution includes you in a community, gives you access to buttons and discounts for a whole year, and makes a lovely birthday present.  

I'll be super good at running this business because of my natural talents for organizing and crafting. I have been a professional administrator since 2005. I spend much of my free time sewing, growing plants, writing and drawing.

There are a few businesses in Ottawa that make custom buttons, but most do not offer the 2.25" round size and none of them boast my singular charm. The button maker comes with a lifetime warranty, and is easy to resell in the unlikely event that The Button Project does not totally explode with popularity.  

In addition to pin back buttons, the machine can make mirrors, for looking backwards, magnets, for attracting, bottle openers, for slaking a pressing thirst, and more.  

I have partnered with a graphic artist for creating custom buttons, and will also make one of a kind buttons with original artwork and found images from vintage magazines and textiles.  I can even make fabric-covered buttons, and am looking into matte plastic coating instead of shiny, to give my buttons a unique and very classy look.

Other ways to participate

Whether or not you can contribute today, please share this link with anyone who has a message to share. Give your friends a chance to score some buttons and discounts, and get their message across in a fun way.

If you are a community organization in need of some buttons, contact me. I will donate 10% of the number of buttons sold to a needy cause or causes.

Leave a comment to enter to win a free button. Answer the question What would you put on a button?, say where you shared this campaign, or ask a question of your own.  Every two weeks I will do a draw for a free button prize!  The first draw is on February 8th.

Thanks, thanks, thanks.
