$200: every contributor will also receive a one of a kind 2.25" bottle opener
$300: every contributor will also receive a one of a kind 2.25" magnet

So please choose a perk that tickles you, share this campaign with your friends, and get free stuff.
All shipping is included.


The Greatest Idea Ever
By using crowdfunding to start this project I hope to foster a sense of community and interest in the machine.  Button making is an act of independence.  Because the badges can attach to anything and look sharp, they are portable message boards that garner constant attention.  If you have access to a button maker, you have freedom from all censorship and restrictions to choose what to post almost anywhere.
Your contribution includes you in a community, gives you access to buttons and discounts for a whole year, and makes a lovely birthday present.  
I'll be super good at running this business because of my natural talents for organizing and crafting. I have been a professional administrator since 2005. I spend much of my free time sewing, growing plants, writing and drawing.
There are a few businesses in Ottawa that make custom buttons, but most do not offer the 2.25" round size and none of them boast my singular charm. The button maker comes with a lifetime warranty, and is easy to resell in the unlikely event that The Button Project does not totally explode with popularity.  
In addition to pin back buttons, the machine can make mirrors, for looking backwards, magnets, for attracting, bottle openers, for slaking a pressing thirst, and more.  
I have partnered with a graphic artist for creating custom buttons, and will also make one of a kind buttons with original artwork and found images from vintage magazines and textiles.  I can even make fabric-covered buttons, and am looking into matte plastic coating instead of shiny, to give my buttons a unique and very classy look.


Other ways to participate
Whether or not you can contribute today, please share this link with anyone who has a message to share. Give your friends a chance to score some buttons and discounts, and get their message across in a fun way.
If you are a community organization in need of some buttons, contact me. I will donate 10% of the number of buttons sold to a needy cause or causes.
Leave a comment to enter to win a free button. Answer the question What would you put on a button?, say where you shared this campaign, or ask a question of your own.  Every two weeks I will do a draw for a free button prize!  The first draw is on February 8th.
Thanks, thanks, thanks.

story:
Help us democratize access to funding through a mutual guarantee fund

We are looking for $30k to establish the fund.

The money will be used as a guarantee for a loan to an entrepreneur selected by his/her peers.

Please consider contribute, because this entrepreneur could be you: you today, or you tomorrow if you are just getting started, or maybe the you from a few years ago when you were looking for funding for your venture. And if this entrepreneur is not you, you should contribute because entrepreneurs are the vital force of our economy, and we need to promote entrepreneurship to build a better future for every one of us.

If you are reading this, you have done half of the work, please consider giving $25 or more to this cause.


Our Story

Today 80% of entrepreneurs looking for money to start their business are not being helped: they are too early stage for banks and they do not fit the very narrow scope of Angel Investors or Venture Capitalists. So in most cases they use their own money, or money from friends or family, or credit cards. 

As an example, data from the 2009 Inc 500/5000 list shows that for the top 5000 fastest growing companies in the US money is coming from a combination of the following sources:

- 87% personal savings
- 26% friends and family
- 23% angel investors
- 22% credit cards
- 18% bank loans

This is a huge slice of the entrepreneurial population that is not being serviced. 

Since not everybody has money of their own, or friends or family with money, and since credit cards are expensive, it is leaving many would-be entrepreneurs out of the entrepreneurial opportunity.

The Entrepreneur Commons Mutual Guarantee Fund is bringing abundance thinking to this ecosystem. Instead of focusing on selecting the best few (scarcity thinking), Entrepreneur Commons welcomes everybody and let entrepreneurs grow to the best they can be. It works, it scales and it sends a clear message to all that entrepreneurship can be an option for them too.

The Entrepreneur Commons Mutual Guarantee Fund is a project of Community Ventures, a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization that grew out of Michael Shuman’s book, Going Local: Creating Self-reliant Communities in a Global Age (hardcover by Free Press, 1998; paperback by Routledge, 2000). The book elaborates principles and policies for community economic development through the support of locally owned small businesses that are rooted in and dedicated to the communities where they are located and that prevent leakage of local dollars.

Entrepreneur Commons is a not-for-profit organization providing peer-support to entrepreneurs in the form of small chapters of 5 to 7 people who meet on a regular basis to help each other. The organization went from 2 chapters in 2009 to 19 chapters around the world (Americas, Asia and Europe) in 2010.

We are now bringing funding into this ecosystem through a mutual guarantee fund pulled from entrepreneurs-members, plus their friends, family and supporters, that will be used as a guarantee for loans, to help projects within Entrepreneur Commons.


The Impact

With a Mutual Guarantee Fund providing a guarantee for loans, we can give entrepreneurs that are not being helped otherwise an opportunity to get their business going.

While this campaign is for a small amount, it is a big step forward, the impact is huge: 

1. From the entrepreneur prospective it sends a clear message that help is on the way, and that starting a business can be accessible to everybody if we implement the right process. The mutual guarantee fund removes the current existing barrier that you cannot get outside help to start your business in 80% of the cases. The community of entrepreneurs selects the project with the most chances of success and use the guarantee to establish a loan to make this business successful. It is a virtuous circle: once the members of Entrepreneur Commons select one of their peer, they will make sure he is successful with his project so that the money can be used to guarantee the next loan, and the next one, etc...

2. From the partner bank prospective it helps resolve 2 issues related to small business loans: underwriting and collection.

- Underwriting is done through peer-selection, which brings scale to the process

- Collection is helped by the fact that the entrepreneurs getting the loans are members of a support group. They attend meetings on a regular basis, we know who they are, how they manage their project, and how the project is doing over time.

The concept of Mutual Guarantee Funds is not new: it has been used successfully in Europe since 1917, and related loans have a very low default rate of 0% to 5%. The banks are so comfortable with the concept there that the guarantee typically represents between 2% and 8% of the total amount of loans. 

And the advantage of the Mutual Guarantee Fund is that it can be re-used over and over. Once we start, and as long as default rates are within a reasonable range, we can help entrepreneurs forever by recycling the guarantee.

Ultimately the impact is jobs creation - if we help businesses get off the ground through this process, we will contribute to bringing jobs back into the economy at a very low cost.


What We Need & What You Get

For this campaign, we are raising $30,000 so that we can do one loan for $25,000 dollars and showcase the process. 

This $25k amount is coming from another statistic from the Inc 500/5000 list of fatest growing companies in the US, which is that the average capital needed by companies to make the top 5000 list is $25k. 

Once we raise the $30k, and after fees to cover the cost of the campaign (Indiegogo, Community Ventures, Entrepreneur Commons), we will have $25k that we will use for a guarantee for a loan that will be managed by a partner bank.

Entrepreneurs from the Entrepreneur Commons chapters will select who among them should get the loan, and we will tell our partner bank to make the loan to this entrepreneur.

Your contribution is your opportunity to participate in the implementation of a new model to finance entrepreneurs who do not get access to funding otherwise.

Entrepreneur Commons Mutual Guarantee Fund is a project of Community Ventures. Funds will be received and managed by Community Ventures. Community Ventures is a 501c3 organization and your donation may be tax deductible. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you can contribute dollars to this campaign or not, please spread the word and forward this request to anyone you know who is an entrepreneur or is interested in bringing jobs back into the economy through entrepreneurship. 

Contributing to the campaign can be as simple as sending an email.

Thank you for your help.


For more infornation on Community Ventures: http://c-ventures.org/

For more information on Entrepreneur Commons: http://www.entrepreneurcommons.org

story:
The goal of this program is to form community through working the land. The focus is on two groups, the youth and the elders of our town. The purpose of this project is to bring the youth and the elderly together to work the land with a common goal; to plant nurture and harvest crops.
This project will enhance the opportunities for multi-generational families to learn and work together.
The program includes education seminars, practical workshops and field trips learning about:
Land Conservation through Sustainable Farming Permaculture; planting a sustainable and edible landscape Traditional Native American farming practices
The harvest will be shared with those in the elder community who may not have access to, or be able to afford, fresh local produce. That which is not distributed will be sold to market, farmers market, food cooperatives and restaurants, to help support and augment the project, with the goal of becoming self sustaining.
All involved will learn skills that are both useful and practical while experiencing the excitement of growing beautiful and useful plants, in community for community. Individuals have the opportunity to provide for themselves and others by assisting in food production.

story:
Our Story

My name is Suzy V and I have a huge passion for helping others. I'm apart of Church on the Journey and we've been raising money for over 2 years to build an orphanage in Nyeri, Kenya.  This July we have the life-changing opportunity to go to Kenya and make this dream a reality. 
The Impact
Our primary purpose in going to Kenya is to assist in getting Belwop Rescue Center up and running. This orphanage will house up to a 100 children, feed them, educate them and set them up to live out the incredible dreams that God has for their lives. 
Each day we will be working hard on the new Belwop Rescue Center building. Then during the nights we will be doing various programs and activities with the kids. Our goal is to give them a great new home as well as show them the love of Christ by building strong relationships with them and showering them with love and care. 
Church on the Journey has worked hard to raise money for this orphanage, and without your support we won't be able to travel to Kenya and build these orphans a new home. 


What We Need & What You Get

First, I need my friends and family to pray for me. Second, I need your financial assistance.  My total cost for this trip is $4,000.  I am asking you to prayerfully consider making a one-time gift. 
By March 11, I need to raise 2,500 for a plane ticket. The remaining money will go towards lodging, food, and other transportation.  I've also created perks for those who give. If you give $10, I'll give you a personal shout out on facebook/twitter. If you give $25, I'll give you the previous shout out plus a personalized postcard from Kenya. If you give $50, I'll give you the previous plus a photo of a child who will live in the Belwop Recuse Center. If you give $100, I'll give you a personal shout out on facebook and twitter plus a 30 minute photo session of your choice. If you give $300, I'll give you a 90 minute photo session including a cd of edited photos. (*Must live in Phoenix area.)  


Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by promoting my campaign on facebook, twitter, email, and any other social media. Let's create a network that's excited about getting this orphanage built!

story:
We are the Mason family! We are a special needs adoptive family in Texas. We have adopted a total of seven children! Five of those children are special needs. Our family lost one of our precious children in 2010. We miss her more than words can say. We also have two grown children (both serving in the United States Army) and have four little ones at home. Our beautiful daughter Christina, is eleven years old and has a condition called hydranencephaly. She was born missing most of her brain. She is truly a miracle child and is happy and healthy. To read more about Chrissy, go to www.hydranencephaly.jigsy.com.  Our son, Stephen is nine years old and has level T7 Spina Bifida. Stephen is paraplegic an has both a manual wheelchair and a power chair to help him get around. He is very active and loves going out in the community and participating in sports.  Joshua is two years old and was adopted 9 months ago by his family. He is also Spina Bifida and his first wheelchair is currently on order. He is a happy little guy and can't wait to get out and about in his new chair! And the latest little Mason addition is Sophia, who also was born with hydranencephaly, like her big sister Chrissy. She is six months old now, but will be big enough for a wheelchair next year.

Currently, the Mason's are making do with a wheelchair lift equipped van that they bought used three years ago (it is a 2000 Chevy) when they only had Chrissy and Stephen in wheelchairs. But now that their family has grown, they will not be able to transport all the children at once in the van they own.

Raising four little ones with disabilities takes a lot of time and most of the familiy's extra money!  Please help the Mason family raise enough funds to purchase an extended van,  put a wheelchair lift on it, and add four sets of tie downs for the wheelchairs, so they can travel together to medical appointments, church and on family outings! If enough funds are raised, they plan to donate the van they currently own to another family in need of a lift van!

Thanks so much for all your help!! To read more about the Mason family you can go to www.earthhasnosorrow.blogspot.com.  If you can find it in your heart to help, our family will be forever grateful!  Thanks and have a blessed day!

story:
Our story

We are  running a small business, producing electrical equipment and especially doing R&D in systems for the production of electrical energy.
Together with a team of freelancing partners we developped various electric and electronic systems in the past, such as:

Infrared heating
Medical electronics
Please find some of them on the little snapshot.

Some years ago, a friend came to visit me.
After a while he lamented that a bunch of rats are going to take over his property. He asked me: Manfred, what can I do?

I replied: Well, where‘s the problem?
There are many models of traps and rat repellers in the market. Why don’t you  just buy one?
He agreed and said to have tried out several of these systems, but with no sustaining result.

Now we had to start thinking!

First of all we needed to study the current technologies. The big majority works with ultrasonic waves.
Good or not good? We think:  NO!
Ultrasonic waves are emanated with an extreme volume-level, similar to a starting jet plane. We as human beings cannot hear these waves, as our ear accepts  up to max.20.000 cycles per second only. Everything beyond that we don’t hear.

Not so with small animals. Imagine your pets, guineapigs, hamsters or other rodents have to suffer under an extremely loud  sound with high frequency. Would you like them to?

A second method is to emanate electric fields to keep rats and mice away from their hideaways.
Also, there is the idea to produce negative ions in the air to make rats believe there is an upcoming storm; consequently they should go away.

The solution:
The basic problem is that rats are very intelligent animals and they find out – after a while – that the threat they are facing is not a persistent one.

Our task in this problem accordingly was to find a method to keep the rats in constant fright and indisposition – based on a random „information“ we wanted to give to them.

What we are using is a blend of technology and nature.

Please permit that we do not open the details behind this invention and make it public by now. The reason is, that there is an armada of knowledgeable people outside who would immediately start to copy our idea. Please allow us to delay this process to be ahead of the crowd - at least for a little while. Thank you for your acceptance.


The team:

Manfred R.   frontman , R&D

Julia R.          marketing and sales

John P.          engineering, R&D

Thomas H.   engineering, manufacturing

Norbert G.   media, design


The product
The result of our R&D work you can see in the video as a prototype. The outer design will be totally different.

The product will of course work in  farmhouses with stables, food storages, public places. But it works of course in any place.

The money we want to collect will be spent for new electronics which can be produced in series for smaller money then. Also, the design of the housing will be totally different and state of the art. The Rat Repeller will be made to meet all important international standards.

How to market?

It is not our plan to set up a big manufacturing plant.
As you can see in the list with the perks on the right side, we would prefer to find licensees all over the world who then produce their own product – based on our ideas. Or, may be they prefer to cooperate with us for improvements, including additional and new technologies in this matter.

Who are the typical customers?

The Rat Repeller will be ideal for farms, storehouses, warehouses and all spots where food or agricultural products are stored or handled.


Crowd funding devolves into crowd manufacturing!

This is why we need your kind help NOW.

Are you convinced that there is a problem with rats in the world?

Would you like to contribute to a sustainable solution?

Shall we bring the product into the real world?

Or – are you even interested in a dealership or a license agreement?
Excellent!
Let’s go!



We really appreciate every contribution to our campaign and say thank you.

If you cannot make use of our product or campaign by yourself, please tell your friends who probably will be in need for a product like this.

Thank you for your attention!


We will be pleased to receive from you more innovative ideas and suggestions. If our email response once will take a few days longer, we ask for friendly acceptance. Thanks!


The ratrepeller2.0 team



FAQ:

What will you do with the money received?

Approx. 11.000 $ will be spent for  state of the art  electronics.

5000 $ for a new housing...

3000 $ for charges (indiegogo,bank, paypal)

4000 $ for perks (including rat repeller 2.0 units)

5000 $ for the first series of rat repeller 2.0

The Rat Repeller will be made to meet all important international standards.How to market?It is not our plan to set up a big manufacturing plant.As you can see in the list with the perks on the right side, we would prefer to find licensees all over the world who then produce their own product – based on our ideas. Or, may be they prefer to cooperate with us for improvements, including additional and new technologies in this matter.Who are the typical customers?The Rat Repeller will be ideal for farms, storehouses, warehouses and all spots where food or agricultural products are stored or handled.Crowd funding devolves into crowd manufacturing!This is why we need your kind help NOW.Are you convinced that there is a problem with rats in the world?Would you like to contribute to a sustainable solution?Shall we bring the product into the real world?Or – are you even interested in a dealership or a license agreement?Excellent!Let’s go!We really appreciate every contribution to our campaign and say thank you.If you cannot make use of our product or campaign by yourself, please tell your friends who probably will be in need for a product like this.Thank you for your attention!We will be pleased to receive from you more innovative ideas and suggestions. If our email response once will take a few days longer, we ask for friendly acceptance. Thanks!The ratrepeller2.0 teamFAQ:What will you do with the money received?Approx. 11.000 $ will be spent for  state of the art  electronics.5000 $ for a new housing...3000 $ for charges (indiegogo,bank, paypal)4000 $ for perks (including rat repeller 2.0 units)5000 $ for the first series of rat repeller 2.0

story:
SAVE the HIPPIES! -- Adam & Leslie Thank You!

Adam & Leslie have this kooky notion -- that perhaps folks'd have an interest in helping them with rent arrears -- in exchange for artworks & profound gratitude.

They're enduring a housing court case after income challenges following Leslie's bout with cancer -- successfully cured with surgery -- & their adopted store cat Zoubi's end of life expenses -- Zoubi succumbed to cancer last year, at age 21 --

Adam's lived in his apartment for 44 years. Leslie's lived there with Adam since 1985, as Mrs. Alexander since 1986. They'd like to continue to dwell there on an ongoing basis & are amidst various arrangements to ensure that it can happen --

Adam, a bohemian mathematician, is the inventor of Ideal Toys' official sequel to Rubik's Cube, Alexander's Star. 

Adam Alexander's fractal artworks may be found online at his "Mathematicality" Facebook fan site, & on display at the Fuse Gallery's site.

Leslie's drawn comix & written about art & in recent years made wearable art -- & far as anyone knows she was the first woman to receive a call-back to do a second comic art job for MAD magazine, nearly 20 years ago now (took 'em long enough!)

They're artists with big hearts & comedic intellects & a number of items in their collection that they hope you might find of interest as One-Of-A-Kind Perks -- though if you wish simply to donate to their campaign, or even just spread the word -- that's totally OK too, encouraged & very much appreciated -- all are welcome! 

Thank you for understanding that those vintage artwork one-of-a-kind perks in their collection are in most instances  not "as new", maybe even in need of restoration -- but may arguably be of value for the afficionado of found east village NYC treasure.

To enjoy a preview of their unique collectible available perk premiums online, from original artworks to one of a kind priceless collectibles to unworn wearable art, visit http://www.panix.com/~sterno/indiegogo/

The East Village's indigenous hippies thank you in advance for your consideration -- 

What We Need & What You Get

We need at least $10,000 -- we have no time & a substantial debt to accommodate. 

Let us know if you have questions about any of the collectible perks we're offering--!

     Indescribable Gratitude --

    You already have that just for visiting & reading this far! xo xo from L & A--!!!!!

    We're extremely fortunate now as it is, & we know it -- 

    thanks for your kindness & understanding & 

    for spreading the word, if you know potentially perk-interested collectors 

    &/or friends of old-school, old growth hippie local color

    continuing to live  in NYC's East Village -- 

    with all our love & then some,

    Leslie & Adam

story:
Short Summary

Vietnam is no longer on the list of underdeveloped countries; yet, in both rural and urban areas of Vietnam there are families still living below the poverty line. We, STEP Forward Exchange - a youth lead initiative, work to bridge the socio-economic gap by providing a platform for disadvantaged families in rural areas of the Mekong Delta region of southern Vietnam. We focus on improving the livelihood of those are living in poverty-stricken circumstances, in particular women and children.

“Brick by Brick” is the first step for us in realising our goal. Earlier this year, we visited families in Tam Binh District, Vinh Long Province, Vietnam. Inevitably, it was a challenge to select a single family that was arguably most in need. Nevertheless, we met with one family that not only needs immediate support in terms of housing but also support in securing long-term financial sustainability and self-sufficiency. 



THE FAMILY 


StepForward visited Anh Trung and his family in September 2014. Trung, 34, works as an independent construction worker in the local area. Trung works on a ‘pay as you work’ basis, meaning if there is no work available, there is no salary for him and the family. During the rainy season, work is often cut short due to monsoons and local companies prefer to rely on their fixed staff, ironically “drying up” chances for Trung to work. If he is unable to find work, he will look for other jobs but without a proper skill-set; these are menial, low paying jobs that don’t provide a concrete platform for his family. 

(Trung's house from inside)

(Kitchen corner)

In addition, Trung’s wife, Dao, work far away from home in a factory in another area of Vinh Long. Due to the distance, Dao must stay in the area to work for weeks at a time. Once the cost of living at her worksite is discounted from her salary it is nowhere near enough to support the family on a monthly basis. Most of this income is used to support their nine year-old son, Nghia, who is currently attending primary school


Nghia was recently in a serious motorbike accident and required four operations and a one-month stay in hospital. What funds the family did have were sapped by the unexpected but necessary expense and the family now find themselves in a particularly difficult situation.Despite this setback, Nghia is back at school where he has proven a good student, with the school often praising his achievement. However; with the cost of school tuition and continued medical expenses, he could potentially be forced to give up his education anytime. We believe higher education and higher understanding to be key tools for economic and social development and Nghia leaving school would be a step backward for a student with such promise.This is a regular occurrence and does not only apply to Nghia, as different generations find themselves stuck in the poverty cycle and are often forced to leave school to find work. StepForward will work to break this cycle and improve the family’s quality of living through improved housing conditions and economic stability.



How it works?

StepForward will relocate the family to brand new accommodation built on the site of their current home. As of now, the family are living in a house constructed mainly of bamboo, dried leaves and tree branches, one side of the house is currently protected by a large tarp which in particular does not provide much protection from the elements. The house is built next to a stream and although it is slightly raised, is still at risk of flooding especially owing to the low quality of materials in use. We plan to comfortably accommodate the family in a small, two-roomed house comprising of a shared bedroom and a living space fit with kitchen area and potential to be utilised as a separate sleeping area if required. The house’ foundations will be raisied to prevent flooding and will be constructed from brick and iron providing proper protection from all weather conditions. There will also be a small bathroom built separately to the house, currently the family are without toilet facilities and are either using their neighbours’ or using the open area around their house which is extremely unsanitary in the long-term.




We will also invest in a small micro-finance loan for the family to set up and run their own business. The fund is 5 million VND ($236 USD) for a small chicken farming enterprise and vegetable garden for personal and business use. This initial investment will be repaid after one year by which time, the business should be in profit and beneficiaries can move forward independently with consistent, guaranteed income. 3 million VND will be utilised towards the construction of a chicken coop, 8-10 chicks and chicken feed to cover a 6-month period. Each chicken has a three-month cycle of growth before they are taken to market to be sold by the kilogram. The remaining funds will be used to build a vegetable garden and provide equipment to support maintenance. Products can also be sold to both neighbours and the local market. This should allow for four cycles before the loan repayment with the family left in a strong position. The initial fund than can be used to support other families in the region.

As well as this, StepForward will commit to a full one-year scholarship for Nghia, which will have the option to be renewed on a yearly basis depending on performance and attendance. The scholarship will cover educational costs including tuition, uniform, text and notebooks and all other school equipment. This will also link in with our long-term microfinance objective as we encourage the family to become self-sufficient and be in a position to retake full financial responsibility for education having seen the benefits through unclouded eyes.



 
Why we are helping the Family


We are not simply building a house. We are building a future.

Despite the overall benefits of Vietnam’s progression into a developing country, it can be argued that this rapid development has played a part in the widening social divide. The lack a well-functioning social welfare system has left disadvantaged families in particular, without the support and opportunities available that will allow them to break from the poverty cycle.

StepForward wants to offer this support to the community provided that beneficiaries commit making the most of the opportunities we aim to provide. This family is young and hardworking, yet their resources are limited and have little if any support in their efforts to improve their livelihood. We will provide new accommodation to better their living conditions and as a result, improve the family’s health. Adequate housing is a basic human right and its provision dramatically improves social well-being.As well as this, a loan for a small family business will ensure economic sustainability and also give them the opportunity to earn their business and make it their own as the initial investment is repaid after a one year term. The child is well recognised by his school and a small donation towards his education could lead to brighter future than his parents right now. 


Proposed Final Outcome 


StepFoward’s target results are both immediate and long-term. Breaking from the cycle of poverty is a process that requires investment from both StepForward and project beneficiaries. We will see an immediate result upon completion of the house, as the family can relocate from sub-standard, high-risk housing to safe and comfortable accommodation. This development should allow beneficiaries to focus on the long-term goal of financial independence and security.

With the successful application of our microfinance loan, the family can achieve a sustainable and self-sufficient lifestyle, improving the quality of life and as result encourage the realisation of other opportunities in business and particularly, education. Education is a key tool for future development and by alleviating beneficiaries from poverty and encouraging further study, higher education can become a reality for those who previously thought it inaccessible. With the completion of ‘Brick by Brick’, beneficiaries will break from the poverty cycle, with the provision of quality housing as well as the confidence and resources to take a ‘Step Forward’ to financial stability and educational opportunity.


What we need?

Funding for building expenses.

As a not-for-profit organisation, we rely on fundraising and donations to complete our projects. In part, our projects are volunteer funded, we encourage and expect our volunteers to fundraise a set amount that will be used solely as project capital. However, we also call for donations and your support in helping us reach our target for each project.

Please see below our detailed budget and projected expense sheet for more information about where funds will be directly used. Donors will made aware about the use of their contributions.

How to Join Our Movement

  • Contribute today and become an owner of our cause!
  • Spread the word! Share our campaign page ,and social media updates on Facebook
  • Send personalized emails to friends, family, colleagues, neighbors, etc. about our campaign, why you support STEP, and why they should too.
  • Engage on social media. Like our posts on Facebook 
  • Become a team member of our campaign. Contact us for more information on joining our team!


Thank you very much

story:
VERSIONE IN ITALIANO SUL FONDO (dopo le foto dei cani) 

_________________________________________________________

What's happened?

October 13th 2014

It was a Monday with a strong storm.

Was few days of intense raining weather around the extended area between 3 regions in the north-west of Italy (Liguria-Tuscany & Emilia Romagna)

That afternoon something goes wrong.

The little stream called “Baganza” - affluent of the main one with same name of the city: “Parma” - it got an extra water capacity since the beginning of the day, above on mountains, where it brought down the installation of the pool of the Berceto Village.

It was a mix of water, debris, mud, everything it could take away and sewers too.

      4.15 PM – The beginning of a dangerous situation

My Mom and I (plus our 4 dogs) were inside the house during the bad weather as usual during a storm.

At a certain point the electricity fails.

This make us a bit in alarm, then we decide to go out and check if others get the same.

In a first moment we just hear a loud noise of water - the traffic was completely out - but we wanted to ensure that wasn't the main river “Parma” swollen; in fact was not from there the problem (even if it was on the max level); the really danger was from the “other side” from “Baganza” stream that overflowed and invaded streets, parks, sidewalks, garages and my HOUSE!!!

WE SAW THE DEATH IN FACE!

We were outside – We have seen the water of a grey color coming to our direction and in the same time the manholes flow up like a fountain!

I got few seconds to release what was going on and run to keep us and the 4 dogs safe.

In that moment the first thing on mind was to STAY ALIVE!
We RUN so fast with that grey water - running fast as well - on our back.

I don't know how I found the right key to open the door then came inside but the flood was coming inside too from the crevices under the door, windows, walls.

I hear the rumble of water....

I screamed to my mom: “Keep safe the dogs on first floor!”

We escaped on first floor . Only one room and a balcony looking outside ALL the water invading ours front yard, gazebo, doghouse.

The same “scenario” was happening INSIDE with ALL the things, stuff, tools, furniture, clothes, shoes, food, documents, books, photographs, memories....

In a blink of an eye..... our LIFE was blown away!

5.30PM – 1 hour of Water Hell

We spent the rest of the afternoon – till 8 o'clock in the evening - at the balcony screaming for HELP!!! - The water noise was over any voice!
The phone lines were totally out - for the emergency - and also because in the flood area was the telecommunications central that was completely submerged.

We were REALLY DESPERATE!

8.00PM – 2 Fireman like 2 Angels

After 3 hours of exhausted & loud screaming: “HELP HERE! WE ARE TRAPPED WITH 4 DOGS!!! WE HAVE NOTHING TO EAT! NO ELECTRICITY!” - [ no electricity inside the house and outside in the street!!!]
We waited so long the relief for two fundamental facts: 1) in the area was in emergency also an Hospital and an Home for the elderly to evacuate... 2) our house is hidden from the main street, that's why nobody was able to understand where to find a way to reach the place.

Anyway just in time – at evening - before the deep night came down - 2 Fireman (from another little village) – that were in town for a casual combination – with a basic track (without the big staircase) got the call of emergency and they came right there to give us some help!
Immediately the situation appeared critical & very dangerous for ALL of us!
Fireman ordered us to EVACUATE INSTANTLY!!!

The 2 Fireman came inside walking some steps of the front yard completely full of water and mud (approximately 1mt & 20 cm)!

They tried once at the main door but the water pressure and things inside were blocking the entrance...

Then they tried on the secondary door that was a bit more free from obstacles.... after few assessment to find the right way of escape.... the only one was to came down from the first floor and going inside the water/mud that was flooded in at 1mt & 20 cm also INSIDE the HOUSE in ALL rooms at ground floor....

A bit of perplexity mixed up to fear, despair and a sense of loss... thinking to put just one feet on that water was disturbing.... but was our only possibility..... then we prepared – with very few things you can bring in the darkness, also things that you don't need but in that moment your mind it's in SHOCK and is missing some logic functions to stay focused – anyway we were ready to go down from the stairs with 2 dogs at a time in arms with the fireman ahead of us to guide in that mess: my mom with Theo & Buffy with me inside a summer bag. (other 2 dogs - Mapo & Ariel - has been recovered just some moment after in the same way!)

We succeeded to keep them safe & dry for what was possible, but they didn't touched that “kind of water”, conversely to us that we owed to soak up at waist!!!

After that in a SHOCKED state of mind and completely dirty and wet, we run away with the 4 dogs in the car (that miraculously has been safe up in the parking!!!) to our relatives that in emergency give us hospitality for 2 days on a sofa and few days a stall for dogs.


THE DAY AFTER: A long day of strange feelings and working on

The day after started very early in a state of bad feelings – as you can imagine I didn't slept so well that night!!!

We came at “WHAT” 24 hours before was still my house, and the “show” was really, really miserable, a feeling of impotence in front of all that mud, water that got the lower level but still there! Walking over it was like wet quicksand! - Horrible thing!

We worked a lot for all the day long to put away the the things and trying to draw the water with pumps with the HELP of Hundreds of Teenagers that offered their help, time and smile to us and in the whole area hit by the flood!
Since the beginning their presence has been so efficient and important, so significant that after they has been called “Angeli del fango” (Mud's Angels!)

We worked so hard I the first place of the 2 weeks after the disaster and then has been decided to put in safety the whole house making a significant restructuring that is still on the working progress right now after 3 months and a half!

______________________________________________________

Dogshouse

An important note about the last 3 months - while we were managing other kind of problems - our dogs has be gently recovered at the City Hall Dog House “Lilli & Vagabondo”. 

In such a situation our Dogs has been through; changing their habits from the warmth of a sofa or rug to a less comfortable fence kennel but a GOOD shelter ; their stay and our concern, has been warmed up to the very nice and professional staff of AVALON Association and the volunteers that make their job and spent their time with true dedication; Love & Passion for Dogs and Animals in general.

                  ______________________________________________________

Charity for the Dogs

In favor of the Doghouse/AVALON we will save the 10% of each donations – starting from the contribution of 50€ - with the amount we will buy food, kennels, etc for so many other worthy Dogs less fortunate as mine!!!

http://www.coopavalon.it/canile.aspx

                   ______________________________________________________

Why YOUR help can make a difference!

All the above report-story to explain you why we are raising money: As you can imagine, an house totally flooded, once it will be restored needs again a lot of things inside and out to be cozy, comfortable, warm & familiar again.
Now we are living in a temporary house not so far - together with our Dogs that came back from the doghouse! - with some primary furniture to live in – as table, bed, refrigerator etc - that generous people donate us, but it's a really TEMORARY accommodation.

Once we will come back to the “116th House” some furniture inevitably will be missed! 

That's why we need your precious help that means a lot to us! 

Refurnish a full house it's a too strong effort for our limited income and any kind of donation can make a significant REBORN for us! 

For any question, feel free to contact! 

We thank-you an advance for your time reading our story! 

Remember that if you cannot make a donation, you can spread to the world and share this project with your friends and loved ones that may be interested!


THANK YOU SO MUCH! 

                                

                                

                                 

 --------VERSIONE in ITALIANO ------
Aiutaci a rendere la nostra casa accogliente, confortevole e di nuovo familiare.

Quello che è successo:

13 ottobre 2014

E' stato un Lunedi con un forte temporale.

Erano un paio di giorni di intensa pioggia intorno l'area estesa tra le 3 regioni del Nord-Ovest d'Italia (Liguria-Toscana e Emilia Romagna)

Quel pomeriggio qualcosa è andato storto.

Il piccolo torrente "Baganza" - affluente di quello principale - con lo stesso nome della città: "Parma" – era in piena eccezionale fin dall'inizio della giornata, su in montagna, ha portato via l'installazione della piscina di Berceto.

E' stato un mix di acqua, detriti, fango, tutto ciò che poteva portare via altre alle fogne naturalmente.

16:15 - L'inizio di una situazione pericolosa

Io e mia mamma (più i nostri 4 cani) eravamo all'interno della casa durante il temporale, come al solito durante una tempesta.

A un certo punto viene a mancare la corrente.

Questo ci mette in allarme, quindi decidiamo di andare fuori e verificare se ad altri nel vicinato mancava la corrente.

In un primo momento abbiamo solo sentito un forte rumore d'acqua - il traffico era completamente in tilt - ma abbiamo voluto assicurarci che non fosse il fiume principale "Parma" in piena; infatti non era da lì il problema (anche se il livello dell'acqua era al massimo); il vero pericolo proveniva dall'altro lato del "Baganza", che traboccava innondando strade, parchi, marciapiedi, garage e la mia CASA !!!

ABBIAMO VISTO LA MORTE IN FACCIA!

Eravamo appena fuori casa quando abbiamo visto arrivare l'acqua di un colore grigio venire nella nostra direzione e nello stesso tempo i tombini che sgorgavano come una fontana!

Ho avuto pochi secondi per realizzare quello che stava succedendo e correre verso casa e mettere i nostri 4 cani al sicuro.

In quel momento la prima cosa a cui ho pensato è stato quello di rimanere in vita!

Correvamo così veloce con l'acqua grigia (velocissima) alle calcagna!

Non so come ho trovato la chiave giusta per aprire la porta, ma l'acqua ha iniziato ad entrare anche all'interno della casa attraverso la fessura sotto la porta, finestre, muri.

Sento il gorgogliare dell'acqua ....

Ho gridato a mia madre: "porta i cani al primo piano!” (unico piano disponibile)

Siamo fuggite al primo piano.

Solo una camera e un balcone che si affaccia sul cortile di fronte dove abbiamo visto l'acqua invadere tutto quanto: ombrellone, tavolo, sedie, panchina, cuccia del cane, armadio degli attrezzi.....TUTTO!

Lo stesso "scenario" accadeva all'interno con tutte le cose, gli utensili, mobili, vestiti, scarpe, cibo, documenti, libri, fotografie e ricordi ....

In un batter d'occhio ..... la nostra vita è stata spazzato via!

05:30 - 1 ora di acqua – Un disastro!

Abbiamo trascorso il resto del pomeriggio - fino alle 8 di sera - sul balcone gridando aiuto !!! - Il rumore dell'acqua era assordante e copriva le voci!!!

Le linee telefoniche erano totalmente fuori uso, perché nella zona dell'innondazione è presente la centrale delle telecomunicazioni, che è stata completamente sommersa.

Eravamo davvero disperate!

08:00 - 2 Vigili del Fuoco come 2 Angeli

Dopo 3 ore disperate e sfinite urlando: "aiuto qui! Siamo intrappolati CON 4 CANI !!! Non abbiamo niente da mangiare! Niente elettricità! "- [Senza elettricità all'interno della casa e fuori in strada!!!]

Abbiamo aspettato così a lungo il soccorsi per due fatti fondamentali: 1) nella zona di emergenza è presente anche un ospedale ed una casa per gli anziani da evacuare ... 2) la nostra casa è nascosta dalla strada principale, è per questo che nessuno è stato in grado di capire tempestivamente dove trovare un modo per raggiungerla.

Comunque appena in tempo verso sera – prima che scendesse la notte – 2 Vigili del Fuoco di Borgotaro, poiché in città per una casualità; sono interveuti in supporto ai soccorsi già al collasso, traendoci in salvo.

Subito la situazione è apparsa critica e molto pericolosa per tutti noi!

I vigili del fuoco ci ha ordinato di evacuare l'abitazione IMMEDIATAMENTE!!!

Un Vigile del Fuoco ha percorso alcuni passi del cortile completamente pieno di acqua e fango (circa 1mt e 20 cm)!

Hanno provato ad aprire la porta principale, ma la pressione dell'acqua e le cose all'interno bloccavano l'ingresso … Poi hanno provato sulla porta secondaria, che era più libera da ostacoli... dopo qualche valutazione per trovare il modo migliore per evacuare da casa; l'unica alternativa era quella di scendere al piano terra completamente invaso dall'acqua e dal fango!

Un po 'di perplessità mescolato alla paura, disperazione e un senso di abbandono.... pensando di mettere solo uno piedi nell'acqua era inquietante .... ma era la nostra unica possibilità.... così ci siamo preparate con quelle pochissime cose che si possono trovare in un cassetto al buio (cose che molto probabilmente non ti serviranno) ma la nostra mente era in stato di SHOCK ed in quei momenti non riesci a connettere logicamente.... nonostante tutto ci siamo fatte coraggio e siamo scese con il Vigile del Fuoco in testa a guidarci al buio immersi nel fango! 

Siamo scesi dalle scale con 2 cani alla volta in spalla, subito dopo sono stati recuperati anche gli altri 2 allo stesso modo.

Siamo riusciti a tenerli al sicuro e all'asciutto per ciò che era possibile, ma non hanno toccato quell'acqua torbida, al contrario di noi che eravamo immerse fino alla vita!

In quello stato di SHOCK e così sporhe e fradice siamo corse via con i 4 cani salvati, in macchina (che miracolosamente era rimasta nel pargheggio!) - presso i nostri parenti che in caso di emergenza hanno dato ospitalità a noi e i cani per un paio di giorni.

IL GIORNO DOPO: Una lunga giornata di strane sensazioni e tanto lavoro!

Il giorno dopo ha iniziato molto presto con delle strane sensazioni ed un mix di emozioni contrastenti - come potete immaginare non ho dormito molto bene quella notte!!!

Siamo ritornate a quello che 24 ore prima era ancora la NOSTRA CASA e lo “spettacolo” era davvero infelice, disarmante; di fronte a tutto quel fango, ora che l'acqua si era abbassata di livello.... Cammiarci sopra erano come sabbia mobili! Una cosa orribile!

Abbiamo lavorato allo sfinimento per tutto il giorno a cercare di riordinare le cose intrise di fango e cercando di aspirare l'acqua con pompe idrovore e con l'aiuto preziosissimo di centinaia di ragazzi che hanno offerto il loro aiuto, il loro tempo ed i loro sorrisi in tutta la zona colpita dall'alluvione!

Fin dall'inizio la loro presenza è stata così efficiente ed importante in modo significativo, tant'è che sono stati ribattezzati "Angeli del fango"!

Abbiamo lavorato così tanto nelle prime 2 settimane dopo il disastro: 12 ore NO STOP!
In seguito si è stabilto di rimettere in sicurezza l'abitazione, facendo una significativa ristrutturazione che è ancora in fase di lavorazione dopo 5 mesi!

______________________________________________________

Canile

Una nota importante riguardo ai 3 mesi in cui i nostri cani sono stati ospiti presso il canile municipale "Lilli e Vagabondo" – dovuto al fatto che la casa è stata dichiarata inagibile sia per noi, che per loro.

In una situazione del genere i nostri cani – oltre allo stress subito durante il salvataggio – hanno dovuto cambiare completamente le loro abitudini del calore di un divano o un tappeto, ad un meno confortevole, ma un buon rifugo del canile; la loro permanenza presso la struttura e la nostra preoccupazione, sono stati “riscaldati” dalla professionalità del personale molto gentile della cooperativa AVALON e dei volontari che fanno il loro lavoro trascorrendo il loro tempo con vera dedizione; Amore & Passione per i cani e gli animali in generale.

______________________________________________________

La beneficenza per i cani

A favore del Canile / AVALON andranno il 10% delle donazioni a partire dal contributo di 50 € - con l'ammontare acquisteremo cibo, cucce, e quant'altro possa essere utile per tanti altri cani degni, meno fortunati dei miei!!!

http://www.coopavalon.it/canile.aspx

______________________________________________________

Perché il vostro aiuto può fare la differenza!

Questo reportage è per spiegare l'effettiva necessità per cui abbiamo aperto questa raccolta fondi: come potete immaginare, una casa completamente allagata, una volta che sarà ripristinata, esige ancora di un sacco di cose dentro e fuori per ritornare ad essere accogliente, confortevole e familiare!

Ora viviamo in una casa temporanea non lontano - insieme con i nostri cani, che sono tornati dal canile! - Con alcuni mobili essenziali - come tavolo, sedie, letto, frigorifero, ecc - che alcune persone generose ci hanno donano, ma è una sistemazione davvero temporanea.

Una volta che torneremo alla "Casa 116" alcuni mobili ed oggetti inevitabilmente mancherano all'appello!

Ecco perché abbiamo bisogno del vostro aiuto prezioso, che significa molto per noi!

Rifornire completamente una casa è un impegno gravoso per il nostro budget limitato e qualsiasi tipo di donazione può significare una RINASCITA importante per noi!

Per qualsiasi domanda, non esitate a contattarci!

Vi ringraziamo in anticipo per la vostra attenzione!

Ricordate che se non vi è possibile effettuare una donazione, potete diffondere nel Mondo condividendo questo progetto con i vostri amici e persone care che potrebbero essere interessati!

VI RINGRAZIAMO TANTO!
story_txt:
VERSIONE IN ITALIANO SUL FONDO (dopo le foto dei cani) _________________________________________________________What's
happened?
October
13th 2014 


It
was a Monday with a strong storm.

Was
few days of intense raining weather around the extended area between
3 regions in the north-west of Italy (Liguria-Tuscany & Emilia
Romagna) 


That
afternoon something goes wrong.

The
little stream called “Baganza” - affluent of the main one with
same name of the city: “Parma” - it got an extra water capacity
since the beginning of the day, above on mountains, where it brought
down the installation of the pool of the Berceto Village.

It
was a mix of water, debris, mud, everything it could take away and
sewers too.



4.15
		PM – The beginning of a dangerous situation



My
Mom and I (plus our 4 dogs) were inside the house during the bad
weather as usual during a storm. 


At
a certain point the electricity fails.

This
make us a bit in alarm, then we decide to go out and check if others
get the same. 


In
a first moment we just hear a loud noise of water - the traffic was
completely out - but we wanted to ensure that wasn't the main river
“Parma” swollen; in fact was not from there the problem (even if
it was on the max level); the really danger was from the “other
side” from “Baganza” stream that overflowed and invaded
streets, parks, sidewalks, garages and my HOUSE!!! 


WE
SAW THE DEATH IN FACE!  


We
were outside – We have seen the water of a grey color coming to our
direction and in the same time the manholes flow up like a fountain! 


I
got few seconds to release what was going on and run to keep us and
the 4 dogs safe.

In
that moment the first thing on mind was to STAY ALIVE! We
RUN so fast with that grey water - running fast as well - on our
back. 


I
don't know how I found the right key to open the door then came
inside but the flood was coming inside too from the crevices under
the door, windows, walls.

I
hear the rumble of water....

I
screamed to my mom: “Keep safe the dogs on first floor!”

We
escaped on first floor . Only one room and a balcony looking outside
ALL the water invading ours front yard, gazebo, doghouse. 


The
same “scenario” was happening INSIDE with ALL the things, stuff,
tools, furniture, clothes, shoes, food, documents, books,
photographs, memories.... 


In
a blink of an eye..... our LIFE was blown away!5.30PM
– 1 hour of Water Hell 


We
spent the rest of the afternoon – till 8 o'clock in the evening -
at the balcony screaming for HELP!!! - The water noise was over any
voice! The phone lines were totally out - for the emergency - and
also because in the flood area was the telecommunications central
that was completely submerged. 


We
were REALLY DESPERATE!

8.00PM
– 2 Fireman like 2 Angels 


After
3 hours of exhausted & loud screaming: “HELP HERE! WE ARE
TRAPPED WITH 4 DOGS!!! WE HAVE NOTHING TO EAT! NO ELECTRICITY!” - [
no electricity inside the house and outside in the street!!!] We
waited so long the relief for two fundamental facts: 1) in the area
was in emergency also an Hospital and an Home for the elderly to
evacuate... 2) our house is hidden from the main street, that's why
nobody was able to understand where to find a way to reach the place.

Anyway
just in time – at evening - before the deep night came down - 2
Fireman (from another little village) – that were in town for a
casual combination – with a basic track (without the big staircase)
got the call of emergency and they came right there to give us  some
help! Immediately the situation appeared critical & very
dangerous for ALL of us! Fireman ordered us to EVACUATE
INSTANTLY!!!


The
2 Fireman came inside walking some steps of the front yard completely
full of water and mud (approximately 1mt & 20 cm)! 


They
tried once at the main door but the water pressure and things inside
were blocking the entrance... 


Then
they tried on the secondary door that was a bit more free from
obstacles.... after few assessment to find the right way of
escape.... the only one was to came down from the first floor and
going inside the water/mud that was flooded in at 1mt & 20 cm
also INSIDE the HOUSE in ALL rooms at ground floor.... 


A
bit of perplexity mixed up to fear, despair and a sense of loss...
thinking to put just one feet on that water was disturbing.... but
was our only possibility..... then we prepared – with very few
things you can bring in the darkness, also things that you don't need
but in that moment your mind it's in SHOCK and is missing some logic
functions to stay focused – anyway we were ready to go down from
the stairs with 2 dogs at a time in arms with the fireman ahead of us
to guide in that mess: my mom with Theo & Buffy with me inside a
summer bag. (other 2 dogs - Mapo & Ariel - has been recovered
just some moment after in the same way!) 


We
succeeded to keep them safe & dry for what was possible, but they
didn't touched that “kind of water”, conversely to us that we
owed to soak up at waist!!! 


After
that in a SHOCKED state of mind and completely dirty and wet, we run
away with the 4 dogs in the car (that miraculously has been safe up
in the parking!!!)  to our relatives that in emergency give us
hospitality for 2 days on a sofa and few days a stall for dogs.



THE
DAY AFTER: A long day of strange feelings and working on

The
day after started very early in a state of bad feelings – as you
can imagine I didn't slept so well that night!!! 


We
came at “WHAT” 24 hours before was still my house, and the “show”
was really, really miserable, a feeling of impotence in front of all
that mud, water that got the lower level but still there! Walking
over it was like wet quicksand!  - Horrible thing! 


We
worked a lot for all the day long to put away the the things and
trying to draw the water with pumps with the HELP of Hundreds of
Teenagers that offered their help, time and smile to us and in the
whole area hit by the flood! Since the beginning their presence
has been so efficient and important, so significant that after they
has been called “Angeli del fango” (Mud's Angels!) 


We
worked so hard I the first place of the 2 weeks after the disaster
and then has been decided to put in safety the whole house making a
significant restructuring that is still on the working progress right
now after 3 months and a half! 


______________________________________________________Dogshouse

An
important note about the last 3 months  - while we were managing
other kind of problems - our dogs has be gently recovered at the City
Hall Dog House “Lilli & Vagabondo”. In
such a situation our Dogs has been through; changing their habits
from the warmth of a sofa or rug to a less comfortable
fence kennel but a GOOD shelter ; 
their stay and our concern, has been warmed up to the very nice and
professional staff of AVALON Association and the volunteers that make
their job and spent their time with true dedication; Love &
Passion for Dogs and Animals in general.
                  ______________________________________________________
Charity
for the Dogs

In
favor of the Doghouse/AVALON  we will save the 10% of each donations
– starting from the contribution of 50€ - with the amount  we
will buy food, kennels, etc for so many other worthy Dogs less
fortunate as mine!!! 


http://www.coopavalon.it/canile.aspx
                   ______________________________________________________
Why
YOUR help can make a difference!

All
the above report-story to explain you why we are raising money: As
you can imagine, an house totally flooded, once it will be restored needs again a lot
of things inside and out to be cozy, comfortable, warm & familiar
again.  Now we are living in a temporary house not so far - together with our Dogs that came back from the doghouse! - with
some primary furniture to live in – as table, bed, refrigerator etc
- that generous people donate us, but it's a really TEMORARY
accommodation.

Once we will come back to the “116th House” some furniture inevitably will be missed! That's why we need your precious help that means a lot to us! Refurnish a full house it's a too strong effort for our limited income and any kind of donation can make a significant REBORN for us! For any question, feel free to contact! We thank-you an advance for your time reading our story! Remember that if you cannot make a donation, you can spread to the world and share this project with your friends and loved ones that may be interested!THANK YOU SO MUCH!                                                                                                   --------VERSIONE in ITALIANO ------
