story:
TO MAKE IT SHORT

This campaign is to help future-Founder, LaQuinda Grimes and co-Founder Lindsey Callier, fund the start-up of Cue the Lens: a non-profit dance, theatre and film organization designed to provide professional artistic training to children of low-income households- particularly underprivileged minority children (African-American & Latino) in Metro-Atlanta, and eventually the nation!

OUR STORY

Cue the Lens seeks to empower the minds of participants by exposing them to disciplines of dance, film, and performing arts techniques that would be unaffordable to them otherwise.

Both Ms. Grimes and Ms. Callier are Atlanta-natives, SC State University Alumni, and avid dancers. Both young ladies want to make a positive change in the lives of minority children, whose exposure to extra-curricular activities may be limited or stifled due to finances.

Cue the Lens will provide children with a creative environment where performing arts exposes them to healthy living and wellness as a primary focus in the belief that the arts have a unique power to engage children and motivate them toward excellence.   

Each year, Cue the Lens will seek to transform the lives of hundreds of children in Atlanta, GA and its surrounding communities through weekly classes/camps and public performances.  Under the artistic direction of LaQuinda Grimes, Lindsey Callier and a diverse staff of professional teaching artists, programs are offered to expose participants to new cultures, languages, genres and concepts, transcending the barriers of class through the art of movement and performance. Children will learn to work together and develop personal standards of excellence, a pride of achievement, and a curiosity about the world outside of their own that supports their success in life-present and future.  

OUR PURPOSE

Cue the Lens aims to provide fun, safe, affordable "Arts and Fitness" experiences to children of color, ages 6-14, in low-income areas who would not be exposed to professional training otherwise. Each experience will be funded mostly or partly funded by CTL sponsors. These experiences will work on improving:

  • SELF ESTEEM
  • BODY IMAGE
  •  PERSONAL FITNESS HABITS 
  • THEIR UNDERSTANDING OF THEIR CULTURAL IDENTITY 

through movement, film, and/or musical theatre training. This will be achieved through CTL's three principle focuses:

Friends

All participants will make new friends and learn the importance and foundations of healthy friendships and mutual respect. CTL will also reinforce prevention techniques of anti-bullying campaigns and teach the importance tolerance and empathy.

Fun

CTL will make each experience a enjoyable, memorable and self-gratifying event  for each child participating. The fun begins with registration!

Fitness

As participants are immersed and learn how to hone their skills in performing arts and media they will be gaining fitness habits. All the while they are having fun they will also be learning fitness techniques suitable for their bodies and the importance of loving themselves.

Our creed

We would like to gain enough sponsorships and community support,  that we may never turn a child away.

Once operating, 70% of monies collected will go to the operating costs of the organization and off-set the operating costs of the provided experiences. The rest goes directly toward the registration fees of children who do not have the means to attend. Any additional costs not covered by sponsorships will be covered through the above-mentioned fees.

Each of these experiences will be tailored to the participants' interests and the hiring entity's need. CTL Experiences can last anywhere from one week to full summers. CTL BRINGS THE FUN TO THE KIDS!!!

During these experiences, participants will learn choreography with the goal of presenting a showcase to friends, family, and camp sponsors as the grand finale! Once we have the funding for film equipment, interested older children will be involved in the process of capturing the experience & performance on film and learn editing techniques to help with production each project, which will be packaged as DVDs for the participants, their families, and sponsors.

Participating children will be exposed to positive & uplifting messages, music and choreography from successful mentors and volunteers handpicked for their passion to make a difference in their communities and skills in their field!

Contributing to this campaign will literally transform- and even bring a sense of purpose to some- young lives, more likely to be trapped in cycles of senseless violence, incarceration, drug use, failed education, and the dangers of unprotected sex.

WE ALL KNOW ONE POSITVE INFLUENCE CAN CHANGE A LIFE FOREVER!

 

WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO, EXACTLY?

  • $2,200 will go to The Foundation Group, an organization that helps get non-profits started by providing step-by-step assistance and even legal counsel.
  • $1000 will cover government fees for filing a non-profit business in GA and filling as a 501(c)3
  • $600 will go toward LegalZoom's trademarking service they provide
    • roughly $200 for the LegalZoom filing fee and $400 for the Standard government filing fee.
  • $5,000 goes toward the operating costs of out initial trial camp in Atlanta the last week of July. 
    • This covers studio & equipment rental, payroll, breakfast, snacks, lunches for some campers, CTL branded merchandise for the campers, guest choreographer stipends, and grand finale show costs.
  • $1,200 goes toward aministrative funding which will cover:
    • Insurance coverage
    • Printing CTL posters, flyers, signage, and business cards
    • Postage
    • Marketing
    • Website
  • $300 to cover Indiegogo and PayPal fees

PERKS

We do not have the ability to offer traditional perks but we will be sure to acknowledge EVERY contributor on our website and social media platforms, as well as in our grand finale playbills. 

We will also keep record of all donations to send a personalized thank you letter.

THE IMPACT

It is a widely accepted fact that students involved in extracurricular activities are more likely to be academically and socially ahead of those who do not. 

"Although awareness of the availability of extracurricular activities is high (up to 98% of kids report knowing about them), participation remains low for poor and minority students." - Eileen O'Brien of Policy Studies Associates and Mary Rollefson of the National Center for Education Statistics

We believe that is because they simply cannot afford to participate.

We're prioritizing minority children because they're often the most in need and furthest behind, though we do encourage and would love the participation of any underprivileged child regardless of ethnicity.

JOIN US ON OUR MISSION TO BETTER LIVES!

Donate, Share & Get Friends to do the same

  • Post and share this on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Blogger, Stumbleupon, Myspace-EVERYWHERE!
  • Email to your friends
  • Tell your neighbors, families, and co-workers
  • Ask your boss! See if your company would like to be a contributor!
  • MAKE SURE EVERYONE YOU KNOW IN ATLANTA KNOWS!

Let's see Cue the Lens, Inc. come to fruition! Thank you in advanced for anything you choose to do to get us up and running! A non-profit campaign will be coming to you soon from CTL!

story:
Short Summary

It's been more than 15 years since it's debut and the "Parking Lot Bash" is back and badder than ever-- with a twist. And you can't even stop us.

We're celebrating old memories, anniversaries, birthdays, recovered equipment, and exes of the other sexes. 

Cinebob is your Orlando camera rental house. A year ago we moved into our new building, and it's been a crazy first year. After having much of our inventory stolen, we recovered most of it through cooperation with OPD and the hard work of our staff. We want to celebrate our first year in our new shop, give back to our local community and have one hell of a time with friends.

What We Need & What You Get

In order for us to make BobBobPalooza possible, we need your help. All of Cinebob's staff is working hard to make this event legen....wait for it....dary. Even with all the free man hours being put-in, we are occurring costs that are exceeding what was expected. Some of our extra costs include: Sound & Lighting equipment, DJ, bartenders, bar supplies (i.e. cups, mixers, etc) Police officers, costume contest gifts, games, construction materials. These are just a few of the long list of expenses.

The Impact

Our goal is to have a great evening with friends and industry co-workers, while giving back to our local community at the same time. With your help and donations, BobBobpalooza should exceed all expectations on October 27th, 2012. It doesn't stop there. BobBobPalooza is hoping to raise enough in donations to make a positive impact on House of Hope and Orlando Police Department chairities.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able donate money. Other things that would help us out:

 

-Snack food (Chips, dip, sodas, Ice, etc.)

-Preparation help (Call Cinebob)

-Help cleaning following BobBobPalooza (Call Cinebob)

-Bring your smiling face

These are just a few things that we can think of. Anything that you think might be of help to us and your fellow party people, feel free to bring.

story:
Story

Hi, I am a single, 50ish grandmother raising my two grandsons, 8 and 9 years old. Working as a school nurse is very rewarding and allows me to be more available for the boys yet does not pay enough for me to meet day to day expenses plus save for emergencies and home ownership.  I dream of a modest size home (such as the example shown) where the boys have more bedroom space, a backyard for their own activities and room for their friends to gather. It would allow me to decrease cost of living and save for our futures.  Please help us afford a home to start building another set of family memories.   Something that feels more permanent than renting.

What We Need

Most of the homes that would meet our needs are in the price range of $150,000 to $200,000.  However, there are homes available for under $150,000.   I qualify for some first time homebuyer government grant assistance. However, that can have certain limits on buying homes that would qualify for renovation loans, etc.  Additionally, in some cases, the seller will pay some or all of closing costs.   Ideally, I would like to have a 10-20% down payment.   However, if I don’t reach that goal, I will look for a home that the donated amount and grant assistance will allow me to purchase.

The Impact

Rental prices in my area have greatly increased due to the housing market and economic landscape.  With guidance from my realtor and mortgage representative, I can decrease my monthly, and in the end, yearly living cost by owning a home.  It will be a tax advantage for me as well.  Owning will allow me more room for my bucks as well.  I want a place for the boys and me to call our own.

Other Ways You Can Help

While not everyone can contribute monetarily, you can still assist by getting the word out about my campaign.  Share this with your family, friends, coworkers, etc.  Use the Indiegogo share tools.

Thank you so much for your generous sharing in whatever form you can contribute!

story:
Beer N Bike
Shh. It's a Surprise!

Thank you to all who came to Jamiel's birthday extravaganza last year!

Alas. This year has been a tragedy for our hero, Jamiel.

Some Brooklyn scoundrels stole his bicycle! One fine summer's eve, he locked his silvery steed to a pole near his home. The next day, as he came to greet his fair-wheeled friend, he discovered his bike was gone! In defeat, all that remained was a signless pole and a saddened shadow trailing behind our poor hero.

Dear friends, 

Come! Let us redeem this travesty and together, give Jamiel a new BIRTHDAY BICYCLE!


Let's chip in, ride, and raise a cup for Jamiel Cornelio's Birthday!

When: Sunday, February 17, 2013
Where: Prospect Park - Grand Army Plaza Entrance. Brooklyn, NY

BYOB - Bring your own bike! We'll lap around the park, then bike to the beer destination for the big $ reveal!

Time: 2:00pm
Please be on time. The surprise will take place at Prospect Pk. When the birthday boy arrives, the bike parade begins. Rain or shine! So please make your donation by Sat Feb. 16! Thanks.

Beer Despot: TBA

For Q's: marlenepaez@gmail.com 

XOXO,
Marlene

story:
Help build socialist.ca, an accessible, user-friendly website that helps us share socialist ideas and fight on every front--for a world of peace, environmental justice, liberation and equality. 

 

The International Socialists already produces tools for the struggle, written by activists across Canada and Quebec.


Socialist Worker is a monthly pan-Canadian, revolutionary socialist newspaper. In the last year, our newspaper has generated solidarity for workers resisting austerity; provided eye-witness accounts of revolts from Egypt to Greece; challenged Toronto mayor Rob Ford’s cuts to jobs and services; campaigned against threats of war to Syria and Iran; supported movements for national liberation, from Palestine to Tamil Eelam; defended civil liberties and opposed Islamophobia and racist scapegoating; generalized the success of Québec solidaire and defended Quebec’s right to self-determination; mobilized in support of Attawapiskat and struggles for indigenous sovereignty; defended a woman’s right to choose and exposed Harper’s sexist and anti-gay agenda; supported struggles against oppression, from Disability Pride to Trans liberation; built and intervened in debates in the Occupy movement, and much more.

 

The Agitator is a regular campus newspaper that has shared the lessons of the Quebec student strike, promoted the February 1 day of action against tuition fees, and built support for teaching assistants represented by CUPE 3902 at the University of Toronto.

 

Help Socialist.ca go viral

 

These publications play an important role in building struggles, connecting them, and generalizing their lessons. But their reach doesn’t go far enough. 


We need a website that allows for rapid online posting and sharing of articles, eyewitness reports, theory, multimedia, and campaign materials—and an easily navigable archive that makes all of this available to as many people as possible. 


The International Socialists is in the process of building such a website, which will appear at Socialist.ca in May, 2012. But we need your help now to pay for the cost of building it, and to make it go viral once we launch it. 


Every donation–no matter how big or how small–makes a difference. Please be generous, and share this with others, to help us bring ideas to change the world to a much bigger audience.

 

There are two easy ways to donate:

1) Online, through indiegogo.

2) By cheque, payable to “ISSI Canada”, mailed to:

Socialist.ca support

PO Box 339, Station E

Toronto ON M6H 4E3

 

Thank you in advance for your solidarity and support.

 

In solidarity,

The International Socialists

socialistworkercanada.com

story:
If the video didn't convince you to donate...

For over 21 years, The Bicycle Man Community Outreach Project has provided over 13,000 bicycles for underprivileged children in the Fayetteville area during an annual Christmas giveaway to help fight childhood obesity. 

It is ran by Mr. Moses Mathis aka The Bicycle Man (A Navy Veteran & 2006 President Call to Service Award recipient) and his wife Mrs. Ann Mathis with the help of amazing volunteers. 

For the past couple of years, Mr. and Mrs. Mathis have moved NINE times when the space they were using became unavailable. Basically, they couldn't afford to lease. Currently operating out of a temporary 40,000 squared foot building, Mr. and Mrs Mathis hope to turn it into their permanent home.  

It is unfortunate that an extraordinary charity that has made a difference in children's lives in the Fayetteville community for so long has yet maintained a stable building. 

The year is almost over and I refuse to read another article like this or this after Christmas about the Bicycle Man searching for a new home. $10,000 would be a substantial start to secure the long-term stability of the organization.

Will you stand up and join me to help this organization progress? 

"As long as I got a building, I'll be doing this." - Moses Mathis, 75 years old

www.thebicycleman.com/

What You Get

The amazing perk for being a contributor is helping an organization that puts smiles on over 1,000 kids' faces every Christmas. Every year, a kid receives a bike that is probably their only Christmas gift x 1,000. 

No one forgets the joy of receiving a bicycle. 

The Bicycle Man Community Outreach Project is a nonprofit organization with 501(c)(3) status. ALL contributions are TAX-DEDUCTIBLE. Ask for a receipt and you shall receive. 

Impact

By donating, you are giving an organization a push to continue striving.

You're not only helping an organization that provides bicycles for underprivileged kids but also combats childhood obesity. 

Any contribution will help $1, $5, $10. Every dollar counts. 

All the funds collected in this campaign will go directly towards The Bicycle Man Community Outreach Project's building maintence i.e. a utility bill runs up to $600/month for a 40,000 square foot building.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, please help by spreading the word. SHARING IS CARING! Facebook it! Tweet it! Email and tell your friends, family, and co-workers! 

You can also mail checks payable to: 

The Bicycle Man Outreach Community Project 624 Platinum St Fayetteville, NC 28311

Volunteer or donate a bike

1800 Wynfare Drive Fayetteville, NC 28306. The working hours are 9AM-3PM on Tues-Friday and 9AM-2PM on Saturdays. 

If you have any questions, please contact Mrs. Mathis via:                              

email: annamae59@aol.com  

office: 910.424.3083    home: 910.822.2034                                                

For more information:  www.thebicycleman.com

Thank you for your gift!

It is unfortunate that an extraordinary charity that has made a difference in children's lives in the Fayetteville community for so long has yet maintained a stable building. 
The year is almost over and I refuse to read another article like this or this after Christmas about the Bicycle Man searching for a new home. $10,000 would be a substantial start to secure the long-term stability of the organization.
Will you stand up and join me to help this organization progress? 
"As long as I got a building, I'll be doing this." - Moses Mathis, 75 years old
www.thebicycleman.com/
What You Get

The amazing perk for being a contributor is helping an organization that puts smiles on over 1,000 kids' faces every Christmas. Every year, a kid receives a bike that is probably their only Christmas gift x 1,000. 
No one forgets the joy of receiving a bicycle. 
The Bicycle Man Community Outreach Project is a nonprofit organization with 501(c)(3) status. ALL contributions are TAX-DEDUCTIBLE. Ask for a receipt and you shall receive. 
Impact
By donating, you are giving an organization a push to continue striving.
You're not only helping an organization that provides bicycles for underprivileged kids but also combats childhood obesity. 
Any contribution will help $1, $5, $10. Every dollar counts. 

All the funds collected in this campaign will go directly towards The Bicycle Man Community Outreach Project's building maintence i.e. a utility bill runs up to $600/month for a 40,000 square foot building.
Other Ways You Can Help


If you are unable to donate, please help by spreading the word. SHARING IS CARING! Facebook it! Tweet it! Email and tell your friends, family, and co-workers! 
You can also mail checks payable to: 
The Bicycle Man Outreach Community Project 624 Platinum St Fayetteville, NC 28311
Volunteer or donate a bike
1800 Wynfare Drive Fayetteville, NC 28306. The working hours are 9AM-3PM on Tues-Friday and 9AM-2PM on Saturdays. 
If you have any questions, please contact Mrs. Mathis via:                              
email: annamae59@aol.com  
office: 910.424.3083    home: 910.822.2034                                                
For more information:  www.thebicycleman.com
Thank you for your gift!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Lucy, im 32 years old.Im down to earth & fun loving & I have a passion & obsession with body piercing.

My dream for forever has been to start my own business but in order to make that happen I need some help from other people!

What We Need & What You Get

The funding amount I need is $7000.I know this seems like a lot of money but you will all literally be helping me start the business from scratch. Renting premises,rent & rates,buying tools,materials,jewellery.Having sinks fitted,a non pourous floor etc etc.

If I do not get the entire amount I need the money will be put into a bank account & I will try to get a loan in order to make the money up to the required amount.

The Impact

This literally means the world to me! This is my forever dream! I am prepared to work as hard as I need in order to be successfull.I have a proven record in retail management with over 12 years experience under my belt & 3 nvqs.I have also completed indepth theory in piercing & have also completed a piercing  apprenticeship. Any amount of money donated will be gratefully received!! Perks I will be giving to investers include hand written thank you notes,free piercings,gift vouchers.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone can contribute money wise as money is short for everyone at the moment. Dont feel bad if you can donate money because you can still help me realise my dream by spreading the word about my campaign.

story:
Sending Baby Lucy Home 

As many of you know, Baby Lucy died on Friday night in Albuquerque, NM surrounded by her mother and father and other family members.  They are now faced with covering the required funerary costs to send Baby Lucy home on a plane for a burial in Minnesota while they drive home with the rest of the family.

We are now humbly asking for your help

Here are the costs that this fundraising campaign aims to meet: 

  • $3,000 for the mortuary and flight for Lucy to Minneapolis, MN.
  • $500 for Lucy's casket.
  • $500 for travel expenses for the family driving from Albuquerque to Minneapolis.
  • $250 to go towards www.indiegogo.com
  • Any and all funds will go to these essential items even if we don't meet the entire fundraising goal.

The Impact

So many people have asked how they might help the family.  Any amount from $1 on up is so welcome. This has been such a difficult time for the family who feels overwhelmed with their loss and now these unanticipated costs. 

  • Please contribute whatever your economic situation allows.
  • We realized not everyone can access a bank to contribute to the Wells Fargo account (which is still accepting funds for Baby Lucy's family) so we are hoping this indiegogo fundraising campaign will help folks from all over the world contribute.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about this fundraising campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for your contributions and prayers!

Please get the word out and make some noise about this fundraising campaign.
Please use the Indiegogo share tools!


Thank you so much for your contributions and prayers!

story:
I started this page to provide support to Brad Klaassen and his family for so many obvious reasons and so many personal reasons as well.  Your donation will allow for his family to pay the bills until he is able to return to work.  Thanks for your support.

The following is the obituary written by Brad Klaassen in memory of his wife Monica.  Donations will go to Brad and his two beautiful daughters to help ease the financial hardship and provide support at a time when it is needed most.  Thanks for visiting this page and thanks for your support.

Monica A Klaassen passed away Thursday, November 29th 2012.

Monica was a beautiful, gentile woman. She was a loving mother and wife. Born January 2nd, 1975, she was fortunate enough to live in many parts of our great country. She had a love of nature and was particularly fond of the Rocky Mountains and the Pacific coast. Her compassionate nature shone through in her love of animals and her willingness to listen to a friend in need. She was quick to laugh at a joke and those who knew her will remember her laugh always.

Like many of us, Monica had her struggles, she was overcome by the complications and hardships of this world. She is at peace now, looking over her precious girls knowing they are in the loving care of their daddy, cousins, aunts, uncles, grandparents and friends.

“The ultimate lesson all of us has to learn is unconditional love, which includes not only others, but ourselves as well” -Elisabeth Kubler Ross

story:
Hello! Allow me to tell you my story.  My name is Jose Ricardo im 23 y/o   and im studying civil engeneering.

 

A year ago I set my mind into making an "eurotrip", to travel through Europe and Uk.  So, I begin thinking and planning what I would need to make such trip come true.  

What I came up with:

passport

plane ticket

place to stay

food

places to visit 

and some party money  xD

I realize I can solve most of these issues by getting enough money.

I did some math and came up with how much money I was going to need. 

Luckily I was already working on a project that year in the construction branch (I work while I study).  I was hired to assist in the building of a school kitchen.

One year later, a lot of hard work and a LOT of saving money and I finally came up with the amount of money I needed!!  

So I immediately went to a travel agency and bought my plane ticket to Spain, where I'm going to start my Eurotrip (this was on december ....  some christmas present I gave my self hahaha )  Up until now, everything was coming together nicely, just as planned.

So far, I have most of the things I need:

passport (check)

plane ticket (check)

places to visit (check)

and money for:

food (check)

place to stay (check)

party money (double check)  hahaha

 

Now comes the tricky (and in my case, the sad) part.

I live in Venezuela, and in my country we have a currency exchange control. That is something that might be hard to understand for most people who dont live here, but I'll try to explain the best I can. It basically means that you can only purchase a certain amount of foreign currency (in this case, the dollars/euro I need) each year. What is worse, there is a lot of bureaucracy involved, and it's basically very hard to come up with even the small amount of Euros they allow us to purchase, even if we are going on a trip. If you want to learn some more about this, here is a wiki link (wiki can always explain things better than I can)  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foreign_exchange_controls

 

But!! no problem, we got something called SITME that is supposed to be an alternative way to get some extra dollars.  

Sadly, on  February 8th 2013 the president of the Central Bank of Venezuela announced that the price of the dollar increased from Bs. 4,30 to Bs. 6,30  

I thought WTH... less money for partying :(

But THEN he said that  there was going to be no more SITME. This was the only way to get the Euros I needed if I didnt have a credit card. Basically, they completely removed the only way I had to exchange Bolivares (the currency in my country) for Euros!!

All of a sudden, all my effort and hard work became worthless because I have the money in Bolivares but no way to turn it in to Euros :S

I have TRIED to find alternative ways to get some Dollars (or Euros) but its simply impossible.  

So, this is my story and this is the last recourse I found to make my dream of trip to Europe come true.

My plane ticket is set to march 30th 2013 so I have until that day to come with a solution to the problem.  A friend of mine told me that it would do no harm to give it a shot here and see what happened. So I turn to you all, to ask for a little help!

THE CATCH !!!

AS A PROOF OF GOOD WILL I'M GOING TO DONATE THE SAME AMOUNT OF DOLLARS I RAISE HERE TO ANY CHARITY ORGANIZATIONS IN BOLIVARES HERE IN VENEZUELA ON YOUR BEHALF (WITH PHOTOGRAPICH EVIDENCE IF NEEDED),  Like I said, I have the money (I worked hard for it), the only problem is that  I need a way to turn them in to Dollars or Euros. It's very unfair that for some messed up rule in my country, I will not be able to make my trip even when I worked so much...

 

I have nothing else to do but thank all the adventurers and travelers that can help me on my quest to make my trip to the other continent. If I get the help, Ill hope to see you on the road!! (I promise I'll take a lot of pictures)

 

Live long and prosper!  \\//

story:
In 2011 Children's Cove hosted the 1st annual Children's Cove Wing Eating Contest.  Teams of law enforcement officers from across Cape Cod competed, not only for a chance at glory, but also to benefit an organization that specializes in helping child victims of sexual abuse. While many teams competed, one team dominated the competition and made eating chicken wings in an absurdley fast manner look like something totally natural to do. That team was from Brewster and they are coming back with a vengeance this year!  Childrens's Cove has asked them to defend their title on October 18th at Red Face Jack's Pub in Yarmouth.

 

          I am a part of that winning team and am very passionate about what I do.  I believe Chidren's Cove is a great organization and are much needed here on the Cape.  That is why this year, in addition to making the other wing eaters look like they are eating wings in slow motion, I also wanted to give a donation as the returning champions.  I feel I should do more than easily walk away with another championship when such a great organization is hosting the competition.

 

          Please consider sponsoring me and my team as we defend our title on 10/18. Any and all donations will go directly to Chidren's Cove to help them in their fight to end child sexual abuse.  If you can't donate then please consider coming out that night and cheering us on.

 

Freddie "Jaws" O'Neal

story:
Greeting to all,

 Iam sorry for the video not being that great. Its not rehearsed or scripted. I just told my story and it all from the heart. Iam not sure where to start...but here it go's. My name is Matthew, My company is Millienium Global Exports. I am pioneering a new industry here beautiful Puerto Rico USA. I am the one who actually got start the whole P.R Iguana meat exporting started and going! Yes i said Iguana Meat, but if you will contiune to read and watch the video you will see the greater picture.

We are a small P.R base company with huge possibles. Without writing out a book I will make a long story short because if you watched the video you already know the story. Here are the detail that were not in the video.

How we got to here

What has happened is this, we were working on a order 44k lbs of iguana meat. But because we dont have the full equipment and things we need we could not produce and send that much at one time. so we where sending 1000k+ lbs every time. and with the sale from that is what i had used to grow and buy more equipment to increasing what we could send.

 Well fast forward about 1-2 months, we started to perpared our next shippment. and something told me to call him. now normally we dont need to call, just ship and when they recieve it they send a wire payment. But when i spoke with him they said dont send it! Because the cost of shipping is way to high. If we continued ship little parts at a time, it would cost him 1000 times more then what it should in shipping. They where paying $2K-$3k each time. and if we continued to ship that way he would end up paying about $80k in just shipping cost. compared to if we shipped all at once it cost $3200 for a container to be shipped.

 So they said inorder to continue to buy, that it would have to all be shipped at once, no more small amounts its all or none. But the problem was i had spend my money all ready to produce it, but i got stuck with it. And if we dont start to produce and ship again soon i will be force to close and let go of my worker go and not just them but all the rest of  the jobs that would be lost. My goal is to put to work 100k+ people in the next year to 2 years. And many many more good things for the community.

 

WITH YOU HELP!!!

 With YOUR HELP we can still make it happen. If we can get the funding in time i can still meet our goal. We can get everything we need to start shipping again and continue to grow. The more we grow the more i can do and help. And remember you are not just helping some guy save his company or some other guys job. YOU are giving hope to someone.

If we are buying more supplies that means that supplier keep buying from his producer. and that producer can keep hiring worker to work. and you never know that just might be your job that we are taking about or your company. As i say "If you can help the right few, you can save a greater many."

 

 

WHAT WE NEED TO MAKE IT HAPPEN.

What we need it not that much compared to what we can make and do. The amount of funding we need to make it is around $15,000+. It breaks down like this,

Starting inorder of most urgent.

1. Larger ice machine 500+ lb ice maker. $3000 that includes pro. install

2. Second truck or van- $3000

3. larger faster boat to harvest with- $4000

4. CSA scale with label printer- $1000

5. more vac bags- $2500

6. operating cap.- $1500- this will be used for i.e gas,food, harvesting supplies and misc. supplies

Anyother  funding we recieve will be alocated to more things that we need such as, more stainless steel tables, small call center to continue to find and increase our sells. more supply and equipment.

And if we dont reach of funding goal, what funds we get will start from the top- down spending.

FOR YOUR SUPPORT....

In return for your support and help i will be offering the following gifts and perks. any where from samples of our exotic meats, to exotic animal skulls from some of what we harvest. Exotic skins like iguana aswell CAIMAN. We will send out a limited number of REAL raw CROC SKIN that you can have tanned or made into somthing you always wanted, right out of caiman and or iguana hide. Imagine a custom pair of shoes or that perfect purse that you dreamed of. Best of all its one of a kind. And for those who would really like to make a difference, you and one other person can fly in to puerto rico and we will take you on your very own caiman and or iguana hunt. And for the very few even a personal scenic tour drive around the tropical island of Puerto Rico. All this just for helping do the right thing and save a great opportunity for all.

*Please note any perk that are claimed, claimer is responsible for cost of shipping and or airfare and board here. All trips and hunting perks must be scheduled before hand. All other perks will be available after funding is completed.

 

Recap of the Impact

Keep in mind of what of our goal and what we are doing here.

1. We are taking a problem and turning it in to a viable and real solution.

2. We are helping to remove a harmful overpopulation and save the native species.

3. We are creating real world jobs, not just talking about or hoping for. OUR goal is 100k+ new jobs.

4. With that many jobs, you will definitely be doing your part to help our economy and country. And we an't talking about some wishful thinking on stimulating of the economy. But real life stimulating the economy. And you know what? It wasnt done by some expensive gov. proposal. or some lengthy 5-10 year plan that never happens. It wont be because of them......

NO it was done by YOU, the everyday normal person. Because you CARED AND YOU HELPED as well. And on behalf of all the people that will greatly benefit from this project.....THANK YOU!!!!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

And dont worry if you cant help financially you can still get the word out. Pass it along and share my story and plight with everyone.

If you are a supplier that deals in what we need and if you like to donate equipment and supplies that is also very welcomed.

Or if you buy and sell exotic meat or are looking to try something new and want to buy supply from us that is welcomed too. and to anybody else that might can help in anyway please contact me or let me know. Thanks you to all

5. more vac bags- $2500
6. operating cap.- $1500- this will be used for i.e gas,food, harvesting supplies and misc. supplies
Anyother  funding we recieve will be alocated to more things that we need such as, more stainless steel tables, small call center to continue to find and increase our sells. more supply and equipment.
And if we dont reach of funding goal, what funds we get will start from the top- down spending.
FOR YOUR SUPPORT....
In return for your support and help i will be offering the following gifts and perks. any where from samples of our exotic meats, to exotic animal skulls from some of what we harvest. Exotic skins like iguana aswell CAIMAN. We will send out a limited number of REAL raw CROC SKIN that you can have tanned or made into somthing you always wanted, right out of caiman and or iguana hide. Imagine a custom pair of shoes or that perfect purse that you dreamed of. Best of all its one of a kind. And for those who would really like to make a difference, you and one other person can fly in to puerto rico and we will take you on your very own caiman and or iguana hunt. And for the very few even a personal scenic tour drive around the tropical island of Puerto Rico. All this just for helping do the right thing and save a great opportunity for all.
*Please note any perk that are claimed, claimer is responsible for cost of shipping and or airfare and board here. All trips and hunting perks must be scheduled before hand. All other perks will be available after funding is completed.

 


Recap of the Impact
Keep in mind of what of our goal and what we are doing here.
1. We are taking a problem and turning it in to a viable and real solution.
2. We are helping to remove a harmful overpopulation and save the native species.
3. We are creating real world jobs, not just talking about or hoping for. OUR goal is 100k+ new jobs.
4. With that many jobs, you will definitely be doing your part to help our economy and country. And we an't talking about some wishful thinking on stimulating of the economy. But real life stimulating the economy. And you know what? It wasnt done by some expensive gov. proposal. or some lengthy 5-10 year plan that never happens. It wont be because of them......
NO it was done by YOU, the everyday normal person. Because you CARED AND YOU HELPED as well. And on behalf of all the people that will greatly benefit from this project.....THANK YOU!!!!!!


Other Ways You Can Help
And dont worry if you cant help financially you can still get the word out. Pass it along and share my story and plight with everyone.
If you are a supplier that deals in what we need and if you like to donate equipment and supplies that is also very welcomed.
Or if you buy and sell exotic meat or are looking to try something new and want to buy supply from us that is welcomed too. and to anybody else that might can help in anyway please contact me or let me know. Thanks you to all

story:
UXCamp Prague 2013 Needs You!

On the last January Saturday, around 100 people will gather together in Prague to practice and sharpen their UX skillz and knowledge.

The poor shelter awaiting these pilgrims will provide water, broadband internet, fireplace to warm by, stage with loud soundsystem and dry toilets in the backyard.

But what about the food?

By the people, for the people

UXCamp is a barcamp-like event, with no tickets or paid registration - it is simply free for everyone.

It's backed by the Czech UX Association, which is a local non-profit organization chapter of the ACM SIGCHI.

We are able to cover the cost for the space, but not for the food.

Eating is social

Barcamps should be social and the best way to network ever discovered is having a lunch together.

That's why we would like to provide lunch for every attendee, so people don't need to go hunting outside, alone in the cold.

Imagine, there is lunch!

We believe, that by feeding event attendees, we will improve their well being, support friendship and universal understanding and thus contribute to the World Peace.

Please, contribute!

If you plan to attend, or if you are simply touched by the destiny of these starving geeks then please, contribute.

Every dollar counts and as old Chinese saying goes - empty stomach is like nails in your sandals. It causes bad user experience.

Thank you very much.

story:
Our Story

Leading the Energy Transition, Sprouting Green Opportunities (LET’S GO Chicago) developed out of a synergy between a youth garden program and the founding of a community house in Chicago in the summer of 2010.  In its initial year, the program taught twenty neighborhood children how to grow food in the front yard of a house owned by the United Church of Rogers Park while developing sustainability solutions for the property as a whole. The program is a joint effort between the church and local youth leaders, combining urban ministry with progressive work in environmental stewardship and social justice.


This summer,  we are expanding our program by partnering with Summer of Solutions, a national youth green economy leadership training, to build up the next generation of leaders to take on some of our hardest social, environmental, and economic problems. Our Chicago program will work toward this vision by launching several initiatives to transform the Rogers Park neighborhood of Chicago into a replicable model of urban sustainability. We will bring youth together to achieve this vision by engaging in creative whole systems thinking that embodies the topics of sustainability, prosperity, justice, and community. 


What's Happening in 2011

The youth garden program at United Church of Rogers Park will remain front and center in the summer of 2011, alongside new projects in home sustainability, renewable energy production, urban yard-sharing, and local movement building.  This year, we plan to teach up to 60 local children the basics of growing food from seed to harvest and bringing the results into the classroom for hands-on cooking and nutrition classes. Your donation today will help us achieve these goals by providing resources to purchase equipment and supplies, offer stipends to local youth participants, and support the budgets of our other project areas.

In addition to the children’s garden, our team will develop and execute projects that:

  • Develop the church house as an outreach center that models urban sustainability
  • Promote local bicycle culture
  • Explore small-scale renewable energy opportunities
  • Build a network of local groups and community members working for sustainable change in Rogers Park

The Impact

Summer of Solutions offers our participants a unique way of learning that moves beyond the static classroom to a learn-by-doing model which offers life changing experiences and creates concrete results that benefit the individual, the environment, and the entire neighborhood while creating an inspiring model of the change that is possible.

This summer our program will:

  • Train Emerging Leaders: We teach transformative and career-building methods in community organizing and social entrepreneurship that help youth leaders create sustained and systemic change. We create competence in these skills through implementation.
  • Build Transformative Learning Communities: We grow from the  experiences we share with our fellow leaders. Our collaborative ventures encourage reciprocal, team-based problem solving and bring together unlikely partners to create solutions together.
  • Achieve Concrete Results: We develop projects that will take measurable steps towards the creation of the green economy and have real benefits for the communities we work with. Successful initiatives will lay the foundation for dramatically higher-quality and broader-scale efforts.
  • Create the Models: We launch community-based green economy initiatives in communities nationwide that serve as innovative models to be shared and replicated.
  • Share the Vision: We share our stories with the world to advance a vision of concrete and scalable solutions that catalyze grassroots leaders to transform the political, economic, and cultural landscape of the green economy.
  • Adapt the Process: We capture, evaluate, share, and adapt the processes we use so as to assist new solutions by ourselves and others.

What We Need & What You Get

Our $5,000 fundraising goal will help us run our summer program and ensure that opportunities to participate are available to all youth, regardless of financial need. Here is how the funding breaks down:

  • $3,000 Need-based stipends to offer (3) fellowships to local high school youth
  • $1,000 Seed money to buy equipment and supplies for our children's garden program
  • $1,000 Rent support to allow participants to dedicate their summer to our project

Any money generated beyond our $5,000 goal will go toward supporting our participants' cost-of-living expenses during the summer program and providing seed money for project groups. Full-time participants are expected to contribute 40 hours/week to the program. We think they at least deserve a free place to live and food on the table.

To verify that your money is going to the right place, we will be sure to keep you up to speed on our projects through the following channels:
  • Bi-monthly electronic newsletter sent to all donors (with the option to opt-out)
  • Frequently updated blog site (link forthcoming)
  • A thorough end of the summer report detailing the outcomes and successes of our program in each program area

Local donors are also encouraged to get in touch with us at SoS.Chicago.2011@gmail.com to schedule a tour or site visit. We would love to show you what we're up to!

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate your support of this campaign! If you know others who would get excited about this work, please use the share buttons above to spread the word. You can share this link on Facebook, Twitter, via e-mail, or even call a friend to tell them why they should donate to Summer of Solutions - Chicago!

Apply to Be a Program Participant

We are accepting applications for program participants through April 24th. Go to http://www.grandaspirations.org/apply2sos to learn more!

story:
Our Story

My name is Adrienne Williams, Founder of Bi Social Network. We're on a two and a half year journey. In December 6, 2009, we started working on creating great content in entertainment and news for the bi community. In 2010 the 'I Am Visible’ campaign kicked off, where we highlighted the face of fear in biphobia, with the goal to stop it. Bi people connected and made a difference through that effort, and I’m grateful to those who contributed videos, songs, stories, and love, in order to make a difference.


Fast-forward to the end of 2011 and moving into 2012. We are in need of visible media that showcases entertainment and personal stories in grand niche fashion. This is why we want to be the first to embark on a special journey: a project to create a bi magazine called "Bi Social".

Many have been emailing us and asking for such a product, but, to be fair, we need support from the community and allies if we are to make this dream a reality. Help us raise the funds to pay for software, servers to house our growing data, and the services of the many people who will help make this project a reality. We have seven writers on board right now, who cover entertainment, arts, politics, news and social issues. We've been doing this for a couple of years, and want to continue with our community's help, but now we know it takes people to really believe in the dream.

Help us get this project off the ground and you will have in your hands (or Android) a great product to read, on your favorite device or computer. We'll be rolling out the mag for the iPad, Android, Nook and PDF. We will have some special features in print. We want to do a run of 6 issues a year. We need your help! we know many want this product, so join us and help us succeed. 


The Impact

We already know that we have helped people all over the globe find a place where they can be themselves. Meeting others like them from the Netherlands to Iceland, from Canada to Scotland, here at home and beyond. We are touching lives, and we want to do even more. This project will bring great content to those of you who want it. You can carry your favored reader device and sit on the beach, read on the train or coffee shop.

If you help us make this a reality, we can keep on going, bringing great new ideas to the community. What better way to sponsor us on September 23 (Bi Pride Day) and beyond? Make a commitment as you move into 2012 with a sponsorship gift. 

What We Need & What You Get

Here are the hard facts:


  1. Our servers costs went up 70% last month. Yeah, the good news is that this means folks are coming back time and time again. The bad news is that this costs more money: about $200 a month, which makes $1,200 for 6-months. You can see why we need to make new products that you really want.
  2. Social Magazine - Indesign: Great idea right? Well, the only great software that has everything we need to do a brilliant job on the Bi Social magazine and ebooks is Indesign. It retails at between $800 to $1,200, but not only will the community love the results - we can't do the job without it. 
  3. Imagery and photographers: A mag can't run without great images and editorials on celebs. Hey, we have media access to movies, TV, etc, but this isn't enough. If we want real access to our favorite bi celebrity or artist, we have to pay to use any image of stars like Ann Paquin or Green Day's front man, Billie Joe Armstrong. Monthly fees have to multiplied by 6 to cover the 6 issues planned. With Bi Social mag in our store, we can make revenue to make even bigger things happen and give back to the greater good. The total expenditure on that comes to about $2,000 to $4,000. 


  • We need to attract a great designer and talented writers, so we can share the dream with those who want to help us with this project. Good talent works better with a little incentive. We are taking about a figure of around $6,000.
    We need reporting tools: a tripod, a camera, equipment. This would come to a total of around $1,000.
    We need to allow for miscellaneous expenses: promotions/marketing/advertising, things that are always needed in order to get a great product into the hands of everyone. This would come to a total of about $500.

    Whatever we get, will help us move another step towards our goal. We take what we have and invest it in what we can pay for, so that we can work another day... We're here for the long run. It's in our DNA.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can help through sponsoring us, then great, but we also need a little help in getting the word out. Share out links, add them to your blog or website, tell friends who believe in this project. Reach as many people as you can who can help us reach out goal! Please visit our website at www.bisocialnetwork.com to learn more, or shop at our store to help.

story:
THE 20TH ANNUAL THAI CULTURAL DAY

Witness and celebrate the art forms of Thailand in Hollywood, at the Barnsdall Art Park. Enjoy a day filled with Thai dancing, costumes, fashion shows, music, and art. Learn the folk dances taught to Thai children and see men and women demonstrating their skills at Thai kick boxing.

This is a fantastic family day atop Barnsdall Art Park which is home to the historic Frank Lloyd Wright Hollyhock House. It's Free to the public and brought to you by a generous grant from the Los Angeles Department of Cultural Affairs and hundreds of volunteers and contributors from the Thai community and friends.

The festival takes place on:
Sunday, September 16, 2012
from 11:00am-5:00pm
At:
Barnsdall Art Park
4800 Hollywood Boulevard
Los Angeles, CA 90027

Convenient parking is available across the street at Kaiser.
(*please park only in legal or clearly designated spaces to avoid tickets and/or towing)

Whether you can join us or not, a contribution from you will go a long way towards keeping this cultural treasure of Los Angeles alive. Please give and be a part of the day. Your contributions will be tax deductible as Thai Community Arts and Cultural Committee which puts on the event is a 501c3 organization.

story:
Our Project.

Our family has been growing organic seed and organic food on Wood Prairie Farm in Northern Maine for 36 years and we need your help to build an on-farm repair shop for maintaining our vintage equipment.

New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk!

Food Democracy Now! Limited Edition 'Farmers v. Monsanto' T-Shirt. FINAL End-of-Campaign-Markdown $50 Level.

New Perk! 'Farmers v. Monsanto' T-Shirt. Limited Edition Choice of XL, L, M, S.

New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk!

 

Our Organic Seed Farm.

     We are pioneers in growing organic food and organic seed for farmers and gardeners. Our isolated seed farm on the edge of the North Maine Woods is 115 acres, about half in farmland and the other half in woods. Over the years we've cleared the trees from 40 acres of cropland, constructed our home and many farm buildings, and dug two irrigation ponds. For 25 years we've sold our organic seed and food crops directly to folks like you in all fifty states through our mail order catalog and our website www.woodprairie.com. Our family makes our entire living from our certified organic farm. Everyone in the family has a big role in making our organic family farm successful.

Our Involvement in the Organic Community.

     In addition to our daily work of organic farming, we've always believed that it's our responsibility to help make our organic community strong and permanent. We have donated many thousands of hours over the last 30 years towards making Organic strong through our organic community volunteer work. We have been committed to helping transform organic family farming into a viable food system option. We've cooperated in on-farm research with scientists from the University of Maine and the USDA and this research has helped prove that organic farming is an effective alternative that is good for the land and good for the people.

     Jim was on the Organic Seed Alliance Board of Directors for seven hears including three years as President. During that time Jim helped create the Organic Seed Growers and Trade Association, established to protect and develop the organic seed trade. Jim is now President of OSGATA and OSGATA is lead plaintiff in the landmark organic community lawsuit, OSGATA et al v. Monsanto which is challenging the validity of Monsanto's GMO (Genetically Modified Organism) patents and seeking Court protection for family farmers from claims of patent infringement should Monsanto's GMO seed trespass onto our farms and contaminate our crops. You can find information about OSGATA et al v. Monsanto on our website www.woodprairie.com, on our Facebook wall and in our Seed Piece newsletters.

Support for organic family farmers in OSGATA et al v. Monsanto.

 

Our Need to Build a New Farm Equipment Repair Shop

     The organic seed and food crops we grow require plenty of specialized older equipment. As farmers we spend lots of time repairing farm equipment, keeping our tractors running and fabricating new machines. From growing up around and working on the farm equipment, Peter and Caleb, our oldest children are accomplished mechanics and have earned the responsibility of doing most of our equipment repairs. 

     We need a farm equipment repair shop so the boys can safely do their repair work anytime including in wet weather and during our long Maine winters. We've worked out a budget and it means raising $32,000 through Indiegogo to buy the materials for the repair shop. Like we always do, we will perform the construction work itself.

Peter Gerritsen, Wood Prairie Farm welder. Peter won the State of Maine Future Farmers of America (FFA) welding competition in 2008.

 

We need your help to build our on farm repair shop!

     This year will be the first phase. The repair shop will be a 30 foot by 70 foot metal building on concrete slab with radiant floor wood heat. The $32,000 will allow us to do the site work, pour the slab, construct and button-up the building shell, and begin using the shop. Future phases will allow us to add things like the large garage doors and the insulation. But the important point is that with your Indiegogo Project help we'll get our shop built and operating this year.

     We're grateful for your support of our family and Wood Prairie Farm. Thanks so much!

Jim & Megan Gerritsen & Family

Wood Prairie Farm

Bridgewater, Maine

* Utne Reader. Nov 2011. “Jim Gerritsen Named 2011 Visionary.”

* New York Times. Dec 2011.  “A Maine Farmer Speaks to Wall Street.”

* Occupy Farmers March NYC. Dec 2011. “We are Farmers. We Feed the People.”

* Farmer Solidarity Rally NYC. Jan 2012. “I Stand with Farmers vs. Monsanto.”

* Public Patent Foundation. Mar 2012. “Jim Gerritsen Discusses Lawsuit on PBS.”

* Lottie Hedley Photography.  “Rural Harvest”

* Slow Food Terra Madre, Italy. Oct 2006. “The Potato Culture of Aroostook County.”

* Atlantic Monthly. Sept 2002. “Maine Certified. The Potatoes of September.” 

* Farm Aid. Jan 2012. "Farm Hero: Jim Gerritsen"

* UNH Sustainable Stories. May 2012. “An Organic Advocate for the Family Farm.”

* NE Potato Tech Forum. UMO. March 2012. “Growing Organic Seed Potatoes.”

* MedicineCrow Blog. Feb 2012. "Jim Gerritsen of OSGATA Interview by David Crow.”

* Wake Up World. May 2012.  “Organic Farmers vs. Monsanto: Appeal Filed!”

* Portland Press Herald.  Nov 2011.  “Maine Farmer Heads Challenge.”

Film made with the help of our friends Nick & Nick at No Umbrella Media.

 

Review of Indiegogo Perks.

We would be grateful if you would support our Indiegogo Farm Repair Shop project. We've put together a collection of Wood Prairie Farm perks that we'd like to share with you in more detail. Thanks!

 

 
Wood Prairie Farm Sweet Cider Label. 

Thirty-year-old heritage color Wood Prairie Farm Sweet Cider label (4” x 4”) designed in the fruit-crate label art tradition.

 

 
Historical Wood Prairie Farm Potato Postcard Set.

A collection of twenty-two of our original fruit-crate-label-inspired Wood Prairie Farm Potato Postcards including the rare Kerry Blue and Ozette Fingerling.

 

 
Vintage Wood Prairie Farm Chantenay Carrot Poster.

Beautiful Wood Prairie Farm Chantenay Carrot poster (10” x 15”) in fruit-crate label style on heavy cardstock with green motif.

 

 
Organic Wood Prairie Farm T-Shirt.

High quality unbleached organic cotton t-shirt. Left breast printed with full color Wood Prairie Farm logo. Choice of XL, L, M, S.

 

 
Personalized Wood Prairie Farm Metal Art Wall Hanging.  

After our Kickstarter Farm Repair Shop is built, our boys Peter and Caleb will personally fabricate for you, by a process involving welding and grinding, a hand made original 3” x 9” solid metal wall hanging (or paper weight) emblazoned with your name (maximum seven characters) and ‘[Heart] Wood Prairie Farm.

 

 
Organic Wood Prairie Farm Container Gardening Kit.

Grow anywhere Container Gardening Kit includes two (2) 15-gallon fabric Smart Pots, the book Window Boxes by Cramer & Johnson, a heavy duty stainless steel trowel and an assortment of ten organic Wood Prairie Farm vegetable seed packet varieties well-adapted to container gardening including sweet Una Hartsock Plum Tomato and amazing Jimmy Nardello Sweet Red Pepper.

 

 
Choice of One Mounted Print from “Rural Harvest” Series by Photographer Lottie Hedley. 

Your choice of one black and white matted archival inkjet print (20” x 24” white mat with 15” x 10.5” image) from Lottie Hedley’s stark and powerful fifteen-image family farmer series “Rural Harvest” (http://www.lottiehedleyphotography.com/rural-harvest#0).

 

Choice of Two Mounted Prints from “Rural Harvest” Series by Photographer Lottie Hedley. 

Your choice of two black and white matted archival inkjet prints (each 20” x 24” white mat with 15” x 10.5” image) from Lottie Hedley’s family farmer series “Rural Harvest” (http://www.lottiehedleyphotography.com/rural-harvest#0)


 
Wood Prairie Farm Private Tour and By-the-Pond Organic Picnic for Six People plus “Rural Harvest” Mounted Print. 

Enjoy a half-day with the Gerritsen family on Wood Prairie Farm. Includes a private farm and Kickstarter Repair Shop tour and hay wagon ride, a momento: your choice of one black and white matted archival inkjet print (20” x 24” white mat with 15” x 10.5” image) from Lottie Hedley’s “Rural Harvest” series (http://www.lottiehedleyphotography.com/rural-harvest#0), and the day topped off with an organic Picnic-By-The Pond and campfire.

Personalized Keynote Presentation by Jim Gerritsen at Your Location.  

Wood Prairie Farm will cover travel expenses and Wood Prairie farmer Jim Gerritsen will journey to your location anywhere in the lower 48 states  (please add-on actual travel expenses for locations in Alaska, Hawaii, and Canada) and deliver a Keynote Speech at your conference or event.

 Whitewater Raft Trip Adventure on Maine's Penobscot River


     Spend a couple of days in northern Maine with the Gerritsen family.Package-for-six includes a private van tour of Aroostook County, Maine, plus a private farm and Kickstarter Repair Shop tour, hay wagon ride, organic Picnic-By-The-Pond and campfire.

     Plus two nights’ lodging in a modern A-frame cabin (with sauna and hot tub) at nearby Blaine Country Cabins.

     Plus one of the top outdoor adventures in the Eastern United States: a breathtaking all-day whitewater raft trip  (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qE6IaoHCJ1w&feature=related) with the Gerritsens on the West Branch of the Penobscot River near Katahdin.  Includes the services of a Registered Maine Raft Guide, Class V rapids, mid-day riverside dinner (salmon, steak, chicken or vegetarian), and professionally photographed DVD souvenir video of your  raft trip.

     Plus your choice of a black and white matted archival inkjet print (20” x 24” white mat with 15” x 10.5” image) from Lottie Hedley’s “Rural Harvest” family farm series (http://www.lottiehedleyphotography.com/rural-harvest#0)

How Indiegogo Works.

     Crowdfunding, of which Indiegogo is the world's leading platform, is a community-funded project incubator. It is a means by which a community comes together to support a worthy project.  Pledges are made by folks like you who want to see a project succeed.  Perks are offered to folks who contribute at different levels of support.  Minimum amounts are indicated for each perk, but you may pledge more than the minimum if you desire.

     There is an established deadline for the financial goal – in our case $32,000. Payment may be made by Paypal or credit card. Soon after our July deadline, we'll be in touch to make arrangements for you to receive your perks.

More Ways You Can Help Us on our Indiegogo Project!

     In addition to your pledge, you can help our Farm Repair Shop project succeed by clicking the Like button. This helps raise our 'gogofactor' ranking which can help channel major attention to our project.  Also please help us by spreading the word so that family and friends come to our Indiegogo Project in any of these ways:

- Please 'Like' us (Scroll above to Video Link)

- Friend us on Facebook.

- Post our Indiegogo Project on your Facebook Wall.

- Tweet about our Indiegogo Project.

- Post about our Indiegogo Project on your blog.

- Email our Indiegogo Project to your friends.

- Post about our Indiegogo Project on Reddit.

- Please tell everyone!  Thanks!
story_txt:
Our Project.
Our family has been growing organic seed and organic food on Wood Prairie Farm in Northern Maine for 36 years and we need your help to build an on-farm repair shop for maintaining our vintage equipment.
New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk!
Food Democracy Now! Limited Edition 'Farmers v. Monsanto' T-Shirt. FINAL End-of-Campaign-Markdown $50 Level.

New Perk! 'Farmers v. Monsanto' T-Shirt. Limited Edition Choice of XL, L, M, S.
New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk! New Perk!
 

Our Organic Seed Farm.
     We are pioneers in growing organic food and organic seed for farmers and gardeners. Our isolated seed farm on the edge of the North Maine Woods is 115 acres, about half in farmland and the other half in woods. Over the years we've cleared the trees from 40 acres of cropland, constructed our home and many farm buildings, and dug two irrigation ponds. For 25 years we've sold our organic seed and food crops directly to folks like you in all fifty states through our mail order catalog and our website www.woodprairie.com. Our family makes our entire living from our certified organic farm. Everyone in the family has a big role in making our organic family farm successful.
Our Involvement in the Organic Community.
     In addition to our daily work of organic farming, we've always believed that it's our responsibility to help make our organic community strong and permanent. We have donated many thousands of hours over the last 30 years towards making Organic strong through our organic community volunteer work. We have been committed to helping transform organic family farming into a viable food system option. We've cooperated in on-farm research with scientists from the University of Maine and the USDA and this research has helped prove that organic farming is an effective alternative that is good for the land and good for the people.
     Jim was on the Organic Seed Alliance Board of Directors for seven hears including three years as President. During that time Jim helped create the Organic Seed Growers and Trade Association, established to protect and develop the organic seed trade. Jim is now President of OSGATA and OSGATA is lead plaintiff in the landmark organic community lawsuit, OSGATA et al v. Monsanto which is challenging the validity of Monsanto's GMO (Genetically Modified Organism) patents and seeking Court protection for family farmers from claims of patent infringement should Monsanto's GMO seed trespass onto our farms and contaminate our crops. You can find information about OSGATA et al v. Monsanto on our website www.woodprairie.com, on our Facebook wall and in our Seed Piece newsletters.

Support for organic family farmers in OSGATA et al v. Monsanto.
 
Our Need to Build a New Farm Equipment Repair Shop
     The organic seed and food crops we grow require plenty of specialized older equipment. As farmers we spend lots of time repairing farm equipment, keeping our tractors running and fabricating new machines. From growing up around and working on the farm equipment, Peter and Caleb, our oldest children are accomplished mechanics and have earned the responsibility of doing most of our equipment repairs. 
     We need a farm equipment repair shop so the boys can safely do their repair work anytime including in wet weather and during our long Maine winters. We've worked out a budget and it means raising $32,000 through Indiegogo to buy the materials for the repair shop. Like we always do, we will perform the construction work itself.

Peter Gerritsen, Wood Prairie Farm welder. Peter won the State of Maine Future Farmers of America (FFA) welding competition in 2008.
 
We need your help to build our on farm repair shop! 
     This year will be the first phase. The repair shop will be a 30 foot by 70 foot metal building on concrete slab with radiant floor wood heat. The $32,000 will allow us to do the site work, pour the slab, construct and button-up the building shell, and begin using the shop. Future phases will allow us to add things like the large garage doors and the insulation. But the important point is that with your Indiegogo Project help we'll get our shop built and operating this year. 
     We're grateful for your support of our family and Wood Prairie Farm. Thanks so much!

Jim & Megan Gerritsen & Family
Wood Prairie Farm
Bridgewater, Maine

* New York Times. Dec 2011.  “A Maine Farmer Speaks to Wall Street.”
* Occupy Farmers March NYC. Dec 2011. “We are Farmers. We Feed the People.”

story:
We are a family run full service Alpaca farm.  Our farm is open to the public daily, free of charge.  We enjoy many visitors, from children groups, schools, churches, assistant living groups, and the Scouts. The Boy and Girl Scouts love to camp in our pastures.

We're dedicated to educating the community about Alpaca's and creating farm experiences for these many  visitors.  We raise , breed, shear, board Alpacas, and  rescue animals.  We market their fleece, yarn, roving, handmade Alpaca products and Alpaca plant food.

We support a CSA (Community Supported Agriculture program) where shares of our yearly Alpaca fleece harvest can be obtained.  Alpaca yarn is the softest known to mankind and is centuries old originally used only for royalty.  We make it accessible for current use and for everyone!  All support solely goes back to maintain the Alpaca's care and upkeep.  Which in turn helps us keep this sustainable product for the generations available.

Our funding project goal is $20,000 for maintaining and building additional shelters and a Veterinary medical room for the Alpaca's.  This will greatly help towards supporting the Alpaca herd which gives education and farm experiences back to the community.

Thank you for visiting with us, we also thank you in advance for supporting us in raising and caring for Alpaca's in order to educate our community and to continue the small farming way of life.

What You Get for your contribution

For every $25.00
You will receive three and a half ounces of beautiful alpaca yarns or rovings

For every $50.00
You will receive your choice of the following:
Seven ounces of beautiful alpaca yarns, or rovings, or a small Alpaca fleece Teddy Bear

For every $100.00
You will receive your choice of the following:
Fourteen ounces of beautiful Alpaca yarns or rovings, or a large Alpaca fleece Teddy Bear

For every $500.00
You will receive a beautiful handmade woven Alpaca shawl or throw and small Alpaca Teddy Bear

For every $1000.00
You will receive a beautiful handmade woven Alpaca shawl or throw and a weekend at the Alpaca farm, and a large Alpaca Teddy Bear.

My family and I operate and run Chantilly Ridge Alpaca farm in beautiful Port Orange, just South of Daytona Beach, Florida

We are a full service farm.  We raise, breed, shear, board and sell Alpaca’s and rescue animals.  We market their fleece, yarns and rovings, handmade Alpaca products and Alpaca plant food.

Our farm is open to the public daily free of charge.  We enjoy many visitors from children, children’s groups, adults, schools, churches, assisted living groups and Scouts.  The Boy and Girl Scouts love to camp out in our pastures.  We are trying to educate the general public about the Alpaca way of life.

This year we are offering a CSA (Community Supported Agriculture) with shares of the 2012 yearly fleece harvest which consists of Alpaca fleece, yarns, and rovings.

We believe and are dedicated to working to maintain local farm ways and allowing the community to experience that.

story:
Right Brain Entertainment, the former employees of Mingles Bar and Grill, and the community of Lebanon, Ohio need your help to restore this local bar and open the charity based Right Brain PhilanthroPub. 

 

 

 Recently our local restaurant and bar, Mingles Bar and Grill, was sold to a new owner. All of the employees were fired, and everything changed. The new location was only open a month before being burglerized, and closed shortly after. The restaurant is now for sale, and we've decided to buy it. We hope to bring the bar and grill back to its former glory under a new name, Right Brain PhilanthroPub, centered around charitable practices. We're here to ask you for your help. Your contributions will go as a down-payment on the building and restaurant and help bring it back to the community. The owner has generously agreed to finance Right Brain Entertainment for the remaining total. All other funds raised above our goal will go to replacing stolen equipment and purchasing brewing equipment for the seven barrel brewhouse.

    The PhilanthroPub

 Right Brain Philanthropub is a brewpup in which half of all profit from food sales goes to local charities. We at Right Brain are community driven. We want to do our part to make Lebanon, Ohio and the Cincinnati/Dayton area a better place for everyone, and we need your help. Inculding the microbrewery, we hope to employ 15-20 well deserving people from the local community full time. The Right Brain PhilanthroPub will also be a venue for local artists of all variations. A stage will be forefront, for local artists and performers. This helps the performers expand their reach to the community and increases their future opportunities. Local art will be displayed and sold with proceeds going to the artist and a percentage to charity. There will be an annual Best of Show: Dish and Drink competition with winners getting a prize package and their Dish and/or Drink featured on the Menu. The Right Brain PhilanthroPub will be a venue for many different charity events and fundraisers, letting us help the community self-generate much needed funding. We will work with local farmers and businesses for product. All food will be cooked fresh daily. The menu will be health conscious and offer vegetarian options. Spent grain from the brewing process will be baked into fresh breads. Nothing will be wasted, as all unused product with be creatively canned and donated to local food dispensing shelters. We hope that all of these philanthropic practices, and others, will help perpetuate prosperity to the people in our local community.

 

    

Paintings by Jangel. Paintings like these are available with $500 and $2000 donation. 

 We at Right Brain feel that beer is art, and brewing an art-form. Ingredients displayed tastefully on a liquid canvas. From pale ales to double bocks, each displaying their own unique notes. As far as we're concerned, it's a mouth full of symphony. Recipes from traditional brews will go back through the roots and offer historic classical flavors. Abstract brews will push the boundaries of brewing and expand the perception of what beer can be. We do not know if Picasso drank beer, but if he did, we would want to brew it for him. 

 

 
 
 

Labels by artist Jason Williams.

 

Right Brain t-shirt received with $50 contribution. Right Brain Brewing Co. t-shirt received with $100 contribution.

 

Thank you for your support. Support from the public will help charity shy investors think differently about giving back. We hope that this is only the beginning of charity based for-profit businesses. The city of Lebanon, Ohio will be grateful. And we from Right Brain Entertainment, again, thank you. Your contribution will be helping people for years to come.

 

             Please tell your friends. 

 

    

 

 


All Right Brain Entertainment, LLC merchandise perks will be shipped out this year. All BSS perks will ship out as created. All other perks redeemable on location after opening. Art pieces distributed in order of contribution. Shipping available for paintings at additional cost upon request. Previews of select perks can be viewed in the gallery.

story:
Short Summary

                       To find out more - www.thehirelist.net/grow-us

Since the 2008 recession many people have lost their jobs in the US. So many people and their families have been affected. The numbers are staggering - to the tune of about half a million people every month!

We were all eventually affected and soon realized how difficult it is to find work. What we have in place isn't enough to help those who want to help themselves. We believe there is a better way to help people access employment opportunities. Through our own experiences as job seekers (employed and unemployed) we came up with the HIRE LIST - a place where businesses wanting to hire can find those people who are looking for employment opportunities.

The simplest way to explain the idea is that we post candidate profiles instead of posting jobs, and employers from anywhere in the US (and eventually the world) can see member's anonymous profile. The idea is simple - more employers can see your profile then you can send out resumes.

What We Need & How You Can Help

Here is what we need:

  • We need you to make a donation, big or small, it is greatly appreciated.
  • We need $191,000 to create 12 jobs across the US working for the Hire List (US citizens and permanent residents only).
  • We need $3,000 to develop the PAID subscription part of the website.

In return we will allocate you the PAID subscription when we have it developed on our website.

If you don't want to donate you can still join the free subscription or post jobs for free!

If we get more than the target amount, any extra will ALL go to hiring more people or converting part-time to full-time positions.

The Impact

We want to help break down the barriers to people finding work. Starting with us - we need the whole US community to help us hire up to 12 people. Here's how we are doing it:

  • we are hiring from 8 designated regions in the US. That means your donation will be contributing towards giving someone a job in your region (The Hire List has defined 8 regional areas for the purposes of hiring);
  • successful candidates will be working remotely and can remain in their designated region. That means the financial benefits will be staying in your regional community;
  • most importantly of all, your donation can be helping someone you know get a job;
  • final selection of successful candidates will be based on qualifications, competencies, applicable and/or relevant experience, and not any other factors.
  • for more details on the Social Media Marketing Associate position - click here

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to donate at this time you can still help by:

  • Joining the Hire Litst - its Free - Sign up
  • Using the Indiegogo share tools to tell your friends about what we are trying to do - top of page.
  • volunteering - we are always looking for volunteers and interns - so submit your resume at info@thehirelist.net

Thank You

The Hire List Team
