story:
I write as the Chief Executive Officer/Founder of Developing Our Community (DOC), operating within Ghana – West Africa. Developing Our Community (DOC) is a local Non Governmental Organization (NGO), that is looking forward to initiating developmental projects in four(4) important components which are; Health, Water, Plantation (Farms) and Education in various communities all over Ghana.

Objectives:

Health:

To make sure health issues are properly investigated, diagnosed and alleviated.

Water:

To create an environment where all individuals have access to clean drinking water.

Plantation:

Help generate employment and stable income.

Education:

Support the educational sector in such communities.

 Projects such as construction of water purification systems, establishment of farms, supply of health facilities, periodical health screening, construction of school buildings and educational supplies will be implemented in over 12 communities located in the Central Region. Communities such as; Ankaako, Ekura Kessim, Frami, Junkwa and Abrafuo will be our main targets.

However Ekura Kessim has been selected as the first community to be developed with a water purification system due to feedback obtained from survey.  

1)    Back Ground Information;

Ekura Kessim is a community located in the Central region of Ghana, approximately 18kilo meters away from the Kakum national park. Has a population of about 430 people of which women form about 57.7% of the population. The inhabitants engage in farming for a livelihood.

The Ekura Kessim community has no school building; children travel approximately 40minutes on foot and another 8 kilometres by bus to get to school. In addition to these, the community has no health post or clinic and all health related cases are treated in another community called Frami. They also lack a public toilet and majority of the people defecate freely in the bush and its surroundings.

In the midst of all these challenges, Ekura Kessim is faced with a serious water problem. They lack pipe born water or even a water borehole.This has compounded the problem of water borne and related diseases such as Skin diseases, Cholera and Typhoid. 

Lack of clean drinking water is a major problem in developing countries. Water-borne diseases are rampant in economically depressed rural areas because clean running water is simply not available.

Developing Our Community will need an amount of $80,922.00 to make this happen. 

Funds would be used for:

1. Geophysical Investigations and Borehole Drilling(Two Outlets)- $13,158.00

2. High Level Water Storage Tank Stand, Full Concrete - $30,000.00

3. 4000LPH (96,000LPD) Multimedia Water Treatment System - $22,895.00

4. 15KVA Generator Set - $14,869.00

If entire goal isn't reached funds would be diverted into the Health sector. We will run various health screening programs in various communities in the Central Region of Ghana.

 

2)    Nature and Level of Demand;

Based on the community need survey and individual household financial analysis, it was realized that, the most pressing need of the people is water and they are willing to pay for it through various supports such as willingness to release land for the project and also participate were necessary in the construction of the project.

 

3)    Objectives of the Project;

i)                    Performance Objective:

a)      Construction of a water purification system for Ekura Kessim community to provide good source of drinking water to the inhabitants.

b)      To train management staff to oversee the project after inauguration

c)      To educate the people of Ekura Kessim on the essence of good sanitation on their environment.

 

ii)                  Impact Objective Assessment:

a)      To provide them with good source of drinkable water after completion of the project.

b)      To reduce the impact of water borne diseases drastically and to improve their health conditions.

c)      To save woman and children from walking long distances in search of water and also minimize cost of expenses related to water purchase.

 

4)    Benefit of the Project;

When the project is carried out successfully, it will benefit the people of Ekura Kessim in the following ways;

i)                    It will provide clean purified water to the community.

ii)                  It will reduce the incidence of water borne diseases in the community by at least 90%.

iii)                It will reduce household expenditure on water.

iv)                It will improve conditions of sanitation in the community.

 

5)    Beneficiaries of the Project;

i)                    Primary beneficiaries will be the community members’ especially household individuals.

ii)                 Secondary beneficiaries will be surrounding villages such as Twapiasi, Onomakwaa, Fofredo.

 

6)    Economic  Worth of the Project;

 Cost effectiveness analysis is used to analyze the economic worth of the project. This is because, it is a socio-economic project and the benefits that will be derived from the project cannot be quantified in monetary terms. The project however will have a positive impact on the quality of life of the members of the community in the following ways;

i)                    Access to clean purified water for drinking and domestic activities.

ii)                  Improvement in standard of living of the people.

iii)                 Most importantly, improvement in academic performance since children will not walk long distances in search of water hence making them go to school early and healthy.

We require your assistance for this project and we believe in your ability to assist since you are so much into developmental activities.

Please support us also in spreading the word and make noise about DOC's campaign. With your help many lives would be saved.

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools. Thank you very much for your consideration.

Regards,

Rost Markus.

story:
Creating new designs in the Philadelphia studios

The Handcrafting Philosophy & A Sustainable Manufacturing Model

     Whether it's a simple T-shirt, a selvage apron, or a bath & body product, Butcher & Baker puts pride and craftsmanship into all of the provisions we create, because we believe that Better Ingredients make for Better Living. B&B was founded by a chef so we began with the simple idea of applying a chef's philosophy of focusing on composition, technique, and high-quality ingredients to everything we do. We wanted to make the absolute best products you could possibly make, and do them all here in America, while creating jobs and a sustainable manufacturing model. 

     The demand for our products has risen greatly, but we're still small - too small in fact. Our demand has outstripped our ability to keep up, and our ability to keep our customers supplied with the great products we make in a timely fashion. Now, we need to grow, which is a great thing because that is what we set out to do - to prove that manufacturing in America is still possible, and not only that, it can create jobs over and over again. We need your support to help us expand our equipment needs, increase our raw material supplies and hire more local staff. Thanks to your involvement our production capacity will increase with the addition of much needed equipment, and we'll be able to reach our full-potential and realize the goal of building a truly great American brand. As a creative way to bring all of this to your door, we will be launching new monthly Bento Boxes, full of creative and high-quality ingredients made right here in our shop. We will also be building an on-premise factory store so people like you can come and experience what American Made really means.

Go Behind the Scenes at B&B:


Here's are some of our rewards: 

The Portland Apron - Handmade in Philadelphia - Monogrammed on the chest pocket with your initials.

The Rockland Apron Reward: Handmade in Philadelphia and monogrammed on the chest pocket with your initials.

Here are a few more examples of Butcher & Baker goods.

Help Open The Factory Store

Talk about seeing the results of your support! With the addition of our new space and factory store, you'll be able to come and visit at any time and see the production process. If you like, you can watch as your favorite shirt is printed, your knife roll is monogramed, or your apron is sewn. We'll custom grind our highly-rated coffee for you (rated 93 points by Ken Davis), or even custom blend a soap that suits your soul (with advanced notice of course). The store will be an interactive space where you can shop, have tea or coffee, and talk to the craftsmen while they're working. When we succeed with our campaign, we'll ship your reward to you, or you can join us for a special celebratory event in the store to pick up your items. We look forward to meeting you. Really. 

What We Need

You. We need you and your friends. We also need fabric, machinery, printing ink, shelving, leather, thread, packing materials, supplies, and more supplies. Every penny will go to outfitting the store and improving on what we've already built. Thanks for everything!

Your Rewards!

story:
Dear Friend,

I am excited to announce that I will be traveling to Bolivia this July!  Sponsored by the President's Leadership Class at the University of Colorado, Boulder, I will be volunteering with various community development projects during my time with the Global Inquiry program!  At this time, I am looking for financial support to lessen the travel costs of my Bolivian experience.

Last summer I had the opportunity to head a research team of fellow CU Boulder students with the distinct mission of learning about the unique challenges faced in the various regions of Brazil.  With our findings, we helped to  create the Global Inquiry program that is in it's inaugural year this summer, running in 3 countries: Brazil, Bolivia & Uganda.  This program allows CU Boulder students within these 3 countries to identify & address social issues within their respective global communities and to further foster global partnerships to work toward effective and positive reforms in areas such as education, health and poverty.  I am incredibly blessed to have the opportunity to experience the result of our hard work last summer in Brazil by joining the Global Inquiry, Bolivia team this summer!

The Global Studies Residential Academic Program (G-RAP) at CU is providing a generous $1,250 sponsorship for this experience.   I also applied for a global grant through the Foundation for Global Scholars, but as the application process was highly competitive, I did not receive an award.  At this time I'm looking to raise an additional $1,000 cover the remaining costs including airfare while in country, lodging, and logistical fees.  For more details regarding our trip, please visit the website for our program: http://www.walkingtree.org/2014-plc-bolivia-pro...

The trip spans from July 3rd to July 30th: 

  * July 7th  - July 23rd     Community Development Projects in La Paz

      My specific projects for which I will be volunteering, include:

      Education: Teaching English - Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday  - 3           hours per day in the mornings

     Community: Book Club– Wednesday, Friday, Saturday – 3 hours per day in        the afternoons 

  * July 23rd - July 30th    In-Country Travel & Sight-Seeing 

The opportunity to grow further as a global leader is far too great to ignore. Upon graduation next May (2015), I hope to apply my degree in such a way that makes a positive social impact. My ultimate career goal is to work with international non-profit organizations to provide anthropological insight on pressing social issues as well as to offer my leadership skills in an organizational setting.  By building a culturally-versed background and beyond, I truly believe I will benefit greatly from this experience. 

Asking for money is never easy, but certain opportunities that serve to extend one's perspective and help to better understand -and hopefully improve- the world merit such action. 

If you are able, please give $10, $25, $50, $100 to help make this trip possible.  As I understand not everyone can donate financially, I kindly ask that you spread the word about my campaign. Publicity is a wonderful contribution and I would appreciate it dearly!

Thank you so very much for your generosity,

Ashley Clevenger

“The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.” - Eleanor Roosevelt

story:
What is it?

It's deodorant, it's caffeine, its caffeinated deodorant. We use an all natural deodarant formula aluminum free with 400 mg of pure caffeine. We have both male and female scents. Using aromatic essential oils we strive to keep you smelling fresh while energizing you throughout your day. So take the journey with us and let's make Alpha & Omega a household name.

Who we Are

We are Alpha&Omega, The Beginning to the End of your caffeinated energy needs from other sources.

My Name is Eugene Gomez/Co-Founder/Boss/Chosen one/The Creator and son of the most interesting man in the world. (Really)

Eugene's Bio: Lets see I am described as a selfie whore while driving, Forget texting and driving I take selfies while jiving to Hall and Oates. Right now I am feeling saucy cause I love designing for Alpha and Omega! I love to laugh and design. I do for the people by the people. If you look closely at the Declaration of Independence my signature is right under ole George himself.

Robert Perkins/Co-Founder/Stunt double for bad kung fu films/The Hobbit Killer.

Roberts Bio: Though he may look Hispanic he is indeed the Filipino Manny Paquio is always talking about. This sultan of swing is the coolest cat in town. Whether riding naked on his tractor or rollerblading to Lady Gaga he is a bonafide dedicated connoisseur of the intricacies of Fried Rice.  

Along with Chris Cortez/Co-Founder/Spokesman/Test Subject

Chris is the outgoing one of the group. He is multicultural and has been all around the world. He loves to dance, and sing, and can keep on going with the best of them. (He has been wearing Alpha & Omega Caffeinated Deodorant for months now, and loves the energetic boost he gets. Just watch and listen, this guy is full of energy.

Next we have Dan Mercer/almost did not make the cut because of these sunglasses (Get some Oakley's for god sakes) Founder-Contributor

Dan's Bio: Dan came late to the team because he insists on having his days off with some other guys. Don't let the mug shot fool you. He is actually Fluent in Chinese and drives a unicycle with two wheels...Don't call the FBI because They caught the uni bomber already and Dan is tired of the mistaken resemblance

We got a commercial with Lightsabers! What!!!!


Who We Are

We are Military Veterans/Police Officers who banded together to create a sustainable energy source and apparel for active people who need that pick me up when caffeine sources are not readily available.

  • We are passionate in what we do for the public and society. The Alpha&Omega team are dedicated and feel the same way. Our Deodorant is an all natural 
  • Aluminum Free product with a kick of CAFFEINE. We all put on Deodorant daily before the start of our day. Let Alpha and Omega help you with a little boost while staying fresh.  
  • Your contributions will help Alpha&Omega become a brand for not only deodorant but Apparel on equal footing with Affliction, Tapout and Underarmour. All the artwork you see are on our deodorants.  I know you like the artwork and guess what you will see our logo and art on clothing and posters. With your help you can be part of the Alpha&Omega Nation. 


What we need


  • We need your donation to help fund our venture. Ingredients and material is what it boils down to and Apparel is not cheap. We want to make Alpha and Omega an option for your caffeine needs and apparel. We also want to put clothes on your back that makes a statement, an expression of art and who you are and what you represent. 
  • We Got Perks Baby!!! let me show you. Also we got Tee Shirts to show! 

  • These things are a beaut let me tell you. You will have the girls or boys hootin and hollering with these sexy things on your back. As Cortez would say "GET IT!"

    Images below are some of the artwork Alpha and Omega are creating. Sexy!!! 

  • Also I got a coin design for you Alpha & Omega Fans out there. These coins are 1-100 and are going to those who donate 250.00 Check it out. 

  • Whoa these are military style Challenge coins folks the look great in the hand and even better on display. GET IT!!

  • I will try to upload new art for you guys so you have a smorgasbord to choose from and the latest is.....

  • Serenity. The One winged angel has descended from the heavens to be with his beloved defying his creator. Love has no limits when trying to reach your soul mate. 

The Virtruvian Man what can I say about this particular masterpiece... Volumes, Da Vinci did it I made him a masterpiece. Beats that old parchment paper look doesn't it.



The Impact

Any amount helps and all big things have small beginnings. Whether you donate $10 or $250 the contribution is greatly appreciated because you share our dream.

  • We are everyday blue collar Americans who wants to share our vision and product with you. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Word of mouth and sharing our videos help us reach our funding goal so if you got a facebook or Google+ you can share this link, anything helps. Thank you for your time from Alpha&Omega.
story_txt:
What is it?It's deodorant, it's caffeine, its caffeinated deodorant. We use an all natural deodarant formula aluminum free with 400 mg of pure caffeine. We have both male and female scents. Using aromatic essential oils we strive to keep you smelling fresh while energizing you throughout your day. So take the journey with us and let's make Alpha & Omega a household name.Who we AreWe are Alpha&Omega, The Beginning to the End of your caffeinated energy needs from other sources.My Name is Eugene Gomez/Co-Founder/Boss/Chosen one/The Creator and son of the most interesting man in the world. (Really)Eugene's Bio: Lets see I am described as a selfie whore while driving, Forget texting and driving I take selfies while jiving to Hall and Oates. Right now I am feeling saucy cause I love designing for Alpha and Omega! I love to laugh and design. I do for the people by the people. If you look closely at the Declaration of Independence my signature is right under ole George himself.Robert Perkins/Co-Founder/Stunt double for bad kung fu films/The Hobbit Killer.Roberts Bio: Though he may look Hispanic he is indeed the Filipino Manny Paquio is always talking about. This sultan of swing is the coolest cat in town. Whether riding naked on his tractor or rollerblading to Lady Gaga he is a bonafide dedicated connoisseur of the intricacies of Fried Rice.  Along with Chris Cortez/Co-Founder/Spokesman/Test SubjectChris is the outgoing one of the group. He is multicultural and has been all around the world. He loves to dance, and sing, and can keep on going with the best of them. (He has been wearing Alpha & Omega Caffeinated Deodorant for months now, and loves the energetic boost he gets. Just watch and listen, this guy is full of energy. Next we have Dan Mercer/almost did not make the cut because of these sunglasses (Get some Oakley's for god sakes) Founder-ContributorDan's Bio: Dan came late to the team because he insists on having his days off with some other guys. Don't let the mug shot fool you. He is actually Fluent in Chinese and drives a unicycle with two wheels...Don't call the FBI because They caught the uni bomber already and Dan is tired of the mistaken resemblanceWe got a commercial with Lightsabers! What!!!!Who We AreWe are Military Veterans/Police Officers who banded together to create a sustainable energy source and apparel for active people who need that pick me up when caffeine sources are not readily available.
We are passionate in what we do for the public and society. The Alpha&Omega team are dedicated and feel the same way. Our Deodorant is an all natural 
Aluminum Free product with a kick of CAFFEINE. We all put on Deodorant daily before the start of our day. Let Alpha and Omega help you with a little boost while staying fresh.  
Your contributions will help Alpha&Omega become a brand for not only deodorant but Apparel on equal footing with Affliction, Tapout and Underarmour. All the artwork you see are on our deodorants.  I know you like the artwork and guess what you will see our logo and art on clothing and posters. With your help you can be part of the Alpha&Omega Nation. 
What we need
We need your donation to help fund our venture. Ingredients and material is what it boils down to and Apparel is not cheap. We want to make Alpha and Omega an option for your caffeine needs and apparel. We also want to put clothes on your back that makes a statement, an expression of art and who you are and what you represent. 
We Got Perks Baby!!! let me show you. Also we got Tee Shirts to show! 

These things are a beaut let me tell you. You will have the girls or boys hootin and hollering with these sexy things on your back. As Cortez would say "GET IT!"Images below are some of the artwork Alpha and Omega are creating. Sexy!!! 

Also I got a coin design for you Alpha & Omega Fans out there. These coins are 1-100 and are going to those who donate 250.00 Check it out. 


Whoa these are military style Challenge coins folks the look great in the hand and even better on display. GET IT!!


I will try to upload new art for you guys so you have a smorgasbord to choose from and the latest is.....

Serenity. The One winged angel has descended from the heavens to be with his beloved defying his creator. Love has no limits when trying to reach your soul mate.

story:
Hi, this is Bud Ford of The Dulcimer Shop in Manitou Springs.
I am here today to ask your help, after 40 years in business The Dulcimer Shop has been put out of business by the Waldo Canyon flood.  Post flood we paid our employees rather than laying them off and didn't have enough left over to pay the taxes to the IRS due to decreased business.

In the past 40 years we have put on music festivals, sponsored and volunteered at the thanksgiving and Christmas dinners for 18 years and have brought countless hours of folk music and culture to the Pikes Peak Region.  As of December 31 we have ceased operations as a business and are under an IRS inventory and seizure. 

We now have $25,000 to come up with in 10 days or the IRS intends on seizing our inventory and wood machinery.  If The Dulcimer Shop has helped you in some way over the last 40 years please I have never had to ask like this but we need all the help possible.  Even one dollar makes a huge difference here.  Should this campaign work my intention is to distribute the shops inventory to those who have contributed here.

The Dulcimer Shop is done, however our woodshop is not and right now we are trying to stop the vintage wood mill machinery from being seized at pennies on the dollar.

All funds raised here will go directly to paying this IRS bill and everything helps.  Even if we can't reach the $25,000 goal it helps us to make the bill that much smaller.

If The Dulcimer Shop has ever had any impact on your life I would please ask you to consider contributing to this Campaign.

Please help us get the word out and send this to anyone you think might be willing to help, we only have 10 days until the IRS comes in so every second right now counts!

Even if you can't contribute please help spread the word, every little bit helps!

Thank you in advance, we have attempted to help our community for the last 40 years in multiple ways and hope that might come back here.

story:
Short Summary

This venture came at a time when I thought my job was, yet again, going to be consolidated to another location.  So over a cup of coffee and a small joke the idea was born.  By being able to purchase the bus and not finance it I will be able to invest more in the merchandise and marketing of the business.  This will create the client base needed for a profitable venture.

I am a professional woman looking to begin her journey from corporate USA to small business owner.  It will not be an overnight process but one that will be an adventure.  So far it has been nothing but positive feed back from all parties I have been associating with.  From my banker to the graphic designer, the attorney, hair dresser and tax man, all think the concept is set for success.

I have worked in a media sales function for 23 years talking about marketing, business campaigns and ad related topics.  I worked retail part time for a large family owned jewelry store in the northeast, and I have never been afraid of long days or weeks.


What We Need & What You Get

  • The total cost of the bus will run around $20,000. I am looking for a used shuttle bus that will cost about $10-12K.
  • A wrap will be applied to the bus which will spare the cost of painting it.  The wrap will include the logo, contact information and social media outlets.   You can all follow this bus @bikinibus for twitter.  The cost of a wrap will be $3-5K
  • The interior will need a build out.  The seats will be removed and resold, hopefully raising about $1,000.  A new floor, changing room, additional lighting and storage containers will need to go in.  Estimate cost $2K
  • A generator to run electricty during idle time will cost about $1,500.  
You will receive merchandise, sarong, hat or store credit along with a special Bikini Bus surprise.
If if the full amount is not raised, the money will go a long way in helping build out the bus.

The Impact

  • I am not claiming to change the world or save mankind.  I hope to bring small fashion designers, the ones the big box stores won't accept, into the retail market.  So much talent is out there I hope I can add another venue for them to work with.
  • I am reaching out to a local college with a merchandising and fashion program with the intent of having students design a collection and intern (paid) with the bus during the year.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot afford a monetary contribution to the bus I would greatly appreciate your support by "LIKE"ing on Facebook.com/bikinibus or following the bus on Twitter @bikinibus  If you are into instagram it is Bikini_Bus and I hope to have a retail store open soon at www.bikinibusnc.com

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and considering the Bikini Bus.

story:
Would you like to be part of a story from real life? The Association of Organized Women Biolley (ASOMOBI) is a member of the Conservation Community Association for Alternative and Rural Tourism, Costa Rica (ACTUAR), these women are experts in turning dreams into reality. Both organizations invite you to participate in the campaign "Rebuilding dreams, a grain for Biolley" to know the history of this visionary group of women and be part of history.

At the end of the nineties, an agricultural crisis risked families and communities in the buffer zone of La Amistad International Park in the Pacific sector, coffee prices (not processed) forced the men of the community to leave their communities in search of sources of income.

A group of concerned women for what happend and trying to eliminate elements of "machismo" created an organization to find economic alternatives to support their families. With much hard work they managed to create the first coffee microbeneficio (a processing plant that prepares the coffee for sales) and after it they find in the rural community tourism a complementary activity that help them to earn money in order to have benefits for their own families and communities, and as part of this project they built a rural lodge that was part of the services they offer to their travelers and that was part of their dream until an unexpected fire destroyed it.

We take extracts from hers words (taken ASOMOBI website) about how they built a new economic activity:

"Over time, the community and the region have experienced positive changes and La Amistad International Park is further recognized and visited, the demand for tourism services grew at different levels.
Everything was a process, first with support groups became the rural lodge, but began to see that customers began to arrive and we had to give them a good service, then a project was presented to a donor to condition the lodge that complies with policies governed by law to provide accommodation.
Declaration had been achieved and we were just steps to obtain the Certification for Sustainable Tourism; when the July 8, 2012 in the early morning fire ended with an effort of many years, Posada Rural Cerro Biolley was completely destroyed and with it the investment made with the support of groups and donors.
This has not only affected ASOMOBI as an organization, the impact was as follows:
• Decreased revenue generating tourism in more than 50%.
• People who were benefiting from that income are now jobless.
• It has reduced our operational capacity, because we do not have enough income to pay the minimum operating expenses.
• Production linkages fell, were weakened.
Although ASOMOBI is not the only one offering accommodation and food services through Posada as many of its members and community members offer them, the fact that Posada disappear reduced the influx of tourists and bundling, although it has been tried to overcome by establishing partnerships with the Hotel Palo Alto and strengthening of our partner enterprises to continue providing the service and conditioning Training Center as an office, living room and kitchen, has been difficult.


A few days after the fire ASOMOBI members began to make a drawing of the new lodge and a plan how they rebuild the dream of development for Biolley. They started the rebuilt of the lodge; stronger and bigger. In total ASOMOBI has mobilized more than 128,000 dollars and many helping hands. Right now the lodge is 20% of what it was before the fire, but the money resources are ended. 

ACTUAR looks with this campaign to get at least 6,000 USD dollars and volunteer work to finish the rural lodge and continue dreaming with the people.

“This is our story ... From that in less than 15 minutes a voracious fire was, we stand and we want to move forward for our families and people who still believe in us. Any support is welcome and helpful”.

Español:

Quieres ser parte de una historia de la vida real? La Asociación de Mujeres Organizadas de Biolley es miembro de la Asociación Comunitaria Conservacionista de Turismo Alternativo y Rural, estas mujeres son expertas en convertir sueños en realidad. Ambas organizaciones les invitamos a participar en la campaña “Reconstruyendo sueños, un granito por Biolley”  para conocer la historia de este visionario grupo de mujeres y ser parte de su historia.

A finales de los noventas una crisis agrícola puso en riesgo las familias y las comunidades de la zona de amortiguamiento del Parque Internacional La Amistad en el sector Pacífico. Los precios del café (no procesado) obligaron a que los hombres de la comunidad abandonaran sus comunidades en busca de fuentes de ingreso.

Un grupo de mujeres preocupadas y derrumbando elementos del machismo crearon una organización para buscar alternativas económicas. Con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo lograron crear el primer microbeneficio de café manejado por mujeres y un albergue para realizar actividades de turismo rural comunitario, agrícola y de conservación. Tomamos extractos de sus palabras (tomado página web de ASOMOBI) sobre como construyeron una nueva actividad económica y como un incendio afectó esta actividad.

“Con el transcurso del tiempo, la comunidad y la región han experimentado cambios positivos y el Parque Internacional La Amistad es aún más reconocido y visitado, la demanda por servicios turísticos creció en diferentes niveles.
Todo fue un proceso, primero con apoyo de grupos se hizo el albergue, pero se empezó a ver que empezaba a llegar clientes y teníamos que darles un buen servicio, entonces se presentó un proyecto a un donante para acondicionar el albergue que cumpla con las políticas que se rige por ley para ofrecer hospedaje.

Se había logrado la Declaratoria y estábamos a pocos pasos de obtener el Certificado de Sostenibilidad Turística; cuando el 8 de julio 2012 en horas de la madrugada un incendio acabó con un esfuerzo de muchos años, la Posada Rural Cerro Biolley quedó totalmente destruida y con ella la inversión hecha con apoyo de grupos y donantes.
Esto no solo ha afectado a ASOMOBI como organización, el impacto ha sido el siguiente:
• Disminuyó los ingresos que generaba el turismo en más de un 50%.
• Personas que se estaban beneficiando de ese ingreso ahora están sin trabajo.
• Se ha reducido nuestra capacidad operativa, porque no contamos con los ingresos suficientes para el pago de los gastos mínimos de operación.
• Encadenamientos productivos cayeron, se debilitaron.
Aunque ASOMOBI no es la única que ofrecía servicios de hospedaje y alimentación a través de la Posada ya que muchas de sus socias y personas de la comunidad los ofrecen, el hecho de que la Posada desapareciera redujo la afluencia de turistas y la venta de paquetes, aunque se ha tratado de solventar estableciendo alianzas con el Hotel Palo Alto y fortaleciendo los emprendimientos de nuestras socias para poder seguir brindando el servicio y acondicionando el Centro de Capacitación como oficina, sala y cocina, ha sido difícil.

Pocos días después del incendio  empezaron a realizar el dibujo del nuevo albergue y la forma en que reconstruirían este sueño de desarrollo para Biolley. El albergue se ha reconstruido, más fuerte y grande. En total  ASOMOBI ha logrado movilizar más de 70 millones de colones y muchas manos amigas y el albergue se encuentran a un 20% de su reconstrucción total, pero los recursos ya se han agotado. Esta campaña busca obtener al menos 3,000,000 de colones y trabajo voluntario para terminar de acondicionar el  albergue y reconstruir el sueño de un pueblo.

Esta es nuestra historia… De la que en menos de 15 minutos un voraz fuego se llevó, estamos de pie y queremos seguir hacia adelante por nuestras familias y las personas que siguen creyendo en nosotras. Cualquier apoyo será bienvenido y de mucha ayuda”.

story:
Short Summary

For the past ten years the name TiffanyDenise has been associated with: positive energy, motivation, inspiration and transformation. Today I want to invite each and everyone of you to be apart of my personal vision to create a more empowered world by making certain that the voice of inspiration reaches an audience of 2.5 million people by December 2016.  

ALLOW ME TO RE-INTRODUCE MYSELF (Jay-Z lol): “TiffanyDenise” Be Inspired Movement! The goal is: to reach at least 2.5 million people, inspiring the masses toward their greatest and highest possibility NOW!  

GOAL: $5,000

Reaching this goal will:

✔ pay for a professional content rich website, a one stop portal of inspiration 

✔ printing of books and marketing materials

✔ marketing and promotions of the "TiffanyDenise" brand to reach 

our 2.5 million goal 

  • I am excited to offer supporters of this campaign some unique perks such as special mentions during my live on air show, autographed copies of my book Simply Wisdom, "TiffanyDenise, Be Inspired T-Shirts" and two tickets to my first live event of 2015.
  • Remember the more you give the more we reach.  Let’s exceed our goal of $5,000 and create massive impact in the world!.

HOW WILL I INSPIRE 2.5 MILLION?

✔ With my radio show: “Sweet Success Sundaes” airing every Sunday from 1PM to 2PM EST on www.bondfireradio.com

✔ With the release of my book "Simply Wisdom: Creating the Life You Really Want in 7 Lessons" 

✔ With my video coaching series "COACHTEA" which includes enriched content for you take in and share with others. 

 

With all that said, its time to take this vision to the next phase.  I need your help.  

The Impact

Ultimately this campaign, this movement is about sharing: me sharing what has been laid on my spirit to share and you sharing with others the morsels of wisdom and inspiration you have experienced.

  • Your support of inspirational content means you understand that empowering content can change lives
  • Many people are in need of inspiration, your support of this campaign allows me to reach them. I have a track record for this work, your contribution is in good hands
  • I have pledged my life's mission to assisting others in living their best life

Other Ways You Can Help

  • You can also contribute by sharing this campaign.
  • When sharing please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Let's inspire 2.5 million and be inspired to live our best lives.

story:
Livingston Pangburn Transgender Access Partnership (TAP) began one year ago.  With your help we have given 4 grants, so over 70 transgender and gender nonconforming young people took steps toward taking charge of their lives by improving their health physically and mentally, connecting with other transgender people in healthy and affirming friendships, and working toward educational goals that are essential to independence and self-advocacy.  That means 70 young people have a lower risk for self-harm and suicide, drug addiction, overdose, and HIV infection, and are less likely to be homeless, jobless.

Let’s work together to have another successful, life-affirming year.  Enjoy shopping the terrific incentives that have been donated.  Think BIG. 

Note about incentives/ "perks": donating by December 15 will ensure that your incentive(s) will reach you before the Christmas holiday. Greeting card sets will be shipped within a week of your order.

story:
Our Needs Far Exceed Our Goal.
Please Continue To Donate!

On the morning of November 6, 2012, Zayvier Barnes' life was tragically cut short in a car accident. Zayvier was a fourth grader in the Eleva-Strum School District.  

Those fortunate enough to be touched by Zayvier's zest for life experienced his genuine concern for others first-hand. In observance of one year since his passing, his family would like to do something positive; something he would be proud of.

This fund has been created in Zayvier's memory to provide for less fortunate children, advancing his legacy of caring and honoring his kind spirit. As Wisconsin's fall color gives way to snow and the holiday season, many kids and families in the Eleva-Strum area lack the resources to acquire food, clothing and other basic necessities.  

How Your Donation Makes A Difference

Our campaign operates on monetary donations. All funds raised toward our goal will be donated to the Eleva-Strum Community Support Network. The network's programs assist children in need with winter clothing items, offer weekend meals to needy kids and provide gifts during the holiday season for families facing economic hardship. If and when our goal is met, additional proceeds may be directed to the Eleva-Strum Intermediate School Playground Project in memory of Zayvier.

Honor Zayvier's Legacy & Help Your Community

Though we miss Zayvier each day, we continue to embrace his warm spirit and celebrate his legacy of care and compassion. Your donation helps ensure that every child in the Eleva-Strum School District has adequate winter clothing, meets basic nutrition guidelines and is able to experience the joy of receiving a gift during the holiday season.

Spread The Word & Thank You

In addition to donating, you can help by sharing this campaign with your family and friends via email or social media. Every donation makes a difference. Small and large alike, we appreciate them all. 

Thank you for your prayers and generosity,

The Family of Zayvier Barnes

story:
I am a United States Army Veteran of 18 years, an avid hunter and outdoors-man.  Hunting and the outdoors is in my blood, I have been doing it all my life.  I enjoy passing down the skills, and respect of nature to new generations.  I want to use my skills to help feed those that are less fortunate than me. I just need some help from kindhearted people whom are tired of our children going hungry.

Our campaign "Help Me Give Hunger the Shaft!!", is to help raise awareness for a great cause and to raise money to fund hunting trips in Texas.  Any game taken will be donated to the Hunters for the Hungry program in the state. Venison is a renewable resource that should be used to help feed the hungry.

There is an epidemic here in Texas and around the world, children going hungry.  According to the USDA, 18.4% of Texas households (or one in five) experience “food insecurity.”  An estimated 1.8 million Texas children or 27.1% (one in four) live in these households. Texas ranks among the top twelve states in terms of its food insecurity rate, and second in terms of the number of food insecure households.

We are looking to raise at least $1500, which will be used for a few hunting trips for me to go on in the state of Texas.  Some of the money will go to land owners for the use of their land,  and lodging, some will go to have the meat processed and packaged for delivery to the food banks (under the program rules, all game must be processed and packaged by a licensed meat processor).  None of the money will be used for personal equipment I have the equipment I need.

I will be filming each hunt that I get to do; copies of the video will be available for contributors of $5.00 or more that want them (Gopro video digitally sent).  For all donations of $15.00 or more there will be a personalized certificate of appreciation.  For donations of $25.00 there will be a custom screen-printed T-shirt.  There will be 10 personalized plaques for donations of $50.00 and 5 personalized glass awards for contributions of $100.00

If we do not reach our entire goal any funds raised will be used for as many hunts as possible, and the rest will be donated to food banks around the state.

Of course there may be a few obstacles to overcome such as:  no game presenting itself for a clean and humane kill.  There of course is always the possibility of hunter failure (missed shots).  One worry is not weather, I will hunt in heat, cold, rain and wind; pretty much whatever it takes to get the job done.

I have been hunting all my life; I practice with my bow approximately 10 hours a week. I have been shooting a bow for 20+ years.  My military background, hunting skills, respect for nature and desire to help feed the hungry gives me not only the drive but the passion to be successful.

We know that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you  can't help:

Do us a favor and spread the word and make some noise about this campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools! Share it on your social media, anything and everything is appreciated.

Thank you for taking the time to look at our campaign, and for any contribution you are able to make be it monetary or just spreading the word.

story:
Short Summary

Mamma Mia! is currently in Bogota, Colombia and before we leave this beautiful country I wanted to find an organization to donate to, specifically one that would benefit children. One local orphanage is giving me the opportunity to visit, deliver items they are in need of, and spend time with the children. I couldn't feel any luckier to be allowed this visit!

What They Need

They are most in need of:

  • Items for infants (bottles, teething rings, diapers, etc)
  • Supplies for their kindergarten program (pencils, paper, etc)
  • Arts and crafts for the older children 
Most of all they need money to support their foundation which has placed over 9,000 children in happy, loving homes. 
I will be purchasing these items and bringing as much as I can to the orphanage when I visit next week!

story:
Short Summary

This year I have been presented with one of the most amazing opportunities, scary but amazing. Throughout my life I've been a devout Christian, but for the first time I've been given a chance to spread the gospel in a part of the world that really needs it.

I have been anxiously planning this mission trip for a few weeks now and I will be leaving October 10 to Niddrie, Scotland, which is near Edinburgh. We will be helping the people, mainly children, in the schemes, and working with people who plant churches in these areas. Schemes are areas with community homes given to the poor by the government. Poverty runs free in these areas and they need help. In this week we will also be going to a youth camp and helping out there. The kids going are preteens and there will only be a few, but this is a chance to get to know them even more personally.

I'm reaching out because I want to give you the same opportunity to be a part of spreading the gospel and God's love throughout the world.

What We Need & What You Get

I need to raise $2,000 by the time the trip comes around. So far I have raised about $900, and any donation or help fundraising would be greatly appreciated.

This money helps pay for my plane ticket, it supports the people who will be hosting me and my mission team, and it supports Niddrie Community Church in holding their first ever youth camp!

As a thank you for donating, I would be willing to draw or paint something for you, as long as you tell me what it is you want. You can contact me at sarahdejesus77@gmail.com

Even if I don't reach my goal, the money will still go towards the mission trip.

Risks & Challenges

I have barely a week to reach my goal, so that's the biggest challenge. Any amount of money will help and be appreciated.

Other Ways You Can Help

Pray for me!! This would be my first time out of the country, so I'm a bit nervous but I'm also excited. Pray also for safety for me and my whole team and that we will see God work in us and the people around us.

Spread the word about this campaign! The more people that know, the better.

Thank you so much!

story:
Who are we?

My partner (Andy) and I have worked in the tourism industry for over a decade. Last year we embarked on an extensive tour through India (which was incredible, we highly recommend it), and were lucky enough to have Mann as our personal driver (pictured with us above). Even though we thought we had seen it all in our experiences in tourism, India was eye opening for us. Our driver Mann was a prime example - he is possibly one of the most generous and genuine people we have ever met, and he taught us a lot on our travels.

Unfortunately, in India, someone like Mann who is caring and highly intelligent, well read and personable, is limited in their future opportunities - For many reasons including family commitments, beauracracy, and lack of funds. He works incredibly long hours, conditions are challenging, and there is no such thing as sick pay, holidays or much opportunity for change. You work, or your family suffer. Mann doesn't see much of his famiy as he works as much as he can to provide, but he is 100% committed to ensuring they have what they need.

We have kept in touch with Mann since we left India, and he has informed us that due to decrease in tourism (low season) he is out of work for 4 months. This is of course very worrying as he has a family to support and no way to make an income at this moment in time.

That is where you come in....

What are our goals?

We aim to raise $USD1000 or as close as we can get to this, to assist Mann in providing for his family for the time he is out of work. A little goes a long way in India, and what is small change to you - could feed his family for a whole day. We will gratefully accept any donations, and will ensure updates are posted with our progress and feedback from Mann himself. 

The world can be an ugly place, so please help us to help one genuine person and his family. It will make you feel warm inside, we promise.

story: Hey, My name is Kentrell Watkins born and raised in Chattanooga,Tn. I'm a proud father of 8, I have 6 of my own and 2 stepchildren.  I'm a Graphic Designer for the City of Chattanooga Youth and Family Development Department. I'm trying to raise funds for  my oldest daughter Keniah Watkins as she start on her AAU Basketball journey. Keniah has been playing basketball since she was able to pick up one.  I know how much support mean, so I try to do much as possible and be that person I wished I had when I was growing up. I was a victim when it came to lack of support or my mother doing it by her self, so funds wasn't always there. AAU gives the kids a better chance of getting into college unlike a high school just mainly play around the city. It would mean everything in the world to me to see my children succeed. I look back on my life and always say "if i had this, I should've did that" I want to give my kids a chance. Now days in life kids are easily lead the wrong way. Her Fees start at $450 then each tournament can run you anywhere from $300 to $400 depending on how you travel, hotel rooms, food and the cost of the tournament. Tournaments start in February and goes up to September, up to 2 tournaments a month. She will be locked in with this team to 2018.  My goal is $4000, you take $350 for each tournament and for 12 tournaments it's a total $4200. And if the goal is not reached the money will still go towards whatever it can pay for. In return of her contributors you will receive a Keniah Watkins AAU highlight tape and a framed autographed picture from Keniah Watkins with thanks to all help support her dream. If your not able to contribute tell a friend or use the indiegogo share tools. Take time to check out her first Highlight tape 2013 as an 8th grader. Keniah was awarded with All-County followed by All-Tournament. She lead the Wildcats to be crowned League Champions averaging 15 points a game with a season high of 24 points. Not to mention, Keniah Watkins is also a Honor Roll Student. Thanks to everyone!
